items.content:
Project Manager at Day Translations

Remote | International
  • Remote Worldwide
  • Full-Time
  • Operations – Translation

Day Translations is a global translation and interpreting company. We help improve worldwide communication through accurate, localized translations, interpretation services, and a wide variety of tailored language solutions for individuals, organizations, and businesses of all sizes.

About the Project Manager Position

Position type: Full-time
Location: Remote job (America, Europe, Middle East, Australia and Asia)

Day Translations seeks a qualified and hard-working Project Manager to support smooth management of translation and interpretation projects on a daily basis.

Job duties and responsibilities:

  • Analyze the consumption of translated content and work to drive better ROI
  • Coordinate all the project phases and efficiently predict the lifespan of all the stages of the project, through accomplishable deadlines
  • Adhere to applicable policies and procedures
  • Answer client queries thoroughly via chats, phone calls and emails in a timely manner
  • Reports activity in group chats and actively communicates with peers on tasks being worked on
  • Negotiate deadlines and rates with freelancers based on HR freelancer databases
  • Establish and maintain excellent relationships with freelancers globally
  • Monitor and control projects status
  • Manage project finances, including budgeting
  • Comply with relevant and applicable procedures
  • Perform quality checks at various stages of the process to ensure quality and accuracy (proofreading, final eye)
  • Handle freelancer queries

Requirements:

  • Experience in project management, business administration, and customer service,
  • University degree is preferred.
  • Advanced verbal and written communication skills in English (Native or C1) and fluency in a foreign language.
  • Strong organizational skills, including the ability to prioritize and multi-task;
  • Excellent cross-cultural and interpersonal communication skills;
  • Strong sense of professionalism and politeness.

Candidates should be prepared to take additional tests/interviews.

Apply for job

items.title: Shogun: Technical Project Manager
items.content:
Technical Project Manager

We are: 
Shogun, a powerful page builder platform for eCommerce stores, and we're on a mission to empower anyone to easily create high converting eCommerce pages, through a delightful product experience. We were in the Winter 2018 batch of Y-Combinator, we’re backed by Initialized Capital, and we have over 10,000 active paying clients.  

We need: 
A Technical Project Manager to help onboard new technical team members onto our software projects, work with our CTO to assign and oversee the daily tasks of technical team members, and assess human resources and project progress against deadlines.

Responsibilities:
- Work with our CTO and CEO to assess engineering team resources and set goals and timeline for the product roadmap
- Onboard and manage engineering candidates through paid trial periods
- Hold regular technical team meetings, along with the CTO, to determine progress and address any questions or challenges regarding projects
- Analyze, plan and develop requirements and standards in reference to scheduled projects
- Assign and oversee the daily tasks of technical personnel to ensure we're working toward established milestones
- Determine and define clear deliverables, roles and responsibilities for team members required for specific projects or initiatives
- Research and evaluate software technology vendors and weigh the cost/benefit analysis when making large purchases on behalf of the company
- Recruit and train exceptional employees to fulfill posted positions within the technical department
- Establish and implement training processes and strategies for technical personnel

Requirements:
- 2+ years experience with Technical Project Management experience
- 3+ years software engineering experience
- Deep understanding of engineering Project Management processes, strategies and methods
- Experience with technical project management software
- Excellent time management and organizational skills and experience establishing guidelines in these areas for others

We Use:
- Clubhouse
- Slack
- Notion

We offer:
- Competitive salary 
- Competitive equity 
- Benefits (Health and PTO) 
- A highly skilled and dedicated team that is fun to work with. 
- Remote work – We are a fully distributed team that works from anywhere with good internet.

items.title: LexBlog: Project Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=4}
items.content:
Project Manager

The Project Manager will own the discipline of project management at LexBlog and be responsible for planning and resource scheduling, scope management, assisting with backlog grooming and prioritization, and defining (and helping meet) acceptance criteria for product releases and iterations. The Project Manager will work closely with LexBlog’s talented design and development teams to help drive efficiency, organize concurrent projects, and release new features in a timely fashion.

Responsibilities

  • Maintain project schedule and prioritize tasks accordingly to meet release dates
  • Manage resource allocation and own timelines and release schedules
  • Collaborate with product owners to develop user stories and organize within a larger backlog
  • Communicate to internal stakeholders regarding project progress
  • Collaborate and coordinate between departments to aid in the introduction of new features or products
  • Update product documentation and provide training for cross-disciplinary teams
  • Identify trends within project lifecycle and leverage or resolve them to drive efficiency
  • Own “doneness” for individual tasks and releases
  • Perform testing and project post-mortem reviews of deployments and releases to ensure quality in both the product and process

Required Skills/Experience

  • Four-year undergraduate degree with technology or project management emphasis
  • Experience with WordPress and related web technologies
  • Experience with the software development lifecycle and various project methodologies
  • Demonstrated skills managing projects while interfacing with and expediting the work of technical teams
  • Gathering requirements and estimating hours/budget and prepare & maintain scopes
  • Experience with Jira and Google Suite

Preferred Skills/Experience

  • 2-5 years experience managing complex internet technology projects delivered to enterprise businesses
  • Working knowledge of HTML/CSS, PHP, MySQL, and JavaScript
  • Experience with New Relic and site reliability tools
  • Passionate about the open web, open source and empowering professionals to publish

Location

Remote, United States

Compensation

LexBlog offers a great benefit package, including medical, dental, vision, 401K, health club membership subsidy, work from anywhere, and Open PTO.

About LexBlog

LexBlog empowers lawyers to increase their visibility and accelerate business relationships through the Internet, primarily through blogging. With LexBlog’s help, legal professionals use their subject matter expertise to drive powerful Sales. The American Bar Association and other key industry organizations routinely cite LexBlog as the legal industry’s authority on social media marketing.

LexBlog has grown into the world’s largest collection of professional blogs with more than 23,000 authors providing a regularly updated flow of legal opinion and analysis.

items.title: Tortuga: General Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=6}
items.content:
General Manager

Tortuga is seeking a General Manager (GM) to help us make travel easier and more enjoyable.

As GM, you will be the first non-founder people manager at the company. This is a pivotal hire for us. Today, we are a flat team of 10 with everyone reporting to the co-founder and CEO. In the GM role, you will help to shape our organizational and communication structures and build out the next stage of the company. Our flat structure was initially a strength but is now a limiting factor to our growth. With your help, we will grow into a "team of teams" that is better equipped for future growth.

At Tortuga, we are building a remote, humane workplace. That’s how we think work should work. As the General Manager, you will influence that vision while helping your teammates do great work.

Tortuga is comprised of Players and Coaches. Individual contributors (ICs) are Players and “managers” are Coaches. This analogy would make you the Head Coach. Longer-term, as we develop teams within the company, you will become a Coach of Coaches.

A Coach’s role is to support Players, not to tell them what to do. You are not responsible for solving every problem. You are responsible for helping Players solve their own problems and for removing roadblocks so that Players can do their jobs well. You will enable Players to spend their time in deep work, not in meetings and administrative hell.

Tortuga is and will remain a Player-first company with a low Coach-to-Player ratio.

Your experience should include growing a company or line of business from 7 to 8 figures in revenue and having managed a team of 10+ people (not necessarily all direct reports).

The GM will work directly with Fred Perrotta, the co-founder and CEO of Tortuga.

===

Tortuga is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and encourage anyone who is interested in joining our team to apply for open roles, even if you aren't certain that you're qualified. For example, research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles if they don’t meet 100% of the qualifications.

Our top priority is hiring the right person for each role at Tortuga. So we want to hear from you.

===

MISSION
To lead Tortuga as the Head Coach. You will work closely with each team member and alongside Fred, the co-founder and CEO, to execute on our strategy. You will make the team greater than the sum of its parts.

OBJECTIVES
  • Grow Tortuga from 7 to 8 figures in sales while remaining bootstrapped
  • Meet or exceed forecasted sales while staying under budget
  • Build the next iteration (V4) of the company as we transition from a flat, siloed structure to a more scalable "team of teams"

STRENGTHS
  • Coaching: You empower others to be great at their roles. You are a Coach, not a manager. Coaches don’t solve problems; they help Players solve problems. Tortuga is a Player-first company.
  • The Right Ambition: The right ambition is ambition for the company, not for yourself. If Tortuga does well, you will do well. The opposite is not necessarily true. You should be able to work towards a common, company-wide goal even when you disagree with the strategy. Doing what is best for Tortuga and our customers is more important than getting your way.
  • Taking Initiative: Every company says that it wants to hire self-starters. Remote companies have no choice. You must take initiative and hold yourself accountable to a high standard of work. No one is looking over your shoulder or tracking every minute of your work. You will likely have more autonomy at Tortuga than at your previous jobs. If you can’t turn this freedom into results, you won’t be successful on a remote team.
  • Written Communication: Everyone on a remote team must be a strong writer. We have video calls and team retreats but communicate far more often in writing (Docs, Asana, email, Slack). You must be able to communicate clearly and concisely in writing.

DO NOT APPLY IF...
  • You aren’t excited about travel. Our team is passionate about the problems we work on every day and our mission of making travel easier and more enjoyable.
  • You want to spend your day in deep work. Coaches will have a manager's schedule, not a maker’s schedule.
  • You need the structure of working at a big company. We are a small, remote team. There is no HR department. If you need something done, you do it.
  • You need the credit. We’ve built a humble, “no ego” team and only intend to hire people who fit that mold.

REQUIREMENTS
You must be based in a North America-friendly time zone as nine tenths of our team is based in the US and Canada.

BENEFITS
  • Salary: Base pay is $140,000. At Tortuga, salaries are calculated by a formula, not by negotiation. The formula includes base pay with multipliers for job level and tenure (at Tortuga).
  • Work from Anywhere: Tortuga is 100% distributed. Decide where you work best, whether that's from home, a coffee shop, a co-working space, or another country. We will even pay for your coworking membership.
  • Team Retreats: Twice per year, we meet up to plan the future and to enjoy time together in person. Past retreats include Prague, New Orleans, Lisbon, and Montreal.
  • Unlimited Vacation: You decide how much of a break you need and when. Just promise to tell us about your trip when you get back.
  • Total Coverage: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance. We pay 100% of your premiums and 50% of your dependents' premiums.
  • Retirement Savings: Tortuga matches 100% of your contributions up to 4% of your salary.
  • Parental Leave: Take up to 12 weeks of paid parental leave.
  • Free Gear: All the bags and accessories you need for your future travels.

items.title: Vice President, Marketing
items.content:
Vice President, Marketing at ConvergeOne

Remote

Job Locations: Virtual Office | US-CO-Denver | US-NJ-Denville | US-MN-Bloomington | US-NY-New York | US-TX-Plano | US-GA-Atlanta | US-CA-Ontario

Position Type: Regular Full-Time

C1 Company Overview

ConvergeOne: 1 Contact, 1 Connection, 1 Choice

ConvergeOne is the foremost, single-source provider of advanced communications and data technology for business. That means if it’s digital, we connect our customers to it — from phone systems and hardware to computer networks, application development, managed solutions and more. And we’re 100% passionate with designing, implementing, managing and supporting our customers’ every need from end to end, so that they can focus on what they do best.

So, when it comes to joining a team of IT and communications technology pros who are empowered to do what they do best, your best choice — your #1 choice — is ConvergeOne.

Overview

The VP of Marketing is responsible for setting and executing the marketing strategy to drive revenue, lead strategic, proactive Field organization and Partner programs as well as event planning (both internal and external) and execution within the company. Drives creation of an aura around the ConvergeOne Brand that enhances team engagement and status as an employer of choice.

Responsibilities

Essential Functions:

  • Drives revenue through creation of sales and marketing programs to power the Field organization
  • Plans, organizes, and manages marketing activities for the organization
  • Develops and manages proactive Partner program
    • Manages an effective partner program that extends ConvergeOne’s capabilities, and contributes to revenue and GP growth
    • Ensures this program generates incremental MDF funding annually
  • Drives brand awareness to create an aura that enhances team engagement and status as an employer of choice
  • Develops effective, measurable, external communication programs, including:
    • Participates in conferences, national and international fairs and other marketing related events
    • Client satisfaction and surveys/input NPS Scores
  • Runs best in class internal and external events
    • Customer Summit
    • Sales Meeting
    • Leadership Council
    • Customer Advisory Council
  • Leads development of strategic presentations that leverage ConvergeOne’s story and capabilities
  • Assists with sales training and product launch

Qualifications

Required Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in marketing, business administration, economics, advertising, public relations or related field
  • 8 to 10 years of previous experience in sales, advertising or marketing leadership in a fast paced, professional environment

Desired/Preferred Qualifications:

  • Cloud marketing leadership experience
  • Experience with Hubspot, Microsoft Dynamics CRM, Google Analytics, Google Data Studio
  • Digital leadership, demonstrated effective digital campaigns
  • Experience leveraging social media, SEO, blogging, video blogging
  • Master’s degree in business or related field
  • Experience in leading the marketing/communications functions during merger, divestiture and acquisition/integrations
  • Experience in the technology or telecommunications industry

Additional Information

Work Environment

Ability to handle multiple priorities and demands in a fast-paced environment. This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.

Physical Environment
Physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by a team member to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this job.

Other Duties/Changes
This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of all duties, responsibilities or activities that are required of a team member for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. At any point in time, the essential functions and primary duties associated with this position will be the principal, major or most important duties, responsibilities and activities that the employee is expected to perform as determined and directed by ConvergeOne.

EEO Statement
ConvergeOne provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all team members and applicants for employment opportunities. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment, and all team members will be treated with respect to their employment, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status. For further details please view the Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP. http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm

Apply for job

items.title: Head of Commercial
items.content:
HEAD OF COMMERCIAL WORKING ALONGSIDE FOUNDERS TO CONTINUE OUR RAPID EXPANSION; MANAGE TEAM AND P&L WITH HUGE OPPORTUNITY TO GROW WITH THE BUSINESS.


 


ABOUT MOVEMEON


We’re a fast-growing, tech-enabled scale-up disrupting the world of recruitment. We were founded with the simple aim to make discovering great jobs easier.


Today Movemeon is used by over 37,000+ ex-consultant professionals and ~3,000 businesses. 125 professionals become members every week. We onboard ~2 new businesses every day to start hiring through us – for permanent and freelance jobs. We’re an international business and candidates have landed jobs in 100+ countries.


We’re looking for a Head of Commercial to join our team and play a critical role in our future growth.


 


THE TEAM


We’re a growing team of 20 who come from a variety of backgrounds – between us we have nine different nationalities! The founders – Nick and Rich – are both former McKinsey strategy consultants; others in the team have a mixture of prior start-up, consulting and corporate experience. University backgrounds include Oxford, Cambridge, Bocconi and others.


We’re a very open and close-knit team – we know how important it is that you enjoy working with your colleagues. As such, we prioritise getting to know each other outside of work with monthly team events and two international away trips every year. Over the past three years, we’ve travelled together to Barcelona, Seville, Brittany, Montenegro and Granada.


 


 


 


HEAD OF COMMERCIAL


The Head of Commercial reports into our two founders and co-CEOs and is responsible for leading our Growth and Success teams. This is a pivotal role for the business with a huge potential impact.


As Head of Commercial, you manage both the growth and success functions and the P&Ls of Freelance, France and Germany. You are responsible for driving improvements and strategic/ operational projects across all these teams.


The growth team is responsible for onboarding new businesses and increase loyalty with current clients, and is currently made up of 3 people. The success team, comprised of 4 people, is responsible for working with clients once they have posted – ensuring clients to get the most from the platform, and candidates hear back promptly.


 


THE KEY RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE HEAD OF COMMERCIAL ARE



  • Owning the overall commercial performance of the UK business, overseeing the day-to-day delivery

  • Managing key commercial and operational projects across the business (in functions and across P&Ls)

  • Keeping an eye on the numbers to identify high impact actions for the team, and helping the team to deliver against these; answering questions as they arise and supporting commercial decisions

  • Day-to-day management of the success team: bringing energy and understanding the detail using data and insight

  • Driving the Personal Development of your team, ensuring they’re growing and finding opportunities to develop

  • Providing a fortnightly commercial update to co-CEOs and helping to implement strategic/ operational changes


 


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR


We’re looking for someone with likely 4-8 years’ experience and is now looking for their next challenge.


Specifically, we’re looking for:



  • Inspirational team leader: someone who inspires others to do their best

  • A people’s person: someone who really cares about their team, wants to develop them, and who wants to be part of a close and open team

  • Detail-focused and organised: someone who likes being in the detail to understand how things work, and more typically why something isn’t working

  • Management experience: both managing people and managing projects

  • A do-er: someone who gets a tick out of operational delivery, and seeing their impact/ not just talking theoretically

  • Consulting knowledge/ experience: an understanding of the market will be really helpful in working with, and supporting the team in working with, senior PE, consulting and corporate clients

  • Experience of life in a start-up and business development experience will be helpful but not a prerequisite


 


ABOUT OUR OFFER


An opportunity to have a huge impact on a fast-growth business, whilst growing and developing a close-knit and open team.


Our offer includes:



  • Exciting business in a time of rapid growth

  • Start-up environment and ethos (i.e. we don’t do face time and we don’t do anything that doesn’t need to be done)

  • Respect for and encouragement of your own ideas and initiatives

  • Real responsibility

  • Fun, smart team

  • A sensible work-life balance (we leave the office by 6 pm every day and don’t work weekends)

  • Monthly team fun & annual away weeks (http://insight.movemeon.com/hiring-retaining/building-a-team/benefits-company-away-weeks)

  • An office in central SW London (we’re based near Vauxhall tube)

  • 25 days holiday + 2 extra days at Christmas

  • Competitive basic salary (experience dependent) & significant bonus related to metrics you can track and control

items.title: Project Manager
items.content:
Project Manager at SBG Technology Solutions

Remote

Summary

Title: Project Manager

ID: 2052

Location: Remote

Description

Project Manager

SBG Technology Solutions, Inc. (SBG) is growing and would like you to come and join our team!

SBG, a service-disabled veteran owned small business specializing in engineering, information technology, cyber-security, and training, is looking for a results-oriented Project Manager. We are seeking a highly motivated individual looking to join our rapidly growing company. The ideal candidate for this position is an experienced individual who is hard-working, with the ability to excel in a fast-paced government contractor environment and is someone who has a positive energetic attitude.

OVERVIEW:

The Project Manager will be part of the team supporting the Veteran Affairs (VA) Electronic Health Record Modernization (EHRM) program. This position is remote.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Supports Veterans Data Integration and Federation (VDIF) program manager in condensing many activities across multiple technical teams into a consistent story on progress and setbacks for senior leadership on a weekly basis (at minimum). This will include, for example, tracking and assigning actions, reporting program status to executive leadership, management of schedule, cost and risk across multiple technical teams supporting legacy Veterans Integrated System Technology Architecture (VistA) and Cerner integration between VA and Department of Defense (DoD) systems (such as Joint Legacy Viewer (JLV), Defense Medical Logistics Standard Support (DMLSS)) across the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) from design through deployment.
  • Designs and deploys techniques and patterns to defer risk, ability to conduct research and identify integration issues with minimal oversight (must be self-starter).
  • Improves knowledge management across the team through centralized action tracking in SharePoint and assigning staff to capture meeting notes and actions, etc.

Position Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Systems, Business or related scientific/technical discipline.
  • Minimum of 10 years of experience. Minimum of 8 years of additional relevant experience may be substituted for education.
  • Must be a U.S. Citizen, Permanent Resident, or EAD to obtain and maintain a Veteran Affairs Public Trust Clearance.

Preferred Skills and Experience:

  • Experience with supporting senior leaders with management of large projects; keeping team leads on track and focused (similar to a scrum master).
  • Proficient with Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.
  • Fast typing skills (50 words per minute or more helpful).
  • Experience supporting the Department of Veterans Affairs is highly desired.
Apply for job

items.title: VP Product // Cara Care
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=16, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
VP Product // Cara Care

Company: Cara Care

Tags:
  • Product Owner
  • product lead
  • product management

    • VP Product at Cara Care

    At Cara Care we are working towards our vision to empower individuals to live a healthier and happier life. To support every person in the world with a gastrointestinal disease, we are developing the first digital companion therapeutic for digestive health – Cara Care.

    Our cross functional product team is responsible for shaping the user experience and bringing our products to life bringing together the power of UX, UI, Data Science, Tech, Medicine, Business and Psychology.

    Starting immediately, we are looking for a VP Product to support us in our mission.

    Together with the founders you will set and deliver the product vision for Cara Care. This role includes leading a multi-faceted product including consumer, patient, practitioner and business partner experiences.

    What’s like to work with us

    We are an interdisciplinary team of doctors, designers and software engineers who all truly care about what we’re building and how it can help people. Our work is inspired by our patient’s journey and our actions are focused on impact and results. We thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced work environment, while appreciating what it means to be healthy and well.

    To learn a bit more about our motivation, our team and company, you can visit our career page: https://cara.care/careers

    What we’re looking for

    A group of your future teammates and stakeholders met to outline the key skills and behaviors we think will lead to success in this role:

    You’re a natural born facilitator and communicator who works closely with users and data to inform product plans and iteratively achieve business goals. You’re a proven team-builder and problem solver who understands how to deliver world-class products at a fast growing startup.

    You will own the product roadmap across all parts of the product. You will partner closely with our operations team including health coaches and physicians to develop experiences for patients that seamlessly blend human input with software.

    You…

    • Know and enable our users
    • Create a shared vision across stakeholders
    • Build teamwork through trusted relationships
    • Prioritize efficiently across a complex set of inputs
    • Have the ability to zoom in and out from details to strategy
    • Have the knowledge to build products in order to change the behaviour of our users
    • Know the drivers of our business and our unit economics
    • Security and privacy aware! You understand risks and best practice

    Responsibilities

    • Lead a thoughtful product strategy that balances consumer, medical, business, and technical priorities.
    • Clearly define and communicate what a winning consumer product looks like, rally teams to build it and iterate until we get it right.
    • Obsessively map the user journey and find creative ways to improve it; making it more delightful and responsive to the user’s needs.
    • Structure a product org around you that is designed for success and recruit a world-class team to help you execute our vision.
    • Find and use data to drive informed decisions, even with imperfect information.
    • Build consensus across our team, with external partners and our patients.
    • Demonstrate expert understanding of agile development practices, understanding how to train and optimize team members’ techniques.
    • Find and track the right OKRs/KPIs for our business to ensure efficient sustainable growth, engagement, satisfaction, and retention.
    • Consider and support all the customers of Cara Care — from patients to practitioners to business operations — as you create and manage our product roadmap.
    • Help build an aspirational consumer-facing healthcare brand that puts the patient first, and that redefines the standard digestive health treatments.

    Qualifications

    • 5-10+ years of senior product management work experience, a mix of early and mature stage company experience is a plus. Experience in digital health is a big plus
    • Demonstrated success in building and leading a high performance product team
    • Experience leading data-driven product strategies and roadmaps
    • Track record of building consumer-facing products that both delight the user and exceed their business objectives
    • Extreme proficiency in research, design, engineering and data analysis
    • Passion for your personal health and wellness and that of others
    • Languages: English is required

    In return, we will ensure you have:

    • Meaningful work – help people improve their lives
    • A vibrant team and a friendly working atmosphere
    • Ability to significantly influence the direction of our startup
    • Competitive salary with regularly salary reviews
    • Participate from our success: Equity options
    • 26 days holiday a year (plus public holidays)
    • The best equipment and setup to be productive
    • Flexible working hours. If you prefer early starts, late finishes or from time to time remote
    • Team events, weekly breakfasts and team drinks
    • A well-equipped office in the heart of Berlin with plenty of snacks, drinks, fresh fruit and a great espresso machine

    Next Steps

    1. We will review your application as quickly as possible and reply to you with next steps. If we haven’t selected your CV/LinkedIn profile please don’t let that put you off applying again. We get a lot of applications and sometimes it’s just not the right match. We always try, but often can’t provide you with individual feedback if we get many applications.
    2. If we move on to the next stage we will arrange a brief intro call where we can tell you more about us and chat through what you are looking for. We are also open to answer your questions about Cara Care. (Tip: Calls are better done in a quiet place, so please pick a time where you know you are going to be free.)
    3. After an interactive interview you will meet the team in person. If we both think that we should work together, we will make you an offer. We value your time and try to be as fast as possible to go through the process and will always provide you with feedback from any of our interview stages.

    At Cara Care we care about equal opportunities.

    Diversity is important to us. We need a team with all kinds of different perspectives, experiences and backgrounds. That’s why we’re committed to hiring people regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age or disability.

    We understand that applying for a new job takes a lot of work and we really value your time. Our team is looking forward to reading your application!

    Please visit fill out this form to start the application process:

    https://cara-app.typeform.com/to/yx7Zcz

    Apply for this position

items.title: Head of Customer Success
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
Our market leading hospitality API platform provides software and hardware companies with fast and secure access to data from hotels. Once integrated with the Impala API and after their initial pilots prove successful, it is of paramount importance to both Impala and those vendors that they're able to bring across their existing hotel customers onto Impala quickly and without friction.


This role focuses on account expansion rather than account retention and would suit someone with deep account expansion experience.


As Head of Customer Success at Impala, you'll:





  • Have responsibility for creating a playbook and overall strategy to help our hardware and software customers move across their hotels as quickly as possible.

  • Build the Customer Success organisation by hiring Customer Success Managers to work across key accounts.

  • Work with our Product teams to develop technical solutions that make the process of moving hotels across to Impala much quicker.

  • Handle our strategically important hardware, software and hotel accounts directly.

  • Report directly to the CCO.


What we're looking for:



  • Great communication skills, you must speak and write clearly.

  • Five years experience working within account expansion roles.

  • Experience leading Customer Success or Account Management teams.

  • Experience planning Customer Success or Account Management strategies from scratch.


What would make you stand out:



  • Experience with deeply technical products.

  • Experience within hospitality or travel technology.







About Impala



Impala is a team of eleven incredibly talented, helpful and outgoing individuals (plus one more modest individual that wrote this job post) based in London (with a remote engineering team). We’re a diverse team that puts building a great product and being happy at work as our two guiding principles. We're also very well funded by industry leading investors.


What we offer:



  • A competitive salary and equity based on experience.

  • Frequent socials.

  • Flexible working hours.

  • Time dedicated every Friday afternoon for personal projects, lightning talks and team events.

  • A monthly allowance for books and other educational materials.

  • The opportunity to work alongside a tight knit and driven team.


Where we differ is:



  • You'll be working in a company that puts professional development front and centre.

  • We'll listen to you. We're hiring you for your knowledge and experience and we intend to put that to work.

  • We have an incredible culture and community.

items.title: Business Development Director

items.content:
About us


ARWAY is an indoor navigation platform that uses augmented reality and voice guidance, enabled by machine learning to connect, inform, guide users and ensure building safety.


 


Our vision is to better enhance the lives of everyone by making context aware AR solutions an accessible part of every day reality. Location awareness is critical to realising AR’s full potential and remains at the heart of the tools we develop.


 


The tragedy of Grenfell Tower fire in the summer of 2017 motivated ARWAY’s founder, Baran Korkmaz, to initially design a prototype app to guide people to fire exits and point out safety equipment. 


 


In 2017, Baran’s early prototype ‘IMAREC’ won awards from the British Invention Show and The Big Bang Fair as well as gaining nationwide media coverage from Sky News, BBC, The Guardian. 


 


Fast forward to 2019: 


-We have completed 3 successful test-pilots including one of the worlds biggest hospitals and shopping malls. 


-We have established a global presence with clients from Qatar to Taiwan.


-Furthermore as proof of our value in the market, we have received an acquisition offer from a bigger player in the indoor location market.


We are confident that we will be creating bigger waves in the indoor location and augmented reality market by the end of this year.


 


About the role


We are urgently looking for an exceptionally passionate, driven, creative and organised individual to lead as the 'Head of Business’ position here at ARWAY. The central remit for the role is to define, design, develop and deliver our business further. Equity will be attributed based on the Slicing pie model.


 


Skills & Experience


We are looking for highly motivated individuals with an excellent attitude, ability to roll up their sleeves and hit the ground running, with the right skills, ambition, passion and personality to make a substantial impact on the future success of the business. All of the skills and experiences below are great to have but not all are essential.


-Experience in the AR/VR/MR industry


-Previous experience operating in a creative leadership, management or executive role


- Experience in hiring, managing and empowering top talent


- Understanding of budgets and business-planning


- Excellent communication skills


- Leadership and organisational abilities


- Strategic thinking


- Problem-solving aptitude


 


For more information:


Website: https://arway.app/


LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/arway


Twitter: https://twitter.com/arway_app

items.title: DockYard, Inc.: Sr. Project Manager
items.content:
Sr. Project Manager

Responsibilities:

  • Use extensive knowledge of multiple project management frameworks to stay flexible and pragmatic across client industries, needs, and contract types

  • Encourage and facilitate close collaboration and open, transparent communication within all-remote, cross-functional product teams

  • Facilitate all product phase iterations, including project planning, client demos, retrospectives, release planning, and maintaining a living backlog of prioritized work

  • Conduct product estimation sessions utilizing the methodology most suited for the project type and scope

  • Deliver regularly updated project plans to communicate design and implementation details to internal and external stakeholders

  • Monitor the project budget and estimates, working with your team to achieve maximum value within the approved spend

  • Utilize risk management best practices to predict, prevent, and mitigate risks to project, product, and relationship 

  • Collaborate with account management to identify areas of success, improvement, and opportunity -- as well as lean on your own emotional intelligence and client relationship-building expertise in the day to day

  • Enthusiastically contribute to the evolution of DockYard-wide processes and best practices

  • Rigorously remove impediments to encourage focus and flow for your team

Must Haves:

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in the software environment as a project manager or similar roll

  • Demonstrated experience with UX design, software development, and web technologies in a scrum or other Agile environment

  • Ability to patiently learn, contribute, and persuade within a strategically growing, small company environment

  • Proven experience with and in-depth understanding of team empowerment and servant leadership, and the skills to balance empathy with the art of delegation

  • Ability to deliver and receive transparent and constructive feedback 


Nice To Haves:

  • Experience in and affinity the agency or consultancy context

  • Experience developing and maintaining long-term client relationships

  • Experience managing projects with all-remote teams

  • Familiarity with GitHub or other common project management tools

DockYard is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity,  disability, political affiliation, personal appearance, pregnancy, family responsibilities, matriculation, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state, or local law.

This role is a U.S.-based remote position. This role is not eligible for visa sponsorship.

items.title: Project Manager- Contract- Tampa/Remote
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Vaco is looking for a Sr. Project/Program Manager for our client in Tampa. This person can sit remote but has to be local in the Tampa area to come onsite when needed.
** Experience with Project Online tool required**

General Description:
Responsible for developing and running the IT Program Management Capability with the objective of ensuring all projects are delivered using a 'best-practice' Project Delivery Approach within the agreed upon scope, time, cost and quality. This role is three fold, firstly overseeing the delivery of the organizations portfolio of projects, providing expert knowledge, support, and monitoring of progress and reporting on the programs status. Secondly, managing projects/programs directly. Finally, the development, introduction and on-going iteration of the organization's Project Delivery Approach. The role is expected to provide strong leadership in a matrix environment to promote best practices in managing interrelated projects and programs to ensure successful delivery. This role will also ensure project resources have the correct toolsets and processes in place and that all relevant staff are trained and equipped to deliver successfully.
Duties:
  • Leading large-scale, cross-departmental initiatives that have a high degree of technology requirements and enablement for the business.
  • Aligning, tracking, and ensuring proper execution of these programs as it relates to resource planning, business process changes, training, financial health, and operational readiness.
  • Communicating effectively with internal stakeholders so that senior executives, technology and business leaders as well as impacted staff feel as though they have adequate knowledge of milestones, progress and what is required of them.
  • Creating effective processes for end-to-end program delivery, addressing difficult conversations, building trust across the organization, recognizing and managing cross-initiative dependencies, properly managing risks and change, ensuring the program is aligned to desired outcomes.
  • As part of the program management office leadership, driving visibility and consistency of strategic initiatives in partnership with other Business leaders and program managers, which includes establishing and executing the next evolution of program management capabilities.
  • Working with multiple delivery teams to take ownership and accountability of technical project planning and delivery.
  • Develop trusted relationships with key technology and functional leaders & stakeholders to drive focus on the strategic program objectives and optimize program delivery. This includes supporting and holding resources accountable for their responsibilities within the program.
  • Translate business objectives into execution strategy (tactical and strategic), lead and successfully execute the strategy through strong collaboration and agile leadership.
  • Ensure data is collected to appropriately inform decision making for mitigating risks and resolving issues.
  • Utilize the agile mindset to create a collaborative environment that fosters autonomy, transparency, mastery, innovation, and learning; promotes continuous improvement.
  • Anticipate and aggressively remove obstacles that slow down or prevent programs from delivering on program objectives. Drive for clarity to keep teams moving forward.
  • Provide "go to" leadership, transparency, and visibility.
  • Seek to continuously grow by proactively seeking and embracing constructive feedback. Provide the same level of feedback to colleagues to encourage an open and collaborative culture.
  • Monitor and resolve end-to-end process for things like: repeating pain points/sticking points, blockers. Build plans and mitigations to address pain points to ensure the alacrity of the cloud and/or program.
  • Directs and guides a team in the operational, financial and strategic analysis of new and existing business opportunities and projects.
Work Experience and Educational Requirements:
  • 15+ years of strong technical program management and IT portfolio experience.
  • BA / BS degree in related field.
  • Proactive driver of complex, cross-functional technology programs.
  • Significant experience marrying a myriad of frameworks to select the right delivery approach (e.g. how are we looking at Agile, Waterfall, business requirement gathering in partnership with Product Management, working with the Organization Change Management team, etc.).
  • Thorough understanding of enterprise software development and infrastructure processes and lifecycle; ability to adjust and apply this knowledge in a dynamic environment using agile methodologies.
  • Adept at working with a globally distributed team and able to deliver with remote teams.
  • Outstanding organizational, communication, interpersonal, and relationship building skills conducive to collaboration; able to work well in a cross-functional, matrix management environment.
  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills with a history of hands-on, detail orientation.
  • Ability to establish credibility and rapport with senior executives and technical and non-technical team members alike.
  • Ability to successfully collaborate with multiple technical functions in the areas of infrastructure, technical operations, software engineering, and customer support.
  • Demonstrated capability working a robust project plan, managing resource capacity and budget against that plan.
  • Excellent organizational, technical writing, oral and interpersonal communication skills, and keen attention to detail.
  • Strong ability to prioritize and handle multiple initiatives in parallel as well as changing priorities.
  • Experience as a Product Manager and/or Product management a plus.
  • Experience as a Scrum Master (or equivalent experience with other agile methodologies).

items.title: Follow Up Boss: Director of Marketing
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)

items.content:
Director of Marketing

Follow Up Boss is at a unique point in our growth stage - we’ve been able to build a robust and strong product and brand that our customers are drawn to and align with (not to mention a profitable, self-funded company).  

Our strongest performing lead generator has historically been referrals from happy customers; our customer support and success are second-to-none.  While there is both direct and indirect competition in our space, we feel like we’re well-positioned as the real estate CRM leader and believe there is ample room for continued growth in the market.  
 
We’ve gotten to this point largely without any real “Marketing Engine” and believe we need to now add this as a primary focus for the business.  We feel that in order to achieve the growth targets we’ve set for the company it is imperative we actively promote and create awareness of the Follow Up Boss product and brand to the right customers (i.e. agencies and teams needing a CRM solution).  

Our focus has never been on outward promotion or brand positioning and we feel that needs to change and we need someone to own that process. 
 
We’re looking for someone who can develop and execute a strategic marketing plan consisting of aggressive demand generation programs, strategic product marketing and content plans, digital campaigns, event/experience initiatives, and comprehensive sales and partner enablement initiatives designed to deliver on revenue and growth targets - while important, we’re not looking for someone to focus on drip campaigns, on-boarding experience or incremental growth ideas.  We need someone who understands and can focus on the big picture, increasing the top of the funnel; someone who can help us be noticed, be seen and be found.
 
We don’t currently have a marketing team, so much of the work this role will entail is the practical day-to-day stuff.  We want someone who understands marketing analytics, can cut through the BS and help us focus on the right metrics and growth drivers.
 
We’re looking for someone to completely own this side of the business and lead the strategy and execution - we’re looking for an “A Player”: someone who’s done this before in a similar stage company, in a similar industry, with a similar product offering and price point.  
 
 
Who Is Follow Up Boss?
  • We’re a powerful, intuitive, sales-focused CRM for real estate teams (and we use our own product)
  • We’re a self-funded, profitable company started back in April of 2011
  • We’re a remote company with a mostly US-based team
  • We don’t just claim to be customer-centric - we live it: https://www.facebook.com/followupboss/reviews
  • Check out our video on how we work: https://www.followupboss.com/about/
 
Why Work With Us?
  • We’re a young, ambitious company who only answers to our customers
  • Opportunity to have a big impact on our growth and your career
  • 100% Remote 
  • Annual Team Retreats + mini-departmental retreats
  • Highly competitive salary
  • Best-in-class Benefits Package (Medical, Dental 100% premiums paid)
  • 4 Weeks PTO + Sick Leave + 8 Holidays
  • Parental Leave (12 wks primary caregiver / 6 wks secondary caregiver)
  • Home office upgrade stipend
  • Yearly money to spend on education and self-improvement
  • Fun perks like free coffee, birthday off and a monthly fitness stipend
 
Your responsibilities will include: 
  • Developing and executing a strategic marketing plan consisting of aggressive demand generation programs, strategic product marketing and content plans, digital campaigns, event/experience initiatives, and comprehensive sales and partner enablement initiatives designed to deliver on revenue and growth targets
  • Leading and driving investment in demand generation and ROI across all marketing channels
  • Growing and acquiring monthly free trials - successful past experience is a must!
  • Owning and leading the creation of marketing and communications strategies and tactics that build our brand visibility 
  • Taking risks - ideally, you are a big idea marketer who is capable of leading teams to develop new strategies and tactics to build our brand, drive traffic to the top of the funnel, resulting in high revenue growth targets
  • Ensuring marketing plans are developed in a highly collaborative manner with other key stakeholders
  • Translating the marketing plan into actionable quarterly targets and initiatives, keeping the team and budget on schedule
  • Continuous analysis of competitive environment and industry trends
  • Building marketing culture ruthlessly focused on customer experience and revenue, highly collaborative and cross-functional, and encourages transparent communication and constructive idea building and dialogue
 
Your qualifications:
  • Minimum experience of 5 years in B2B SaaS software marketing (experience in the real estate market a plus!)
  • Ability to grow and lead a small team but not just seeking a hands-off management role
  • Proven track record of creating and driving a marketing strategy that delivers on brand/product promises, creates engaging customer experiences, enables the sales process, and drives revenue growth
  • Collaborative by nature with proven effectiveness working with key internal stakeholders to shape and execute vision and strategy; can influence without authority
  • Possess a test and learn mentality
  • Experience as a member of a leadership team 
  • Strong creative, strategic, analytical, organizational and personal skillset
  • Experience owning improvement on a top of the funnel marketing strategy
  • Strong oral and written communications skills
  • Remote work experience is considered an asset.
  • Based in the USA; quiet home office with fast internet.
 
What our team thinks about working here (Glass Door reviews):
I have worked in the SaaS industry for almost 10 years and this is by far the best company I have ever worked for. The CEO and CTO truly have a passion for the customer and the industry they are in. The work environment is relaxed but the best is expected from each person. The company itself is remote and employees are spread throughout the United States (great perk!).
 
This is the first job I have had where I like going to work. The team is helpful and encouraging. We all have that dream list of ways we want management to treat us as employees and they go beyond that here. It the first time I have seen an owner care about his employee's. It directly translates to motivated and sharp team members.
 
It is great to see everyone excited at a company, where we have a focus on making something great for our customers and providing them with the best support possible.

items.title: Personal Assistant To Operations Manager
items.content:
Personal Assistant To Operations Manager at Fisico

Remote | Freelance | Part-time

We are looking for a highly driven self-learner to join our growing natural health company: nothing short of an A-player who thrives on success and feeds on progress.

I have created an intro video about us and this position. Please watch it first before reading on:

http://bit.ly/FisicoIntroVideo

Done watching?

Great…

As you’ve just learned in the video above, this is a unique opportunity to get on board with a team of very successful high performers in a booming boutique digital advertising agency.

What You’ll Be Doing:

You will work alongside the company executives to aid in their daily tasks. Experience in assisting is a plus. Specifically, you will be responsible for:

  • Taking over administrative tasks such as:
    • Screening emails and voicemails
    • Returning calls
    • Scheduling
    • Booking travel and accomodations
    • Raw materials and product freight arrangements
    • Assisting with screening new hires and preparing application packages for review
    • Preparations of various documents and forms
  • Serving as the operations manager’s right hand:
    • As you get integrated in the company’s day to day, you will be given more responsibilities to handle higher level functions.
    • In short, aside from a few daily repetitive tasks, you will be given various administrative duties and projects as needed to assist with the daily flow of the business.
    • In this position, you will learn a lot about operations and productivity. You will be given the high responsibility of representing our company and the management team.

A Little Bit More About Us…

The Boston-based company was founded in 2009 and has experienced hyper-growth year over year. We currently send millions of visitors each month to our various brand websites that sell information products and dietary supplements that change lives and dramatically improve people’s health.

Please be sure to check out our raving customer reviews on the Better Business Bureau (https://www.bbb.org/us/ma/westford/profile/marketing-consultant/fisico-inc-0021-165292).

As part of operations, I oversee the departments of Customer Support, Product Fulfillment, Accounting, Supply Chain, Research & Development, Marketing & Advertising, IT and Human Resource. While I do have managers and assistants at different roles, there is no part of the business that I am not involved with.

If you enjoy learning, project variety and the bustle and hustle that comes with business growth and success, this will be a very challenging and rewarding position.

Now, I have not worked with an assistant before and will need time to start delegating. For this reason, we are opening the position as part-time, a couple of hours a day at first, with the aim to transition to full-time as quickly as possible. The faster you get integrated and take on task and responsibilities, the faster we will be adding more hours. I work on a 9-5 EST scheduled and would need someone to match that. The position is remote and no travel is required. Also, not required is answering live calls. Although I would for you to work exclusively with me, to get integrated faster and add more hours quicker, you will also have the opportunity to assist the company CEO directly with many overlapping tasks.

Think you may be a right fit for the position? Then let us know by filling out the form below:

http://bit.ly/FisicoAssistant

Thank you for your interest in the position. We look forward to hearing from you.

Sincerely,

Violet Stoyneva

Operations Manager

Fisico Inc.

6 Lyberty Way, Suite 103

Westford, MA 01886

Apply for job

items.content:
Director of Marketing at Happy Tax Franchising

Remote

Company Overview

Happy Tax is the fastest growing tax preparation company three years in a row according to Entrepreneur Magazine. We operate multiple brands and websites including GetHappyTax.com, HappyTax.com, CryptoTaxPrep.com and CryptoTaxAcademy.com. What makes Happy Tax standout from other traditional tax preparation companies is we have patent pending technology that separates the front end from the back end of the tax preparation process. CPA’s focus on the tax preparation while franchisees and contractors take care of the initial sales. Happy Tax’s p technology and processes, gives customers a fresh new experience with none of the hassles traditionally associated with preparing their taxes, meeting them anytime, anywhere including house calls.

Job Summary

Work from home managing small department including Creative Director, Digital Marketing Ad Campaign Manager Implementer and Optimizer, Webmaster, Graphic Designer, Franchise Marketing Support and freelancers including, Digital video person and Motion video person. Some of those folks are already in our organization and some are being hired now which you can assist in. Must also have skills on web design and be proficient in creating great UX/UI for websites and app. Daily oversight to make sure we are continuing and accelerate our growth.

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Management, Oversight and Accountability over Dept
  • Franchise and Consumer UX/UI web/app design & development
  • Make sure marketing advertising is consistent, fresh and effective and growing the revenue for GetHappyTax.com, HappyTax.com, CryptoTaxPrep.com, CryptoTaxAcademy.com
  • Report results to CEO/Chairman on regular basis

Qualifications and Skills

  • HTML, javascript
  • Zapier and API’s
  • Search and Social Media Ads
  • Managing people
  • Working remotely from home with discipline
  • Working in a fast growing company and being a linchpin of growth

Benefits and Perks

  • Health Insurance or Stipend
  • W2 Employee
  • Stock Options

items.content:
Exam Program Manager at Unity Technologies

Remote | Freelance

Location: Remote

Unity is seeking an Exam Program Manager (contract) to support the Education Product team with Unity’s certification offerings for higher education (college/post-secondary) and professionals, building a certification that requires detailed research, development, and maintenance of the exam. Along with building, the Exam Program Manager is also always working on finding ways to improve the exam products at all times to consistently deliver value to our certified audience. You will be responsible to track the test development project, and milestones to launch and maintain the exam after launch. You will perform research, job task analysis workshops and exam question writing workshops.

You will enable Unity Sales team, Unity resellers and distributors to be successful by supporting them with product needs. You will also help our customers with support needs.

Responsibilities

  • Will work with Exam Distribution Vendors and manage Certification related projects
  • Coordinating the recruitment and management of subject matter experts for certification and other educational products
  • Help manage project timelines and roadmaps with direction from Product Managers
  • Provide insight on how Unity is used and could be used in higher education
  • Support help with Certification related inquiries from customers

Requirements

  • Communication experience, both verbal and written
  • Demonstrated interest in education
  • Experience in program or project management
  • Willingness to do what it takes to get the job done, pivoting when needed
  • Attention to detail

Bonus points

  • Technical project management skills
  • Support skills
  • Experience in the Certification industry

Who we are

Unity is the creator of the world’s most widely-used real-time 3D (RT3D) development platform, providing content creators around the world with the tools they need to build rich, interactive 2D, 3D, VR and AR experiences. In fact, apps made with Unity reach 2.7 billion devices worldwide, and were installed more than 24 billion times in the last 12 months.

The global engineering team keeps Unity at the forefront of technology and working alongside partners like Magic Leap, Google, Facebook, Oculus and Microsoft ensures optimized support for the latest technology and platforms. Unity is powering the real-time revolution, expanding beyond games and breaking into other industries including automotive, film, architecture, engineering, construction and more.

Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

items.title: Senior Manager, Business Operations
items.content:
Senior Manager, Business Operations at Webflow

Remote

San Francisco HQ or Remote (US Only)

Webflow is a fast-growing startup on a mission to empower everyone to create software without having to learn to code. With over 45,000 paying customers, we’ve built a real business on the foundation of making complex website and application development much easier. We have a thriving business and a passionate community.

Now that we’ve found product market fit, Webflow is looking to hire a strong operator to kick off our Business Operations (BizOps) team and lead key strategic initiatives to drive our next phase of growth. In this role, you’ll report directly to the CEO to help Webflow accelerate our existing momentum, scale our business initiatives, and maximize our full potential.

In this high leverage position, you’ll own and drive business-critical initiatives in close coordination with the founders and functional partners (finance, marketing, people, operations, growth, sales, etc.). It’s not an internal consulting position; you’ll work hands-on to drive projects through from hypothesis to implementation.

This is a full-time, salaried position that includes health, dental, and vision benefits; significant equity; and lots of awesome perks. We’re remote-friendly, so you can live wherever you want.

Note: You’ll need valid U.S. work authorization to join us.

What you’ll do:

  • Identify, implement, and operationalize high impact strategic initiatives
  • Lead execution on impactful projects that directly influence business results
  • Partner with other teams to execute strategic initiatives or drive operational scale and efficiency
  • Perform analyses and research to inform growth decisions and prioritize opportunities
  • Design, implement, and operationalize performance metrics at the company and functional levels
  • Drive company-wide process improvements

We’d love to hear from you if you:

  • Have 5+ years of work experience and background in management consulting and technology startups (especially SaaS business models)
  • Are a curious, analytical and investigative thinker
  • Have a solid track record of driving complex projects with many stakeholders to success
  • Are highly productive and motivated by solving hard problems, and can operate in a kind and low-ego way that’s consistent with our core behaviors
  • Have the ability to find the right metric to optimize and then optimize it
  • Are not afraid to roll up your sleeves and get stuff done in a fast-moving, ever-changing startup environment
  • Have well rounded mix of business and technical acumen
Apply for job

items.title: Head of Design
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
We’re looking for a Head of Design who’s passionate about making a positive difference in the world.

This is a full-time, in-house position

Our mission:

Type 2 diabetes has become a global epidemic; in the UK, we spend £9 billion a year alone (that’s 10% of the NHS budget) on treating this. What’s shocking is most of this is preventable – through sustained lifestyle and behaviour change.

Enter OurPath.

We’re here to help people take control of their health. By bringing together behavioural science, technology, and incredible people, our grand mission is to eradicate the global epidemic of chronic lifestyle diseases once and for all.

Our digital behaviour change programme – delivered digitally through mobile and web apps – helps people to improve their lifestyle, lose weight, and ultimately reduce their risk for conditions such as type 2 diabetes.

We’re also commissioned by the NHS to help people already living with type 2 diabetes.

The role:

We’re looking for an empathetic Head of Design, not only to help us build and grow our product but also our design team.

What you’ll do:

  • Help define and implement an inspiring, holistic product vision and design strategy to build delightful experiences for our users.
  • Help cultivate the design culture of the team and the company, including championing user-centric design thinking across the company and maintaining a collaborative design process.
  • Work closely with your peers across all departments (Growth, Marketing, Customer Support and Health Coaches) to help solve both user and business goals.
  • Lead user research to determine the best approaches and methods to capture the right insights; plan and run qualitative studies, including (but not limited to) user interviews, remote and in-person usability studies.
  • Communicate research findings to inform business decisions through the best possible means with relevant stakeholders to help inform our decision-making.
  • Manage and grow designers within the product team; this includes hiring and mentoring all levels of designers to deliver their best work.

What we’re looking for:

  • (Required) You have a proven track record of designing successful products that users love. You have a background as a visual designer and UX designer.
  • (Required) You have hands-on experience with exploratory and evaluative qualitative research methods; you’ll have previous experience in running research projects and user testings, from planning to running the sessions to analyzing and creating deliverables.
  • (Required) You appreciate the value in research, but can also consider practical constraints – you understand what ‘just enough research’ means.
  • (Nice to have) You have empathy for customer needs but can also consider technical constraints and business goals. You’re passionate about inclusive design and accessibility, and you’ll design with all our users in mind (not just the ones that look like our team).
  • (Nice to have) You’re flexible in your approach and embrace a challenge; you can come up with new ways of answering research questions quickly and communicating the results in a memorable, impactful way.
  • (Nice to have) You have previous experience in managing designers, and you’re passionate about developing designers’ skills and careers.

What’s in it for you:

  • You’ll be able to provide direct input into how we should improve our product and the development of OurPath.
  • You’ll get to work with amazing, friendly, smart colleagues all incredibly passionate about solving the type 2 diabetes epidemic.
  • You’ll lead the design – together with the rest of the product team – on a product that’s used by thousands today, and millions tomorrow.
  • You’ll have autonomy and responsibility for your work direction; we also offer a flexible working environment where you can work from home when you need to.
  • We have regular company-sponsored socials (pub drinks, team dinners, board games and movie nights) that’ll allow you to catch up and make friends outside of your team.
  • We all have a thirst for knowledge and have regular Lunch&Learn sessions to help us expand our knowledge base; the product team also get together and run quarterly Hackathons.

How to apply:

This position is available to start immediately. If you believe you’re a good fit, go to https://ourpath-1.workable.com/jobs/1038310 to apply.

Applications without a portfolio will be ignored.

items.content:
This listing is for the London Office or the Cambridge Office


Role


We are looking for someone to lead the product development activities across WeGift including technology, design and product management. This role requires the candidate to develop expert knowledge of our customers’ needs and build, own and deliver on the long term product strategy. This position requires deep engagement with customers and all departments including engineering, design, marketing, sales and customer success.


Responsibilities



  • Devise product planning, customer discovery, product discovery, and product development processes.

  • Work closely with the CEO and CRO in achievement of growth objectives including building market share, supporting multi-product revenue generation, profit and ROI on new features or products.

  • Spending time with customers to refine user needs.

  • Deep engagement with prospective and existing customers in order to gather data and establish user needs to ensure continuing product market fit.

  • Identify and build business cases for potential opportunities, and present these to the CEO and CRO for initial validation and testing.

  • Ensure there is a robust product feedback and improvement cycle that ties into sales, marketing and customer success.

  • Ensuring a cycle of data collection, measurement and continuous improvement on product prioritisation and roadmap delivery.


The Opportunity



  • Autonomy and ownership in a fun environment, that cares about your wellbeing both inside and outside of work.

  • A chance to shape the future of one of Europe’s fastest growing fintech start-ups.

  • Lots of opportunity to learn and grow professionally.

  • Be a key member of a passionate, smart and driven team of professionals who are committed to transforming the way businesses use digital currency.


Sketches of life at WeGift



  • We run at a million miles an hour, there’s always great things to get done.

  • We laugh a lot. Humour solves a lot of problems.

  • If things go sideways, we’re reflective, with some healthy humour; we roll up our sleeves and sort it out.

  • We see the awesome work we do used in everyday life and are driven by the knowledge that there are still millions of businesses and consumers we can help.

  • If you’re the type of person that likes to laugh in the face of danger, wants to make a big splash and gets stuff done, we’d love you to come and join us for the journey.


What’s Exciting About WeGift?



  • We’re building a new business category; the world’s first digital currency of all customer acquisition, loyalty, retention pay-outs, that globally and instantly saves businesses up to 20%, with no bank account required.

  • You’ll be working with many of the world’s leading gift card brands (Amazon, Nike, Uber) and corporate partners (Vouchercodes.co.uk, Perkbox and Coinbase)

  • You’ll see millions of people, business partners, friends and family interact during their everyday lives

  • We’ve built an amazing product and are leading the way in $600 billion industry that is growing fast.


Requirements



  • You have successfully scaled an enterprise level product at a successful startup (ideally more than once).

  • Minimum 5 years’ experience in such a role.

  • You have owned and directed a portfolio of products at one business.

  • Please clearly demonstrate your experience in your application highlighting the value you have added to the product/team.

  • Technical expertise.

  • Strong communication and leadership skills.



What’s in for you?


We believe there is a clear distinction between perks and benefits. Perks are easily replicable, whereas benefits are something that are unique to us. We have taken the time to tailor a number of them to fit our culture and ethos.


Compensation



  • £90k - £120k (depending on experience)


Benefits



  • Pay reviews every 6 months to make sure we’re paying market rate.

  • Participation in the Employee Options pool so you get to own a piece of WeGift.

  • Pension scheme (3% contribution)

  • A minimum of 25 days holiday + bank holidays (we’re not too descriptive about holidays so if you need more time off then just ask).

  • Staff perks with WeGift brands - discounts of up to 12% on coffee, weekly groceries, holidays, the list is endless.

  • Flexible hours and work from home when needed - yes, yes everyone says this but we do.

  • WeRecognise, where we shine the spotlight on exceptional employees every month who in turn get a £200 award in the eGift card of their choice.

  • Personal development budget - well actually there is no budget as we don’t believe in putting a cap on learning new things.

  • Generous maternity and paternity packages to make sure you get to spend time with your new bundle of joy.

  • Fully licensed as a tier 2 sponsor + relocation packages to help you get settled in.


Perks



  • Brand new WeWork office based in Monument, London.

  • A new laptop as standard - no one wants an old one when they need to be doing their best work + all the trimmings you need to get the perfect work setup.

  • Catered lunch once a week.

  • Monthly team socials (Escape Rooms, Karaoke - everyone gets a chance to choose what this looks like)

  • Cycle to work scheme - save some £££ on buying a bike


 


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.


 


Successful candidates will be contacted within two weeks.

Perks

items.content:
Role


You will be managing a small team and ensuring the finance function and operations of the business is set-up to support the growth of the business both operationally and strategically to reach the commercial objectives set by the CEO.


Responsibilities



  • Leadership: Implementing and managing specific financial and operational KPIs and ensuring the team are organised, focused and supported.



  • Operations: Ensure day to day finance functions are executed efficiently and run in a manner that delivers the best customer experience, managing high volumes of multi-currency financial products.



  • Controllership duties: Owning the budgeting processes, reporting accurate and timely historical financial information of the company and assisting in monitoring, controlling and clarifying company performance and cash flow.

  • Treasury duties: Managing deployment of company funds taking into consideration risk and liquidity and the optimal capital structure of the company. Understanding of and ability to manage fraud management, including e-commerce, credit card, KYB and banking fraud.

  • Strategy and forecasting: Analyse, model identify and report on what areas of a company are most efficient and how the company can capitalize on this information and the impact on strategic business plans.

  • Corporate structure and tax: Experience with multi-jurisdictional finance regulation and accounting practises. Develop financial and tax strategies. Oversee the financial operations of subsidiary companies and foreign operations.

  • Financial information management: Manage the accounting across multiple subsidiaries, human resources, investor relations, legal, tax, and treasury departments including managing any third parties to which accounting or finance functions have been outsourced and overseeing the issuance of financial information.

  • Capital allocation: Assisting in capital raising, investor relations, investment of company capital including pensions and due diligence or negotiation on acquisition.


Requirements



  • 7-8 years’ experience

  • Senior member at a global FinTech company

  • Experience of leading and delivering on big projects

  • Management experience of 2 years with a team of at least 4

  • SaaS, ecommerce and payment processing/transactional business experience

  • Start-up environment - having experienced success and failure

  • Experience with VC/Private Equity backed businesses and the SME environment

  • An interest in blockchain or cryptocurrency
