items.content:
General Manager at Tortuga

Remote | High-paying

REMOTE · United States

DESCRIPTION

Tortuga is seeking a General Manager (GM) to help us make travel easier and more enjoyable.

As GM, you will be the first non-founder people manager at the company. This is a pivotal hire for us. Today, we are a flat team of 10 with everyone reporting to the co-founder and CEO. In the GM role, you will help to shape our organizational and communication structures and build out the next stage of the company. Our flat structure was initially a strength but is now a limiting factor to our growth. With your help, we will grow into a “team of teams” that is better equipped for future growth.

At Tortuga, we are building a remote, humane workplace. That’s how we think work should work. As the General Manager, you will influence that vision while helping your teammates do great work.

Tortuga is comprised of Players and Coaches. Individual contributors (ICs) are Players and “managers” are Coaches. This analogy would make you the Head Coach. Longer-term, as we develop teams within the company, you will become a Coach of Coaches.

A Coach’s role is to support Players, not to tell them what to do. You are not responsible for solving every problem. You are responsible for helping Players solve their own problems and for removing roadblocks so that Players can do their jobs well. You will enable Players to spend their time in deep work, not in meetings and administrative hell.

Tortuga is and will remain a Player-first company with a low Coach-to-Player ratio.

Your experience should include growing a company or line of business from 7 to 8 figures in revenue and having managed a team of 10+ people (not necessarily all direct reports).

The GM will work directly with the co-founder and CEO of Tortuga.

—

Tortuga is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and encourage anyone who is interested in joining our team to apply for open roles, even if you aren’t certain that you’re qualified. For example, research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles if they don’t meet 100% of the qualifications.

Our top priority is hiring the right person for each role at Tortuga. So we want to hear from you.

Mission

To lead Tortuga as the Head Coach. You will work closely with each team member and alongside Fred, the co-founder and CEO, to execute on our strategy. You will make the team greater than the sum of its parts.

Objectives

  • Grow Tortuga from 7 to 8 figures in sales while remaining bootstrapped
  • Meet or exceed forecasted sales while staying under budget
  • Build the next iteration (V4) of the company as we transition from a flat, siloed structure to a more scalable “team of teams”

Strengths

  • Coaching: You empower others to be great at their roles. You are a Coach, not a manager. Coaches don’t solve problems; they help Players solve problems. Tortuga is a Player-first company.
  • The Right Ambition: The right ambition is ambition for the company, not for yourself. If Tortuga does well, you will do well. The opposite is not necessarily true. You should be able to work towards a common, company-wide goal even when you disagree with the strategy. Doing what is best for Tortuga and our customers is more important than getting your way.
  • Taking Initiative: Every company says that it wants to hire self-starters. Remote companies have no choice. You must take initiative and hold yourself accountable to a high standard of work. No one is looking over your shoulder or tracking every minute of your work. You will likely have more autonomy at Tortuga than at your previous jobs. If you can’t turn this freedom into results, you won’t be successful on a remote team.
  • Written Communication: Everyone on a remote team must be a strong writer. We have video calls and team retreats but communicate far more often in writing (Docs, Asana, email, Slack). You must be able to communicate clearly and concisely in writing.

Do Not Apply If…

  • You aren’t excited about travel. Our team is passionate about the problems we work on every day and our mission of making travel easier and more enjoyable.
  • You want to spend your day in deep work. Coaches will have a manager’s schedule, not a maker’s schedule.
  • You need the structure of working at a big company. We are a small, remote team. There is no HR department. If you need something done, you do it.
  • You need the credit. We’ve built a humble, “no ego” team and only intend to hire people who fit that mold.

REQUIREMENTS

  • You must be based in a North America-friendly time zone as nine tenths of our team is based in the US and Canada.

BENEFITS

Salary: Base pay is $140,000. At Tortuga, salaries are calculated by a formula, not by negotiation. The formula includes base pay with multipliers for job level and tenure (at Tortuga).

  • Work from Anywhere: Tortuga is 100% distributed. Decide where you work best, whether that’s from home, a coffee shop, a co-working space, or another country. We will even pay for your coworking membership.
  • Team Retreats: Twice per year, we meet up to plan the future and to enjoy time together in person. Past retreats include Prague, New Orleans, Lisbon, and Montreal.
  • Unlimited Vacation: You decide how much of a break you need and when. Just promise to tell us about your trip when you get back.
  • Total Coverage: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance. We pay 100% of your premiums and 50% of your dependents’ premiums.
  • Retirement Savings: Tortuga matches 100% of your contributions up to 4% of your salary.
  • Parental Leave: Take up to 12 weeks of paid parental leave.
  • Free Gear: All the bags and accessories you need for your future travels.
Apply for job

items.title: Associate Project Manager
items.content:
Associate Project Manager at IQ Solutions

Remote | Part-time

Job Locations: US-Remote

Job ID: 2019-1218

Category: Communications

Department: Communications – Communications Strategy

Job Status: Active

Type: Part-Time On-Call

Role Summary
As an Associate Project Manager on IQ Solutions’ Digital Communications team you will utilize your background in public health to support major government contracts. In this role, you will provide support to project(s) on the social marketing and communications teams. Your responsibilities will include supporting the development and implementation of market research, media outreach, media materials, consumer-and provider-education products and campaigns and programs as well as providing technical direction to inform evaluative activities for health communication projects and campaign initiatives. The ideal candidate will have over six years of experience managing public health programs and/or program evaluation activities, working closely with clients at the Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and public health prevention partners.

What Will You Be Engaged In Day-To-Day?

  • Assisting with the development and management of work plans and budgets, coordinating across project teams, and monitoring and tracking of project deliverables.
  • Conducting qualitative analyses on health communication campaigns and projects.
  • Translate data into plain language and clear calls-to-action for public health audiences.
  • Develop evaluation plans and logic models for programmatic activities.
  • Lead the strategy for social and digital media monitoring activities.
  • Developing integrated marketing and communications plans for current and planned activities.
  • Consulting the client on marketing and communication strategies to reach targeted audiences with desired messages.
  • Evaluating marketing efforts and reporting results to the client.
  • Developing and maintaining partnerships that expand our clients’ reach.
  • Providing direction and monitoring junior and mid-level staff to ensure that projects and tasks meet internal and client deadlines, revising schedules as needed.
  • Preparing budgets for specific tasks and projects and tracking costs to ensure projects remain within budget.
  • Developing and reviewing weekly and monthly client reports.
  • Refining and maintaining quality control processes for specific projects and tasks and working to enhance quality control processes across projects.
  • Negotiating and contracting with outside vendors as needed.
  • Developing day-to-day contact with senior-level client representatives, including planning and participating in conference calls and meetings as needed.
  • Participating in the development and delivery of new business pitches and proposals.
  • Performing other duties as assigned.

What Qualifications Will Help You Succeed?

  • B.S. or B.A. degree in communications, marketing, or a related field, and a minimum of 4 years of experience in all stages of developing and implementing integrated marketing and communications plans for major projects, as well as a minimum of 5 years in a managerial position. M.P.H, M.S., or M.H.S. degree is a preferred.
  • A background in public health or health education, Hispanic communications, or interactive communications, as well as experience working on Federal Government or nonprofit projects, is preferred.
  • Must have strong written and verbal communication skills as well as excellent organization, initiative, flexibility, and responsiveness to changing requirements and conditions.
  • The successful candidate can work well in a collaborative, team environment, while possessing the ability to work independently.
  • Strong project and team management skills and the ability to work collaboratively with a diverse team to implement cross-project, integrated marketing strategies is required.
  • High-level ability to think creatively, plan strategically, and execute tasks thoroughly is required.
Apply for job

items.title: BriteCore: Director of Product Management
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=10, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Director of Product Management

BriteCore is seeking a Director of Product to manage the strategy, vision, and direction of our insurance administration software suite. Working closely with the CEO, the Director of Product develops and maintains the BriteCore product roadmap to align with the strategic vision of the company. Product Owners and Product Managers report to the Director of Product to develop cohesive epics and stories that meet the needs of customers and drive sales.

BriteCore is a modern Python/Django SaaS solution deployed fully through AWS. All web services are highly decoupled but tightly integrated through careful design. We are in year two of a five-year build of our third generation software suite. Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery principles drive BriteCore’s ongoing development, leading to a steady evolution across over twenty products. 

Key challenges include breaking up the second generation monolithic codebase into third generation microservices, expanding our product fit to meet the needs of a broader market, and coordinating the build of many core products under concurrent development. For the right candidate, this is an opportunity to fundamentally shape the direction of a high profile, enterprise financial services platform. 

Key Responsibilities
  • Work closely with the CEO to align the product roadmap to the strategic vision of the company
  • Directly manage product owners and product managers
  • Approve epics for development at the Program level.
  • Coordinate new product development with ongoing support and implementation service requirements
  • Implement consistent design patterns across a range of diverse applications
  • Review all sprint demos for steady, incremental progress
  • Accept or reject epics at each Program Increment
  • Communicate clearly and effectively with internal and external stakeholders
  • Advance a large number of concurrent initiatives
  • Maintain a values-driven culture
  • Solve complex problems daily

Required Skills
  • Senior product management experience
  • Excellent written and verbal communication
  • Advanced critical thinking
  • Rapid comprehension of abstract ideas
  • Technical expertise in enterprise SaaS platform development
  • General exposure to property casualty insurance or financial services preferred
  • Empathy for both customers and delivery teams
  • Collaborative problem solving and consensus building

Benefits
  • Retirement plan with 3% company match
  • Comprehensive health insurance coverage including medical, dental, and vision
  • Short and long term disability
  • Flexible schedule with unlimited vacation time
  • Fully remote work in a remote-first company
  • Relaxed work environment

items.content:
Project Manager for Digital Rollouts (m/f/d) // ctrl QS

Company: ctrl QS

Tags:
  • Content Management
  • Project Management
  • Digital Marketing
  • CMS
  • digital agency
  • Digital Projects
  • System Management
  • rollout management

    • About Us

    At ctrl QS we address the challenges faced by global brands when operating their digital activities worldwide. Offering a specialized range of services, we achieve operational excellence internationally to go hand in hand with advancing technology. Our track record of achievements is based on the contribution of every team member and has resulted in close and trusting relationships with our clients who see us as part of their team.

    Working at ctrl QS is to be at the forefront of the world’s corporate digital transformation. Located in the heart of Berlin, we steer international digital activities for some of the world’s top global brands like NIVEA, Montblanc, IWC Schaffhausen, GROHE and la prairie. We are unique in our positioning focusing on what we do best.

    A job with us combines working in a fast-paced professional environment and being part of a young-spirited, agile, collaborative, and multicultural team of about 80 team members from over 30 nations. Our working language is English.
    We are continuously learning and growing, offering careers in a wide variety of directions with the possibility to develop and take on new responsibilities quickly. Our account teams consist of Account Managers and Directors, Project and Content Managers, Rollout Managers, International Support Specialists, Technical Experts as well as Trainers. Our success is based on sustainable and healthy growth and we put our team, values and client satisfaction first.

    What you’ll do

    • Managing rollout projects. You manage international rollout projects for global brands in an agile way. From campaign rollouts to tool & system rollouts to rolling out new ways of working. You are responsible for all strategic, operational and team management matters of the project, ensuring to meet project objectives.
    • Applying expertise. You will apply our ctrl QS company expertise and proven approaches to the projects you manage. You build and expand the expertise through your experiences and skills. You quickly develop a sound technical expertise on our client’s system infrastructure.
    • Planning and budgeting. You will manage project budgets and take over responsibility for timely budget and team planning. You evaluate short and medium-term team needs and always ensure regular and accurate reporting and invoicing.
    • Building relationships. You work closely with our clients and their technical and creative partners. You uphold, strengthen and build trusting and long-term partnerships.
    • Optimizing. You critically review project developments and proactively suggest and implement optimization initiatives (e.g. to processes, team set-up, budgeting, client relationship management etc.).
    • Rolling up your sleeves. You dive into action with a hands-on approach, pragmatically supporting with operational and configurational tasks when and where necessary. You have robust analytical skills and deliver on detail as well as strategy.

    What you can offer

    • Result orientation. You have a proven track record of successful project management in agile environments. You take full accountability and ownership of your role. You deliver excellent results with an action-oriented but quality-focused approach.
    • Digital savviness. You understand the challenges large corporations face with digital transformation, have a profound understanding of the digital landscape and state-of-the-art digital marketing technologies. You love to dig into the details and complexity of our clients’ worlds and to collaborate hands-on with the teams.
    • Communication. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills: you interact confidently in an international and intercultural, dynamic surrounding and are experienced in presenting and communicating professionally to client teams. You love to build connections to people and communities across the globe. Fluent English skills both orally and written, German skills advantageous.
    • Experience. You have gained relevant experience in digital project management and agile ways of working. Ideally, you have already worked with multilingual Content Management Systems, international website infrastructures and website localization. Experience in working in corporate environments advantageous.
    • Resilience. You don’t mind if things become hectic and stay cool if things change unexpectedly. You strive in a fast-paced and dynamic working environment. Even under pressure you can provide consistent quality and reliable results.
    • Inspiring a can-do attitude. You love to get involved and proactively approach opportunities and business challenges with a positive and open mind. You inspire others to follow you.

    What we offer

    • Opportunity to shape. You can actively shape our organization and continue the ctrl QS success story. Reap the fruits of your own initiatives and see the impact of what you do.
    • Exposure and top clients. We enjoy long term and profound client relationships. You will work closely with leading global brands, helping them to steer digital transformation in their organization.
    • Learning and development. We face new challenges every day and we encourage you to take them on. You’ll never stop learning when working with us. We’ll plan your development steps together.
    • Work-life balance. We strongly believe that a healthy work-life balance not only makes us happier but also leads to better results. We offer opportunities to work from home, temporary remote work and sabbatical opportunities.
    • Culture and Team. We always strive to ensure that our intentions and everyday actions are guided by our values: Trust, Dynamism, Quality, Collaboration, Impact and Professionalism. An open, committed, supportive, multicultural, fun and powerful team is looking forward to welcoming you soon!
    • Working environment. Our beautiful office is located in the heart of Berlin. We offer fresh fruit every day, weekly breakfasts and yoga classes, team and company events, and more.
    Apply for this position

items.title: Hotjar: Senior Legal Counsel
items.content:
Senior Legal Counsel

Note: Although this is a remote position, we are only looking for team members based in European timezones (between UTC-1 and UTC+2).

As a member of our newly formed Legal and Compliance team, you’ll oversee the workflow of legal matters from throughout Hotjar. You’ll participate in compliance projects with our teams and external customers to address topics spanning many different legal areas.

You’ll be part of a team which focuses on ensuring that our customers can use our service in a manner compliant with applicable regulations, and work on legal and compliance related company-wide projects and requirements. The team commonly works with outside attorneys across the globe to address specialized topics such as privacy, employment, contracts, intellectual property, and other legal domains. You’ll draft, review, advise and update legal correspondence and external and internal documents for the use of our team.  

You will:
  • Manage contractual compliance of Hotjar’s commitments to its customers and team members
  • Facilitate the review of legal documents (incoming contracts, NDAs, Data Processing Agreements, addendums, and vendor and partner agreements, etc.)
  • Review, and where necessary negotiate, the terms and conditions in contracts and legal documents for tools and vendors we engage with, and analyze and assess their risk
  • Be involved in compliance-related projects including: data protection regulations; product development; financial regulations; labor and fair wage
  • Audit Schedules (financial, security, contractual, etc.)
  • Provide counsel to executives in multiple legal topics
  • Be an internal advocate on Data Protection and assist the our Data Protection Officer when needed
  • Implement processes for tracking and record-keeping to fulfill contractual obligations
  • Work with high profile external customers

Requirements
  • A German or United Kingdom law degree (this is a definite for this role; we will not be able to consider candidates without this requirement)
  • Experience with Data Protection Legislation and standard contractual or business agreements for a European company
  • Strong negotiation skills
  • A business practical approach to legal and compliance matters
  • Must be customer-centric. You will support external customers and internal team members, and work with our trusted legal partners
  • Must submit to a background check confidentially processed by a third-party
  • Desire to work in a respectful, transparent, and collaborative work environment, following Hotjar’s company values, culture and ways of working 

What we offer
  • A remote and accomplished diverse and international team
  • A chance to positively enhance people’s experience online and make the web a better place
  • Annual learning and development budget
  • Several perks designed for your well-being and a healthy work-life balance. (Holiday Budget, Wellbeing Allowance, Working Together Budget, 16 weeks paid parental leave, and much more)

Compensation Range
The budgeted compensation range for this role is €65,000 to €85,000 annually. Ranges are based on market research and are equitable to other roles within Hotjar. The actual compensation offered will be based on relative experience. At this time we are only able to provide official employment status to those located in Malta, and Germany (for candidates who don’t require visa sponsorship). All other team members will join as full-time consultants and will be responsible for paying any taxes or applicable fees where they reside.

items.content:
Implementation Project Manager at Magellan Health

Remote

Location: Glen Allen VA

Looking for an Implementation Project Manager with 7+ years of experience. This is a REMOTE position, allowing you to work from anywhere in the US.

  • Looking for candidates with their PMP certification, or ability to get it within 6 months of hire.
  • Healthcare experience preferred, but not required.
  • Any previous PBM experience a large plus.

This position serves as a senior member of a cross-functional project team consisting of individuals from various IT departments and business units. Provides senior level specialty expertise to management from various IT departments. Has the ability to effectively deal with evolving and competing objectives and possess a mastery of project management tools. Experienced with managing enterprise-wide projects, including managing third party staff, working through contractual issues, etc.. Develops and maintains project charters, detail project plans, weekly status updates and provides problem resolution. Responsible for ensuring projects are within scope and meets time and budget targets. Must be familiar with the role and function of team members in order to effectively coordinate the activities of the team. Communicates with appropriate staff/leadership regarding status of specific projects.

  • Provides direction to a team of IT Project Managers
  • Manages a program or cross-functional projects using lean/agile methods
  • Provides senior-level expertise to management from various I.T. departments.
  • Works directly with senior leadership on highly visible, strategic projects
  • Demonstrates experience in managing complex, evolving and competing objectives.
  • Demonstrates experience with managing enterprise-wide projects, including managing third party staff, working through contractual issues, etc.
  • Possesses a mastery of project management tools and methodologies, especially lean/agile methods
  • Ensures projects are within scope and meet time and budget targets.
  • Influences team members, peers and stakeholders to meet the objectives of the project
  • Demonstrates the ability to work with and lead technical and non-technical staff and leadership across all levels in the department
  • Demonstrates strong organization, communication, negotiation, conflict resolution and time management
  • Communicates with appropriate staff/leadership regarding status and impacts of projects.

Agile:

  • Coaches and mentors other IT Project Managers in lean/agile methods.
  • Drives servant leadership and coaches other IT Project Managers on this quality.
  • Empowers the teams to be self-organizing.
  • Empowers the teams and stakeholders to make decisions.
  • Measures and reports progress frequently using agile metrics.
  • Creates Product Roadmap and Release Plan in partnership with POs and Ims.
  • Leads coordinating practices in Agile methods such as Release Planning, Iteration Planning, Grooming etc.
  • Coaches and assists Product Owners in prioritization, 3-Amigo Reviews and other PO activities.
  • Leads and facilitates Scrum of Scrums with related projects/teams.

Traditional:

  • Develops and maintains project charters, detailed project plans, weekly status updates and provides problem resolution.
  • Creates and maintains WBS, RACI, Stakeholder Register and detailed Project Management plan.
  • Manages dependencies across projects.
  • Performs Root Cause Analysis.
  • Leads in the establishment and facilitation of internal IT project management processes and tools (i.e. critical path tracking, contingency planning, operational workflow documentation/refinement.)

General Job Information

Title

Implementation Project Manager

Grade

29

Job Family

Info Technology Group

Country

United States of America

FLSA Status

United States of America (Exempt)

Work Experience

IT, Project/Program Management

Education

Bachelors: Computer and Information Science

License and Certifications – Required

License and Certifications – Preferred

CSM – Certified Scrum Master – Enterprise, PMP – Project Management Professional – Enterprise

Other Job Requirements

Responsibilities

  • 7+ years related experience including a minimum of 2+ years of Agile/Scrum master experience.
  • Experience working with Agile Methods and modern programming environments.
  • Should have moved across different departments within IT to gain a broader perspective of the business/industry.
  • Scrum Master or similar certification.
  • Critical thinker.
  • Demonstrated problem solving techniques.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.

Magellan Health Services is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Tobacco-free workplace. EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled. Every employee must understand, comply and attest to the security responsibilities and security controls unique to their position.

Job description

Incredible opportunity to become the VP of Engineering for Crunch.io! 

Crunch.io, part of YouGov PLC are looking for a VP Engineering that can drive innovation, quality and agility in our engineering.  Crunch.io is an innovative analytics company in the market research industry. We offer a survey data analysis platform that allows market researchers, analysts, and marketers to collaborate in a secure, cloud-based environment, using an intuitive drag-and-drop interface. Crunch users can quickly gain insights from their data and communicate them to their clients.

You will leverage latest cloud-computing and open-source technologies. You will manage distributed development teams to realize our technology vision. We are looking for someone who is entrepreneurial with a proven record building and managing successful software development.

What will I be doing?

  • Direct responsibility for managing approximately 20 developers, split across three teams.
  • Work with senior leadership and product marketing to create a roadmap for the product.
  • Develop, lead and inspire a team of approximately 20 developers. Be a magnet for technical talent and accelerate the hiring of engineers.
  • Allocate resources, set priorities, and manage schedules for the teams. Deliver high quality software on time and within budget.
  • Promote a culture of success, pride, performance, discipline, and creativity. Play a leadership role within the company.

What do I need to bring with me?

  • Experience managing teams using agile and test-driven development.
  • Strong computer science foundation
  • Expertise building big-data analytic solutions with appropriate use of relational and NoSQL database technologies
  • Fluency in multiple programming languages, but especially Python.
  • Understanding of JavaScript frameworks, such as React.
  • At least ten years’ experience in software development.
  • B.S. in computer science or related degree. Advanced degree preferred.

Any additional info:

This position is a full time role, based 100% remotely

Apply now

About YouGov

YouGov works with the world's leading brands and organisations to understand what people think.

Powered by Digital Development

Our Global Dev group is a tight group of seven teams comprised of about 40 developers based globally in the UK, Poland, USA and beyond.

The teams coordinate on efforts to build applications and innovate in data collection, survey authoring, profile data management, integration, data analytics, content management, and other areas.

These applications drive the opinion data engine of YouGov; empowering the biggest and the best organisations around the world with accurate information about what the world thinks. Enabling these organisations to make effective predictions based on what their audience or stakeholders think.

We believe the more people are able to participate in the decisions made by the institutions that serve them, the better those decisions will be.

Diverse as the Audience we work with

YouGov is part of Stonewall's Global Diversity Champions Framework.

Benefits

  • Flexibility
  • Best Equipment
  • Salary + Bonus
  • Well-being at Work
  • Various lifestyle benefits
  • Culture of Learning
  • Pension (401K in the USA)
  • Employee Assistance
  • Games and Social Events
  • Good Holiday allowance

items.title: RELAYTO Head of Design
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)

items.content:
RELAYTO is looking for a UK-based design leader (remote or at London office) to work directly with our founders and lead a small design team – with the potential to progress into an executive-level Chief Design Officer. We are open to working together either on a permanent or freelance basis.


1/ WHAT IS RELAYTO?


RELAYTO helps sales & marketers to turn documents into interactive presentations & web pages with instant branding, analytics & more. It’s a $30B opportunity to re-think B2B content for the modern age. RELAYTO is a fast-growing and award-winning (we are a Top100 European private company as awarded by Red Herring) tech startup that already worked with world-class enterprise clients such as Accenture, Salesforce, Mercedes Benz and PwC-Startupbootcamp. 
We are proud graduates of TechStars and Accenture’ Fintech Innovation Lab, Salesforce Accelerate and currently participating in the Alchemist Accelerator in San Francisco (the role is still in London). Curious to find out more? Check out rla.to/pitch


2/ FOUNDERS & ADVISORS


Alex Shevelenko - CEO 
* Cloud Pioneer: pre-IPO at SuccessFactors through to exit to SAP for $3.4B. Stanford MBA, ex-Salesforce and Microsoft (helped launch Office 95). 
* Consulting: only MBA student awarded by Foundation for Excellence in Management Consulting & Association of Management Consulting Firms in recognition of client work at Mercer Management Consulting / Oliver Wyman 
* Creative + Science: contributed to 50 creative/digital awards without “creative/design training” by developing Ideas Science ™ method that leverages behavioural and neuroscience research


Nikita Korotaev - CTO 
Founded & built from scratch Lectrio, the next-generation online learning environment. 
* Scaled SaaS business to 20+ geographies 
* Recognized as “Exceptional Talent” by Tech City UK and won a Russian Presidential Award for top computer science students.


Advisors:
We have built a network of world-class Silicon Valley advisors: 
* Aaron Au – Co-Founder/CTO of SuccessFactors (now CTO of SAP and head of SAP collaboration business) 
* Hiroki Asai, Apple GVP Marketing, who for 15 years lead all comms and 1000-person creative team working directly with Steve Jobs 
* Steve King, ex CEO of DocuSign and current Executive Chairman of Nuxeo


3/ DAY TO DAY ROLE


At RELAYTO, you would be a part of a small international team (London, Silicon Valley & Paris), operating primarily via Slack & Asana, and working directly with the Founders. While every day in a startup is different, you can expect these responsibilities:


✓ Being the champion of our users and clients 
✓ Creating high-end templates in PPT / Photoshop for upload onto the RELAYTO Platform 
✓ Understanding client specifications and creating interactive experiences using the R/ Toolkit 
✓ Designing infographics and marketing material to help explain the RELAYTO value proposition 
✓ Leading and mentoring a team of junior designers
✓ Demonstrating the product and use cases/examples in a client environment 
✓ Working with our Product Team to shape the future of the end-user experience


4/ WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?


In general, the person most likely to succeed in this role will possess:


✓ A high level of visual aesthetics, including advanced typographical, design and layout skills. 
✓ A portfolio that demonstrates innovative designs 
✓ An expert understanding of design theory and structure i.e. type, colour, formatting, semiotics, information design and digital design. 
✓ Prior design agency experience or equivalent 
✓ A strong commercial understanding that will enable you to “put yourself in the clients shoes”. Key technical skills (you will be tested on these): 
✓ PowerPoint / Google Slides 
✓ Adobe Illustrator
✓ Adobe Photoshop 
✓ Adobe Indesign Nice to have skills for extra brownie points: * Web Design/CSS * Adobe After Effects * Sketch Admin points
✓ Permission to work either in the UK or proven ability to work remotely 
✓ Upper-Intermediate English Level *5


5/ WHAT DO I GET?


We are a location-free startup, currently spanning London, San Francisco & Paris. We encourage flexibility and opportunity for working virtually or in physical teams, depending on your preference. Once you join, these come in a package:


* Competitive remuneration + equity 
* Remote work via Slack, Asana & Zoom * Work directly with the CEO, CTO & be part of the founding team. 
* Room to grow within a startup that has only scratched the surface of its vast potential 
* Professional guidance from an advisory board that includes Hiroki Asai, Apple’s former GVP Marketing, Communications & all-things-creative. 
* Being a part of the Accenture, PwC, Salesforce and Alchemist accelerator networks 
* Ability to have a direct impact on client projects that matter (we are currently in discussion with a multinational life science company to help market its life-saving drugs) 
* Exciting product challenges, in both architecture, product management and user experience. 
* A jerk-free culture defined by trust, respect, and empathy.
* Optional personal development in product marketing & general business skills

items.title: Marketing and Comms Manager for Fitness / Wellness app
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=10}
items.content:
The Role


Fitlink is looking for a Marketing and Comms Manager to join the team and take over the overall marketing (web, mobile, email and social) of Fitlink products and also support with comms within the b2b side of the business. We have websites (x3), Twitter (x2), Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, Blog, Medium, email, and chat as our marketing and comms channels. 


Fitlink App


Fitlink is a free app that lets anyone in the world combine all their activity trackers into one single app. We convert calories into points that unlock rewards - therefore users get rewarded for being active. Inside the app there are some cool features where users can compete with each in private or public leagues, regular challenges, rewards store, and activity feed of all users you follow.


Fitlink for Business


Most recently we have gone into the workplace with a new version of Fitlink aimed at HR managers/directors who want to create a fit and healthy workforce. Fitlink for Business offers a Workplace Wellness solution to businesses who are looking to keep their workforce fit, healthy and happy. And we all know that a fitter and healthier workforce will be more productive, take less time off work, less likely to leave their job, and things like recruitment get easier. So investing in the health and wellbeing of your company pays healthy returns! Some larger firms have KPIs, CSR commitments, and a general obligation to keep their staff fit, healthy and happy. And that’s exactly what Fitlink for Business does.


About you


Experience within the Fitness, Health, Employee Wellbing, Workplace Wellness industries would be an advantage. You should have experience of working within a startup and you'll be working in a remote team, using tools like Github, Slack, Google Apps, etc so you should be comfortable and have experience of working like this.


Should have experience in...



  • Workplace wellness, employee wellbeing and/or active travel industries 

  • Intercom.io as a CRM

  • Hubspot as a CRM

  • Slack, Gmail, Google Docs


Remote work


We are a remote team spread across three countries but for this role, you would be required to be located in or near Norwich or London. We spend most of our time remote working but have regular meetups in Norwich or London so being in one of these two places would be preferable.

Title: Project Coordinator Analyst
Please read job description in full. Must include cover letter highlighting experience applicable to requirements and qualifications outlined. Resume must reflect relevant experience.

Contract: 7 months
Pay: $21.59 / hr.
Location: Remote, anywhere in the USA
Work Authorization: Must be able to work legally in the U.S. without sponsorship
POSITION SUMMARY & KEY AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY:
Experience as Project Analyst or Project Coordinator desired.
  • Serves as single point of contact for escalations from vendors or customer in the post sales activities; Provides PMO support for customer deployment activity.
  • Resolves installation issues using multiple sources of information and by applying independent judgment and expertise.
  • Required to be responsive and aggressive in handling customer escalations and internal escalations.
  • Responsible for basic understanding of entire order fulfillment cycle and impact on role responsibilities; Raises any concerns over policy or policy interpretation with Project Manager.
  • Position manages scheduling, delivery and installation of client, customer procured and third-party products and services for client's customers.
  • Provides project coordination services (customer single point of contact, management reporting, billing, subject matter expert, etc.) in accounts that do not have Project Management representation.
  • Position is a key member of the project team responsible for coordinating the successful delivery of equipment and installation of the contracted services (internally and externally).
  • Utilizes defined processes and tools to ensure that each customer site/project is delivered and installed on time and is complete to meet the customer's expectations and in accordance with the documented scope of work.
  • Develop or assist in the creation and ongoing management of the rollout schedule
  • Update, track, and adjust the rollout schedule on a timely basis.
  • Identify installation risks, escalate and implement risk mitigation strategies
  • Recognize and document process/project improvements.
  • Create installation scheduling requests and ensure that all customer installation/deployment activity is scheduled and completed to the customer's satisfaction and per SOW.
  • Responsible for updating QuickBase (or similar) database with equipment and services data.
  • Coordinate post-startup activities (i.e. data gathering, team resources identification, installation processes distributed, data repository established, etc.).
  • Ensure that the requested site level activities are scheduled within standard process time frames
  • Provide the required delivery dates and locations for subsequent rollout or destination deferred orders to the Deployment Services centers.
  • Coordinate with other vendors as needed for delivery of equipment or services.
  • Escalate issues with maintaining the rollout schedule, as needed, and manage to closure.
  • Ensure any necessary billing data is provided to the appropriate parties.
  • Establishes and maintains communications with project team; Project team may include representatives of the customer, sales, BU, Project Management, Staging, Service Account Management, CS and any third-party partner(s).
  • Participates in scheduled meetings with key team members to review project feedback, tasks, action items and lessons learned.
  • Provide updates to the project status via QuickBase.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
  • 2-3 years of related experience.
  • PC proficient (Microsoft Windows, Internet Explorer and Microsoft Office including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook).
  • Customer focus
  • Excellent written and verbal communications skills.
  • Basic project management knowledge; Basic conflict management and negotiation skills.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, multi-tasking environment; Good time management and organizational skills.
  • Proven ability to identify and resolve issues with a sense of urgency.
  • Ability to work as part of a team or independently.
  • Detail oriented.
  • Payment processing software / firmware deployment services desired.
QUALIFICATIONS:
  • 2+ years of related experience.
  • Experience in the Financial, Retail, Telecom, or Entertainment Industries.
  • Willing to work non-standard business hours as required by projects.
Experis is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE/AA)

items.title: Direct Fundraising Manager
items.content:
Direct Fundraising Manager at American Red Cross

Remote

(work from home)

Location: Washington, DC, United States

Job Description:

PLEASE NOTE: Candidate will work remotely from their home office; can be based in any US city

The Consumer Fundraising team builds the foundation for optimal long-term donor value by developing strategies and programs that increase individual donor engagement, financial revenue, and fundraising capacity for the American Red Cross (ARC). The team focuses on marketing to individual donors via Direct Response and digital channels (e.g. direct mail, email, phone, search, mobile, etc.) to engage constituents and to raise revenue to support the mission of the Red Cross.

The Direct Fundraising Manager is responsible for collaborating with Red Cross regional chapters to develop and execute campaigns via email, ticketed events, and peer-to-peer (P2P) channels. This role works closely with local regions to develop strategies to achieve revenue targets and engage supporters. The manager will partner with cross-functional teams such as local Red Cross regions, brand, digital, and marketing data & operations. The manager will supervise a staff of two, who will help to develop and execute the regional campaigns.

Responsibilities:

  • Design and implement direct marketing programs and campaigns via digital fundraising platforms including email, events, and peer-to-peer fundraising (P2P). Manages marketing campaigns end-to-end, including template design, set-up, execution, reporting, and optimization, ensuring flawless execution and adhering to time sensitive deadlines.
  • Develop training to educate Red Cross regional platform users on how to self-utilize ticketed event and P2P platforms, direct marketing best practices, and new platform functionalities.
  • Report, analyze and aggregate data to drive continual optimization of all programs.
  • Manage revenue and expense budget for ticketed events
  • Supervise a team of two direct reports including defining priorities, assigning roles and responsibilities, and providing coaching.
  • Manage vendor relationships associated with the ticketed event function
  • Maintain close working relationships with all team members to ensure consistent brand messaging, alignment with marketing plans, and cross-promotion optimization

Qualifications:

Education:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Experience:

  • 5 to 7 years prior professional experience with either in for-profit or non-profit, through agency work, or other relevant experience.
  • Minimum of 3 years of staff management or supervisory experience required.

Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:

  • Excellent communication (oral and written), interpersonal, presentation and organizational skills an absolute must
  • Commitment to providing strong levels of customer support
  • Ability to be independent yet collaborative and team-oriented while possessing strong leadership skills
  • Ability to uncover actionable insights from quantitative analysis
  • Strong project management skills required
  • Drive and commitment to exceed goals in a high-pressure work environment
  • Ability to balance multiple priorities and project deadlines
  • Exceptional attention to detail; commitment to providing high quality work
  • Basic knowledge of HTML
  • Strong computer skills required

*LI-EH1

Apply now! Joining our team will provide you with the opportunity to make a difference every day.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Administrative Assistant to the Director of Engineering at Input Output HK - IOHK

Remote | International

Location: Remote

FULL-TIME

ALLOWS REMOTE

In 2015 IOHK founders, Charles Hoskinson and Jeremy Wood, set out to cause cascading disruption, committed to using peer-to-peer innovations to provide financial services to the three billion people who don’t have them. They knew back then that they had to first create a place that was designed to enable such unprecedented ambition. A place where incredibly talented individuals are actually empowered to put their best work into the hands of millions of people to build on and explore new ways of working together. As IOHK continues to grow, we hope that these principles will serve each new person joining our ranks.

Each and every role in our business is of equal importance to us. To that end, we are searching for individuals across all functions who display strong analytical skills and are constantly seeking to learn new technologies & solve complex problems. As a distributed team advanced communication skills and the ability to integrate seamlessly as a team member across different areas of the organisation is essential; as is resourcefulness and self motivation. Our people are curious and passionate about their work and we encourage an inclusive and collaborative environment where we support each other in knowledge sharing and personal growth. As a distributed team we use a variety of online communication on a daily basis and keep connected via Trello, Slack, GitHub, Hangouts.

Some projects that we’ve recently completed or are working on:

  • IOHK | A vision for blockchain in Africa
  • Cardano Whiteboard: Overview with Charles Hoskinson
  • IOHK | Cardano Testnets. May 2018

Summary

IOHK is recruiting an Administrative Assistant, to support the day-to-day activity of our Director of Engineering. We are searching for a highly organised, disciplined and motivated individual who can keep pace with the Director of Engineering’s busy schedule.

Duties

  • Contact people daily, weekly, fortnightly or monthly (depending on the case) to track progress on tasks that they have promised to do for the Director of Engineering.
  • Approve trip requests in our Finance system when the destination is a pre-approved event and pre-established rules are satisfied. Forward exceptional cases to the Director of Engineering.
  • Approve leave requests in our HR system when pre-established rules are satisfied. Forward exceptional cases to the Director of Engineering.
  • Prepare financial reports for activities of the Department of Engineering.
  • Check the list of contractors sent by Finance once per month.
  • Be a point of contact for other departments to raise issues asynchronously to the Department of Engineering.
  • Plan meetings and take detailed minutes.
  • Organize and schedule appointments.
  • Book travel and meetings hosted by Director of Engineering (including attendees, agenda, location, budget).
  • Groom the wiki space of the Engineering department periodically.
  • Filter emails and slack messages sent to the Director of Engineering.

Key Competencies

  • Applied knowledge of efficient time-management methodologies (GTD, Kanban, Scrum).
  • Ability to conduct meetings or participate in meetings efficiently.
  • Excellent writing skills (concise, unambiguous, grammatically correct).
  • Ability to keep documentation organized.
  • Ability to effectively use modern communication, documentation and management tools (wikis, issue trackers, email, messaging apps)

Education / Experience

  • Ideally three years relevant, senior level administrative work experience.
  • Experience working for both large companies with established structures and processes and for startups trying to figure out their structure and processes would be a significant stand-out factor.
  • Demonstrated written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to react with appropriate urgency to situations and events that require quick response.
  • The ability to deal with ambiguity and work independently to achieve results with a high degree of accuracy.
  • The ability to work effectively under pressure, within short time constraints, and prioritize according to the appropriate level of urgency and business value.
Apply for job

items.content:
Head of Performance Marketing // Honeypot

Company: Honeypot

Tags:
  • SEA
  • Growth
  • Performance

    • Honeypot is a developer-focused job platform. Our vision is to build the world’s largest worklife community for technical talent. We are strongly committed to the developer community, creating OSS documentaries, such asGraphQL, Elixir and Ember, and running large scale conferences such as GraphQL Conf.  In March 2019, we were acquired by Xing, who are investing heavily into our growth and expansion.

    We are looking for a Head Performance Marketing to own demand generation and acquisition across both B2B and B2C sides of our marketplace. You will report directly to a founder and work closely with the Brand Team who run our community platform (content, events, video). We want to work with someone who is creative, analytical and ready for a challenge. Some of your responsibilities include:

    We believe everyone should have a job they love

    • Grow, mentor and lead a performance marketing team, both in central HQ and in our remote office
    • Develop and own our acquisition strategy across both B2B and B2C user group
    • Set goals for the performance marketing team and work with Marketing Analytics to track the success
    • Manage and determine allocation of spend across channels to meet business goals
    • Work with Marketing Ops & Analytics to devise more intelligent, algorithmic and scalable ways of bidding for and deploying spend against user acquisition
    • Develop new paid and performance strategies to grow Honeypot’s audience, using alternative acquisition channels (among other methods)
    • Manage development and A/B of new creatives, creative types and landing pages, in collaboration with Design
    • Work with Product and Engineering to test performance optimization related to landing pages, tracking, and funnel conversion
    • Work closely with the Brand team to amplify video, content and events

    We hire for potential

    • 5+ years of experience in performance marketing and SEM, Facebook, LinkedIn and ideally for online marketplaces, ecommerce and/or listings sites
    • Leadership experience
    • Experience with email marketing
    • An experimental mindset, a passion for creativity and storytelling and strongly analytical outlook
    • Interest in people
    • Enjoy digging in and getting your hands dirty to take things to the next level
    • Proficiency in English (Dutch or German is a plus)

    Become part of our growing community

    • Join our growing team of over 35 nationalities
    • Autonomy: the chance to grow and develop a team in your vision
    • Creativity: close collaboration with a powerful brand team, who have produced successful documentaries and run 800+ people conferences
    • Growth: be part of a growing, well-funded company which plans to expand to over 10 markets in the next three years
    • And the fun (of course): a great social life with driven, motivated colleagues

    Honeypot is an equal opportunity employer, and encourages applicants from any national origin, sex, sexual orientation, religious background, gender identity and those individuals with disability.

    In your application please tell us your favourite channel and why :)

    Apply for this position

items.content:
Head of Content Marketing at Crossbeam

Remote

REMOTE · Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, United States · Marketing

DESCRIPTION

Crossbeam is growing fast. We’re developing a new category of software that allows companies to build more valuable partnerships through private and secure data sharing. We’re rapidly onboarding customers and are ready to show the rest of the business world who we are. That’s where you come in.

You will own the “category creation” playbook that defines and educates our target market. Initially, your work will be largely focused on content creation, but it will soon evolve into a player/coach role as we expand our content team under your leadership. Outputs will span whitepapers, blog posts, research reports, social media, marketing emails, customer communications, events, product messaging, and more.

Your job is to embody the voice of the company, and that means you have a strong passion for what we do, how we do it, the customers we serve, and the markets in which we work.

REQUIREMENTS

You think and move a bit faster than those around you. You’ve done something like this before, but think you can do it even better this time. You’re excited to learn the ins and outs of Crossbeam and spread our message in fun and inventive ways.

These are some of your traits:

  • 4+ years of experience developing content and influencing content strategy in high-growth B2B SaaS environments.
  • Strong writing and editing skills, including familiarity with the tools of the SaaS trade (APIs, major cloud software platforms, venture capital, etc.)
  • Experience with “category creation” tactics including community building, creating brand ambassadors, and standardizing new terminology.
  • A vision for how content strategy should intersect with work done in field marketing, product marketing, advertising, and other areas.
  • Ability to switch gears from big-picture strategy to execution and back again, all in the same day (or hour).
  • You speak your mind, have no issue raising concerns with other company leaders, but are also able to “disagree and commit” when things don’t go your way.
  • You believe in the value of Crossbeam and are excited to share it with the world.
  • You just read this whole list and got more excited than concerned.

BENEFITS

This is a full-time role offering the following benefits:

  • Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
  • Flexible PTO Policy
  • Free Food & Snacks
  • Stock Option Plan

This role can be based in Crossbeam’s Center City Philadelphia Headquarters, or remote anywhere in the US.

ABOUT CROSSBEAM

Crossbeam is a collaborative data platform that helps companies build more valuable partnerships. Our team is headquartered in Center City, Philadelphia, with some team members working remotely.

Our Values

  • Trust is Our Business: We create value by building trust in our company, our team, our technology, and our network. Never let anything compromise that trust.
  • Feed the Network: Our customer network is our most valuable asset. Prioritize its growth.
  • Equity: We will build a workplace that ensures everyone access to the same opportunities to share in our success.
  • This is Fun: Few people are lucky enough to do what we do. Follow the fun in every step of the journey.
Apply for job

items.title: Senior Project Manager
items.content:
Senior Project Manager at DockYard

Remote

Description

DockYard is digital product agency specializing in progressive web applications (PWAs). We are looking for a Senior Project Manager to join the team who is experienced with a range of work cultures, methodologies, and industries.

Who We Are

DockYard is a 100% remote software consultancy that specializes in web applications. We have in-house designers, developers, and project managers, and we are looking for an Engineering Manager to join our growing team. You’ll work alongside talented individuals on groundbreaking projects for the world’s largest companies.

What We Do

We help ambitious companies transform new ideas into fully deployed web applications. Our clients range from seed funded and early stage startups, who depend on us to define and deliver business-critical workflows, to established enterprise companies seeking fresh perspective and deep expertise on new projects.

The ideal candidate is a champion for diversity and inclusion, is self-driven, team-oriented, passionate about web technologies and industry best practices.

What It’s Like to Work Here

We offer a comprehensive benefit plan with a focus on providing an exceptional working environment. Some of these benefits include:

  • 100% Remote workforce
  • 100% DockYard paid medical, dental, vision, life & AD&D starting Day 1
  • 401(k) offered through Vanguard
  • Substantial paid time off
  • Conference stipend

Responsibilities

  • Use extensive knowledge of multiple project management frameworks to stay flexible and pragmatic across client industries, needs, and contract types
  • Encourage and facilitate close collaboration and open, transparent communication within all-remote, cross-functional product teams
  • Facilitate all product phase iterations, including project planning, client demos, retrospectives, release planning, and maintaining a living backlog of prioritized work
  • Conduct product estimation sessions utilizing the methodology most suited for the project type and scope
  • Deliver regularly updated project plans to communicate design and implementation details to internal and external stakeholders
  • Monitor the project budget and estimates, working with your team to achieve maximum value within the approved spend
  • Utilize risk management best practices to predict, prevent, and mitigate risks to project, product, and relationship
  • Collaborate with account management to identify areas of success, improvement, and opportunity — as well as lean on your own emotional intelligence and client relationship-building expertise in the day to day
  • Enthusiastically contribute to the evolution of DockYard-wide processes and best practices
  • Rigorously remove impediments to encourage focus and flow for your team

Must Haves

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in the software environment as a project manager or similar role
  • Demonstrated experience with UX design, software development, and web technologies in a scrum or other Agile environment
  • Ability to patiently learn, contribute, and persuade within a strategically growing, small company environment
  • Proven experience with and in-depth understanding of team empowerment and servant leadership, and the skills to balance empathy with the art of delegation
  • Ability to deliver and receive transparent and constructive feedback

Nice to Haves

  • Experience in and affinity the agency or consultancy context
  • Experience developing and maintaining long-term client relationships
  • Experience managing projects with all-remote teams
  • Familiarity with GitHub or other common project management tools

DockYard is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, political affiliation, personal appearance, pregnancy, family responsibilities, matriculation, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state, or local law.

This role is a U.S.-based remote position. This role is not eligible for visa sponsorship.

Apply for job

items.title: Head of Inbound Sales
items.content:
Airsorted’s sales performance is unrivalled in its field. No other company has grown at this pace and across so many geographies. We’re looking for a talented Head of Inbound Sales to take Airsorted’s global footprint to the next level, by leveraging the work of our world class growth function. 


This is a brand new and it role will report straight into a co-founder of the business. It is a London based role, managing global teams remotely. Some travel may be required. 


Airsorted runs a consultative sales process, so we’re looking for someone that is truly passionate about the client and that is able to inspire that same passion into others.


This person will:



  • be responsible for sales performance through from lead to live. 

  • work with our world class growth team to convert the thousands of leads generated each month. 

  • work closely with our global operations teams ensuring that client on-boarding is smooth. 

  • coach and mentor global city launchers.

  • own and deliver sales training globally.

  • own resource planning.

  • line manage a combination of sales managers and executives in various locations. 


This person will have...



  • 5+ years Sales experience (extensive experience of inbound sales and ideally some outbound too).

  • 3+ years management experience with proven results.

  • managed teams of 10+ before including other managers.

  • experience running call centres across multiple locations.

  • experience working with multiple languages and timezones is desirable

  • deep knowledge of Salesforce and ideally others.

  • very analytical with advanced Excel ability.

items.content:
Title: Project Coordinator Analyst
Please read job description in full. Must include cover letter highlighting experience applicable to requirements and qualifications outlined. Resume must reflect relevant experience.

Contract: 7 months
Pay: $21.59 / hr.
Location: Remote, anywhere in the USA
Work Authorization: Must be able to work legally in the U.S. without sponsorship
POSITION SUMMARY & KEY AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY:
Experience as Project Analyst or Project Coordinator desired.
  • Serves as single point of contact for escalations from vendors or customer in the post sales activities; Provides PMO support for customer deployment activity.
  • Resolves installation issues using multiple sources of information and by applying independent judgment and expertise.
  • Required to be responsive and aggressive in handling customer escalations and internal escalations.
  • Responsible for basic understanding of entire order fulfillment cycle and impact on role responsibilities; Raises any concerns over policy or policy interpretation with Project Manager.
  • Position manages scheduling, delivery and installation of client, customer procured and third-party products and services for client's customers.
  • Provides project coordination services (customer single point of contact, management reporting, billing, subject matter expert, etc.) in accounts that do not have Project Management representation.
  • Position is a key member of the project team responsible for coordinating the successful delivery of equipment and installation of the contracted services (internally and externally).
  • Utilizes defined processes and tools to ensure that each customer site/project is delivered and installed on time and is complete to meet the customer's expectations and in accordance with the documented scope of work.
  • Develop or assist in the creation and ongoing management of the rollout schedule
  • Update, track, and adjust the rollout schedule on a timely basis.
  • Identify installation risks, escalate and implement risk mitigation strategies
  • Recognize and document process/project improvements.
  • Create installation scheduling requests and ensure that all customer installation/deployment activity is scheduled and completed to the customer's satisfaction and per SOW.
  • Responsible for updating QuickBase (or similar) database with equipment and services data.
  • Coordinate post-startup activities (i.e. data gathering, team resources identification, installation processes distributed, data repository established, etc.).
  • Ensure that the requested site level activities are scheduled within standard process time frames
  • Provide the required delivery dates and locations for subsequent rollout or destination deferred orders to the Deployment Services centers.
  • Coordinate with other vendors as needed for delivery of equipment or services.
  • Escalate issues with maintaining the rollout schedule, as needed, and manage to closure.
  • Ensure any necessary billing data is provided to the appropriate parties.
  • Establishes and maintains communications with project team; Project team may include representatives of the customer, sales, BU, Project Management, Staging, Service Account Management, CS and any third-party partner(s).
  • Participates in scheduled meetings with key team members to review project feedback, tasks, action items and lessons learned.
  • Provide updates to the project status via QuickBase.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
  • 2-3 years of related experience.
  • PC proficient (Microsoft Windows, Internet Explorer and Microsoft Office including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook).
  • Customer focus
  • Excellent written and verbal communications skills.
  • Basic project management knowledge; Basic conflict management and negotiation skills.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, multi-tasking environment; Good time management and organizational skills.
  • Proven ability to identify and resolve issues with a sense of urgency.
  • Ability to work as part of a team or independently.
  • Detail oriented.
  • Payment processing software / firmware deployment services desired.
QUALIFICATIONS:
  • 2+ years of related experience.
  • Experience in the Financial, Retail, Telecom, or Entertainment Industries.
  • Willing to work non-standard business hours as required by projects.
Experis is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE/AA)

items.title: Remote Senior Project Manager
items.content:
Summary

As a Clinical Trials Project Manager, you are a valued resource and point of contact for clients, making your strong customer service and communications skills and ability to organize and manage multiple responsibilities extremely important.

STATUS: Full Time

LOCATION: ACM Global Laboratories - Remote

DEPARTMENT: Study Management

SCHEDULE: Days

ATTRIBUTES
  • Five (5) years of relevant experience in Clinical Trials, Project Management, and/or Clinical Research
  • Two (2) years of healthcare related experience or a minimum of twelve (12) months of project management experience required
  • One (1) year of full time remote experience or five (5) years of working remotely on a regular basis required
  • Excellent interpersonal, organization and management skills
Responsibilities
  • Customer Service. Act as client's primary point of contact; maintain a high level of customer service and satisfaction; display precision in delivery and flexibility in approach; assume full responsibility for study conduct, ensuring client goals and timelines are met; perform troubleshooting and problem-solving functions as needed
  • Protocol Management. Manage 10 to 25 protocols, depending on scope and complexity; review clinical protocols and assist with protocol set-up functions as required; develop the Global Laboratory Specification Document, Investigator Manual and protocol-specific Global Work Practice Instructions; develop protocol specific procedures as needed
  • Evaluation & Training. Evaluate and communicate monthly project metrics and analyses of all activity related to the trial, including monthly budget review; conduct investigator training sessions by telephone or at investigator meetings (involves overnight travel, frequently on weekend days)
  • Documentation Management. Assume responsibility for required study documentation and comply with standard procedures for collecting, maintaining and archiving materials in accordance with regulations and policies

items.title: Close: Director of Sales (100% Remote)
items.content:
Director of Sales (100% Remote)

About Us
At Close, we're building the sales communication and collaboration platform of the future. With our roots as the very first sales CRM to include built-in calling, we're leading the industry in sales automation—helping companies to close more deals, faster than ever. Since our founding in 2013, we've grown to become a fully profitable, 100% globally distributed team of 34 high-performing, happy people that are dedicated to building a product our customers love.

As the Director of Sales you will be reporting to the CEO, Steli Efti and working closely with the Director of Revenue, Nick Persico. 
About You
We are seeking a Director of Sales that will take ownership over a mature inbound sales funnel, continue to build the sales team, and help create a new gold standard in SaaS sales. This is a unique opportunity with a company that lives and breathes for the success of salespeople. You should be a highly ambitious, results-driven and self-motivated individual that strives for excellence.

We’re looking for a Director of Sales that knows what it takes to avoid these 10 mistakes.

About the Role
You will be responsible for the success of our Sales Team and lead the company in providing our customers with exceptional actionable sales advice they won’t find anywhere else.

Your responsibilities will include managing our entire inbound sales funnel (14-day free Trial to close) and driving 2x growth in new MRR in the first year (we’ll talk specifics). On-boarding, training, and managing a team of Account Executives (2-3 in 2019) will be also be in your wheelhouse.

You will collaborate with the Director of Marketing to increase conversion at the top of the funnel.

Requirements
  • More than 3 years of management experience of 10 people or larger in a remote environment 
  • Based in North America (preference for EDT or CDT)
  • Experience selling SaaS to small businesses
  • EXPERT command of the English language (written and verbal) 

Main KPIs
  • New Trial to Customer conversion rate
  • New customer growth
  • Total contract value (TCV) growth

Why Close?
  • 100% Remote (we believe in trust and autonomy)
  • 2 x annual team retreats ✈️ (Lisbon Retreat Video)
  • Competitive salary
  • Medical, dental with HSA option - 99% premiums paid (US residents)
  • 5 weeks PTO + 6 gov't holidays + Dec 24 - Jan 1 company-wide holiday
  • Paid parental leave (10 wks primary caregiver / 4 wks secondary caregiver)
  • 401k matching at 4% (US residents)
  • Paid 1 month sabbatical after 5 years
  • Our story and team
  • Glassdoor Reviews 

At Close, everyone has a voice. We encourage transparency and practicing a mature approach to the work-place. In general, we don’t have strict policies, we have guidelines. Work/Life harmony is an important part of our organization - we believe you bring your best to work when you practice self-care (whatever that looks like for you).

We come from 12 countries and 14 states; a collection of talented humans rich in diverse backgrounds, lifestyles, and cultures. Twice a year we meet up somewhere around the world to spend time with one another. We see these retreats as an opportunity to strengthen the social fiber of our community.

This team is growing in more ways than one - we’ve recently launched 8 babies (and counting!). Unanimously, our favorite and most impactful value is “Build a house you want to live in.” We strive to make decisions that are authentic for our organization. At Close, we have a high care factor for one another, in making an awesome product and championing the success of our customers. 

Interested in Close but don't think this role is the best fit for you? View our other positions.

items.title: Growth Operations Manager
items.content:
Growth Operations Manager at Remote Year

Remote | International

Location: Worldwide

Job Type: Full-Time

Role Description

The Growth Operations Manager will play a key role at Remote Year. This person will bring a vast toolkit of both sales and operations-related methods, practices, and ideas, and be equally adept at implementing those strategies into successful sales team operations. Combining the strength of execution with the ability to act as a thought partner and change agent within the sales vertical, the Growth Operations Manager will be a champion for the Remote Year sales team. This role will center around (1) Operations, (2) Salesforce administration, (3) Reporting, and (4) Analytics.

Responsibilities

  • Manage daily sales operations, including both strategic elements (processes, quota alignments) and operationally (tools)
  • Manage Salesforce: update workflows, debug issues, build reports, and handle other administrative tasks
  • Monitor key sales metrics, analyze results, and provide reporting and recommendations to the Head of Sales on appropriate actions
  • Work closely with the heads of Marketing and Sales to implement opportunities to improve sales management tools and processes that support sales strategy
  • Optimize sales efficiency by refining processes and making systematic enhancements and resolving operational inconsistencies and bottlenecks that are slowing down the sales team
  • Liaise with product teams, marketing, operations, admissions, and onboarding teams to ensure communication flow is timely, consistent and productive
  • Lead third party tool administration and contract/vendor management
  • Quickly and accurately perform detailed sales analysis in response to ad-hoc requests

Qualifications

  • 3-5+ years of sales operations experience in rapidly growing organizations
  • Salesforce Certification, and familiarity with other sales/customer tracking tools
  • Advanced Excel skills – confidently manage large data sets
  • Documented experience developing and managing sales methodologies, processes, policies and procedures
  • High level of ability to read, analyze and create reports on large complex data sets utilizing appropriate tools
  • Experience in marketing operations, both in process, reporting, and automation tools is a plus
  • SQL knowledge is a plus
  • Experience with Pardot is a plus

**This is a fully remote position that can be done from anywhere in the world**

Remote Year is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Apply for job
