items.content:
Project Manager at GeekHive

Remote
  • United States
  • Full Time
  • Project Management
  • Experienced

GeekHive is hiring a Project Manager who knows how to get things done. In this role you will be responsible for the successful delivery of marketing technology enablement projects for our clients. You’ll work closely with the smartest and most creative people in the industry to solve challenging problems and provide amazing experiences to our clients, our clients end users, and our team members.

As a central point of contact to our clients, you will have a significant influence on our company’s success. Doing this is no small feat. As a Project Manager you’ll demonstrate leadership skills to guide, coach, and motivate team members to reach their potential. Tactical skills such as managing Agile teams, time management, financial planning, issue management, meeting facilitation and status reporting will be necessary. None of our projects are one-size-fits-all. You’ll need to be comfortable sometimes navigating ambiguous project definitions and molding them into valuable end-products for our clients.

Successful candidates will possess:

  • Minimum of 5 years project management/leadership experience in an application development organization as an individual, team leader, and/or development manager
  • A record of driving successful delivery of web and/or mobile applications
  • Demonstrable understanding of the software development lifecycle (SDLC), application of Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban), and using them to effectively deliver technology products to market
  • Comfort with switching gracefully between strategic (project management, account management, etc.) and tactical (scrum master, requirements discussions, etc.) contexts as the situation demands.
  • Strong leadership, project management skills, time & budget management, and problem solving skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong organizational and coordination skills along with multi-tasking capabilities to get things done in a fast paced environment
  • Self-motivated and proactive with demonstrated creative and critical thinking capabilities
  • Previous experience developing web or mobile applications desired
  • Experience with Atlassian Jira & Confluence, or equivalents, desired
  • Knowledge of content management systems such as Sitecore, Drupal, Episerver, or WordPress desired

Successful employees will be:

  • Team players willing to work hard to ensure the success of the team, the project and GeekHive.
  • Curious – problem solving will not be a chore, but a welcome exercise to strong candidates.
  • Excellent communicators with the ability to conceptualize and articulate ideas clearly and concisely.
  • Personal ethics combined with career-oriented professional ambitions are must have attributes.

Successful employees will be:

  • Intellectually curious with a passion for personal development, learning, and teaching.
  • Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Problem solver who exercises sound judgment in complex situations.
  • Possess ability to provide strategic guidance and counsel to stakeholders in the assessment and development of existing and/or proposed processes and systems.
  • Self-motivated and proactive; works effectively with limited oversight and direction; attentive to detail; organized; ably manages resources, constituencies, projects of varying size, and multiple and competing priorities and deadlines.
  • Superior commitment to serving others with empathy, timeliness, accuracy, thoroughness, and professionalism.

We offer our team:

  • A friendly and fun work environment
  • Competitive base salary & bonus program
  • Comprehensive health and welfare benefit program
  • Paid time off
  • Employer contributed retirement plan
  • A ton of employee discounts and perks
  • Work life balance

The Gritty Details:

Please note: we do not provide relocation assistance or work sponsorship. This role requires authorization to work for any employer in the US without visa sponsorship.

GeekHive is an equal opportunity employer.

To all Agencies/Vendors:

We do not accept agency resumes. We are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Apply for job

items.title: Perry Street Software | VP Engineering | New York | Full-time, Onsite | https://www.scruff.com  ...
items.content:
Perry Street Software | VP Engineering | New York | Full-time, Onsite | https://www.scruff.com & https://www.jackd.com

Perry Street Software, owners of two of the worlds largest gay social dating apps, SCRUFF and Jack'd, is hiring a VP of Engineering. Ideal candidates have a minimum of 7 years of professional software development experience, 3+ years managing development teams, and have shipped major software projects. You will be responsible for managing projects distributed across a team of 15 engineers, some based in NYC and others based in remote home offices.

There are myriad skills our VP of Engineering must possess and cultivate, but the most important are sincere empathy, crystal clear communication, and technical excellence. These skills are equally weighted. The VP of Engineering is a hybrid role with one foot in management and the other in engineering, and acts as a liaison between project expectations and development tasks.

For more info, check out our website at: https://www.scruff.com/en/careers/vpeng

items.content:
Software Development Manager/Swansea/SQL/.NET C#/ASP.NET/Agile/Scrum

A successful, legal software solutions firm are looking to recruit a software development manager at their Swansea office on a permanent basis.

The main purpose of this role is to ensure high quality software components are developed by applying cutting edge software engineering practices. Responsibilities will include overseeing the development, implementation, and execution of project plans, ensuring scope and schedule are established for projects and assignments, and management of a team of engineering resources.

Main duties in this role:
Work closely with Product Managers and Scrum Masters to define and prioritize the product deliverables

Establish software development best practices

Conduct regular review with management on program progress, risk assessment with proposed resolution alternatives in the delivery of complex, cross organizational and technologically challenging projects

Establish and drive program schedule, review, analysis, and monitor of all critical paths related to key deliverables

Provide leadership in generating cross product and project task plans, resource planning, identifying interdependencies and risk management plans

Ability to communicate up and down the organizational ladder from CEO to front line software developer

The main skills and experience required for this role are software team development and the ability to mentor and inspire teams, experience of delivering complex products and a deep understanding of software development and experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies. It is also important that you have experience with Windows (.NET C#) based software projects.

Preferred Technical Skills include:
Perforce / TFS / GIT or alternative version control experience

Technical PC experience in a Windows environment preferred

Oracle and/or Microsoft SQL Server knowledge

Experience with Visual Studio for Web / Desktop / Server development

Microsoft .NET C#, ASP.NET MVC, HTML, JavaScript

2+ years of experience leading local and remote development teams

Experience with software test automation tools and CI / CD practice

If you are interested in this opportunity are keen to hear more please do not hesitate in sending your CV.
Swansea
Permanent

items.content:
Director of Marketing at Happy Tax

Remote
Director of Marketing (Remote – Work from Home – Anywhere in USA)
Company Overview

Happy Tax is the fastest growing tax preparation company three years in a row according to Entrepreneur Magazine. We operate multiple brands and websites including GetHappyTax.com, HappyTax.com, CryptoTaxPrep.com and CryptoTaxAcademy.com. What makes Happy Tax standout from other traditional tax preparation companies is we have patent pending technology that separates the front end from the back end of the tax preparation process. CPA’s focus on the tax preparation while franchisees and contractors take care of the initial sales. Happy Tax’s p technology and processes, gives customers a fresh new experience with none of the hassles traditionally associated with preparing their taxes, meeting them anytime, anywhere including house calls.

Job Summary

Work from home managing small department including Creative Director, Digital Marketing Ad Campaign Manager Implementer and Optimizer, Webmaster, Graphic Designer, Franchise Marketing Support and freelancers including, Digital video person and Motion video person. Some of those folks are already in our organization and some are being hired now which you can assist in. Must also have skills on web design and be proficient in creating great UX/UI for websites and app. Daily oversight to make sure we are continuing and accelerate our growth.

Responsibilities and Duties
  • Management, Oversight and Accountability over Dept
  • Franchise and Consumer UX/UI web/app design & development
  • Make sure marketing advertising is consistent, fresh and effective and growing the revenue for GetHappyTax.com, HappyTax.com, CryptoTaxPrep.com, CryptoTaxAcademy.com
  • Report results to CEO/Chairman on regular basis
Qualifications and Skills
  • HTML, javascript
  • Zapier and API’s
  • Search and Social Media Ads
  • Managing people
  • Working remotely from home with discipline
  • Working in a fast growing company and being a linchpin of growth
Benefits and Perks
  • Health Insurance or Stipend
  • W2 Employee
  • Stock Options

Location: US Locations Only

Apply for job

items.content:
BRD | Stealth Cryptocurrency Project | San Francisco, CA / Bend, OR / Chicago, IL / Tokyo, Japan / Remote Welcome

I [Samuel Sutch, CTO] am hiring for a stealth project team. Our main product, BRD, is a cryptocurrency wallet currently supporting over 150 assets. We are looking to add many more assets as well as dramatically improve the user experience in our app, as well as potentially develop new lines of business.

The two roles I am hiring for right now are:

- Senior Java Architect - will be tasked with leading development of the backend stack and owning architecture.

- Senior Devops Engineer - tasked with deploying and scaling out the system, automating deployments, monitoring, alerting.

Our stack is Java 11 / Spring Boot / Cassandra / Kafka / Zookeeper / Postgres. Our deployment target is multi-cloud with some dedicated hardware for certain services.

Our company is almost entirely remote, but we have some offices where groups of people are, primarily San Francisco, Bend, and Chicago. If you're in one of those areas, great, but there's no pressure to work from the office. You can read more about our mission here: https://brd.com/careers (note: these jobs are not yet listed there)

Please send your resume to sam@brd.com

CodeWeavers | St Paul, MN, USA | Full Time | REMOTE or ONSITE | General Wine and Open Source Developer | C-language systems programming

https://www.codeweavers.com/about/jobs

CodeWeavers is hiring skilled C programmers to work on the open source Wine project. A year ago, CodeWeavers partnered with Valve Software to integrate Wine into the Steam for Linux client as a part of the Steam Play (Proton) initiative. This allows Linux gamers to play Windows games on Linux more easily. We need new, full-time developers to improve Wine's ability to run games.

We are hiring remote workers, US or international, as well as local workers. We will consider relocation, if desired, on a case-by-case basis. Please see link above for information, benefits, requirements, and how to apply.

items.title: Hack Club (https://hackclub.com) | Director of Club Operations | San Francisco, CA or REMOTE ...
items.content:
Hack Club (https://hackclub.com) | Director of Club Operations | San Francisco, CA or REMOTE

Launched 3 years ago, Hack Club is a nonprofit global network of student-led hacker clubs across 35 states and 17 countries, impacting thousands of students each year. Our programs span hundreds of after-school clubs, dozens of student-led hackathons, a vibrant online Slack community with thousands of students, and a fiscal sponsorship (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fiscal_sponsorship) program that recently crossed $700K in transactions and frontpaged Hacker News a few months ago (https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=19257241).

We’re looking to bring in a Director of Club Operations to systematize and grow our primary program: clubs. You will own the end-to-end club experience, including processes to deliver high-quality mentorship to hundreds of club leaders worldwide, enabling Hack Club to scale beyond the number of calls our team can take in a week. If successful, this position will bring Hack Club from 2% of US high schools to becoming as ubiquitous and culturally foundational as the Girl Scouts and Boy Scouts.

This role has C-level freedom, as well as responsibility. You will be tasked with solving the most challenging problems Hack Club faces as a rapidly growing student network. You must be able to work creatively and autonomously to design life-changing student experiences that you can simultaneously maintain and deliver to an ever-growing number of students.

Some examples of challenges to overcome:

- How do we build a diverse and representative community of student leaders and enable leaders to do the same within their clubs?- How do we offer consistent value to students regardless of their financial background, making the club experience as powerful in Zimbabwe as it is in Cincinnati?- How do we provide high-quality mentorship and coaching to a large body of student leaders, and bring students into the process of onboarding other clubs?- How do we ensure that clubs survive the graduation of their leaders?

We need an obsessive, product-minded, operationally-excellent person with past experience growing direct-service programs and an intense focus on the student experience.

Interested? Email me at zach@hackclub.com with why you think you’d be a good fit for this role.

items.content:
Technical Services Manager

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead, Manager
Industry: Government, Libraries, Web Hosting
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Interpersonal Frequency | No office location

Technologies

web-services
php
html5
drupal
css3

Job description

Interpersonal Frequency (I.F.) is seeking a Technical Services Manager to add to its growing team. 

Why work with us?

  • Fun, cutting edge remote work environment – ever changing, always a chat away from team members 
  • Your work directly impacts the lives of millions of Americans every day 
  • Healthcare, and Dental/Vision/Life/Disability plans 
  • Unlimited vacation, and a flexible schedule 
  • Work in a mostly virtual environment or a coworking location. If you work virtually, be prepared to travel at least once a quarter for face-to-face with the team. 

Responsibilities 

The Technical Services Manager is responsible for overseeing and coordinating the technical staff, resources and processes required to achieve Interpersonal Frequency’s Purpose in alignment with its Principles and overall strategy. High level areas of responsibility include:

  • Software development (staff and function)
  • Development operations (DevOps staff and function)
  • Technical operations (policy, procedures, processes and tools)
  • Hosting operations (operation and maintenance of I.F. hosting infrastructure, related services and staff) 

While not primarily responsible for overall coordination or delivery, the Technical Services Manager is responsible for support of and critical contributions to:

  • The definition and documentation of I.F. standard products, services and general processes.
  • Client management strategy in general and resolution of technical conflicts or issues associated with particular clients.

Specific Duties

  • Provide team leadership, vision, direction, mentoring and management to geographically dispersed technical staff who design, develop and support I.F. products and services. Responsibilities include hiring, staffing, training, and performance management.
  • Collaborate with Solutions Portfolio Manager and Project Managers to plan, coordinate, and supervise activities related to the technical design, development, and implementation of I.F. client products and services. 
  • Develop, deploy, integrate, support and enforce technical best practices, standards, tools and processes: 
    • Identify gaps, improve and maintain team working processes and tools 
    • Scale technical staff to meet the demands of a growing business
    • Ensure that work packages and services are properly implemented not only technically but also in terms of timeliness and care with client interaction
    • Identify and exploit opportunities for technical efficiency (e.g. pattern, code reuse or automation) and consistency of technical deliverables
  • Provide direction on key project milestones from initiation to delivery and oversee scheduling and organization of interdepartmental activities to ensure completion of projects and products on schedule within budget:
    • Lead development of technical systems architecture plans, estimates, costs, and ensure projects meet strategic needs
    • Conduct technical team resource planning in support of work scheduling and I.F. growth
      • Derive technical work from client requirements
      • Monitor technical delivery and resolve issues
      • Collaborate with Solutions Portfolio Manager to adjust priorities/work assignments based on new requests, technical issues as they arise or business development-related requests
    • Communicate and coordinate with client-facing project managers, account managers, and I.F. management stakeholders 
    • Manage internal technical I.F. projects and standard maintenance activities (e.g. planned and unplanned activities related to security and optimization updates)
    • Coordinate I.F. technical response and troubleshooting activities
  • Establish and report on team goals and deliverables monthly
  • Act as management authority regarding I.F. technical products and services in client-engagement activities including but not limited to shortlist interviews and kick-offs
  • Responsible for technical escalations and related client facing communications support
  • Define and manage technical operational process with I.F. third party providers (e.g., Cloudflare)

Requirements

  • You must either be a US Citizen or already have a Green Card to apply
  • Strong people and management skills to interact with staff, colleagues, cross-functional teams, and I.F. clients.
    • Ability to drive a culture of quality and personal accountability 
    • Demonstrated ability to inspire trust in the team, other internal teams, and clients 
    • Ability to lead virtual teams in a matrix management environment by focusing on the people 
    • Ability to challenge, to ask “why” in a collaborative and supportive way 
    • Demonstrated ability to manage multiple complex issues/projects 
    • Demonstrated success in working in a highly collaborative team environment and ability to resolve conflict, while fostering a collaborative and communicative environment 
    • Ability to anticipate and adapt to changing conditions and opportunities 
  • Three to five years experience managing a remote technical team
  • Demonstrated ability to recruit, manage and retain geographically distributed technical teams, including performance management 
  • Seven+ years experience building software-based solutions (strong preference for candidates with Drupal experience)
  • Experience working closely with design and project teams throughout the software and infrastructure development life cycle:
    • Strong software development, design and architecture experience; commitment to quality demonstrated through the ability to translate complex technical requirements into functional software using best practices.
    • Strong process orientation and experience integrating tools to ensure seamless service delivery.
    • Conversant in technology used in front/back-end development; HTML5, CSS3, CMS module/theme customization, PHP, Javascript/AJAX, database modeling, user stories, unit testing, comps and wireframes.
    • Familiar with the principles of source control (e.g., Git or similar) and deployment strategies
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, the ability to interface effectively with senior managers, business partners and clients, and the discernment to sense of when to strongly advocate for a position and when to seek compromise. 
  • Demonstrated critical thinking and problem solving skills grounded in the attitude that every challenge is an opportunity to improve.
  • Available to travel to various locations across the United States
  • Demonstrated commitment to I.F. Purpose & Principles based on employment history and experience and interview(s).

Interpersonal Frequency LLC is an Equal-Opportunity Employer.

Apply now

About Interpersonal Frequency

At I.F., we’re putting the government in the cloud. We design, build, maintain, and grow sites on our open source, highly available web stack for some of the largest cities, public libraries, and government agencies in the country. Our company’s purpose is to make government online more relevant, accountable, and responsive to everyone. We also created a suite of proprietary analytics tools that survey 3.4 million Americans each day. We are growing quickly and are looking for several new positions, including this management role, to continue to deliver cutting-edge, open sourced websites for our clients.

I.F. is a 10 year-old company with team members in Seattle, Chicago,  Denver, New York, and the DC area, among others.

We provide a remote work environment, so you don’t need to move for this job. We encourage face to face collaboration in our regional offices and expect you to travel when required. As a purpose and principles-driven organization, we want talented team members who want to make a difference.

Working remotely means we can bring together some of the best minds in the country. Between video calls and Slack, the distance evaporates quickly, and ideas, projects and puns fly at the speed of light. Working remotely also allows us to find harmony in work / life balance.

Benefits

  • Unlimited vacation policy
  • Access to training's and conferences in your field
  • 401(k) available by the end of this year
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Three competitive medical plans to chose from
  • Dental and vision plans
  • Long and short term disability insurance
  • Employer paid life insurance

items.title: Delivery Manager (Project Manager)
items.content:
Delivery Manager (Project Manager) at Truss

Remote
Truss tackles tough technical problems for the private sector and government. We use modern development practices to build software, streamline infrastructure, and train others through exposure to our teams.
Truss is a software consultancy known for pragmatism, empathy, expertise, and trust. We build strong relationships with our clients, contractors, and employees; we believe that this is fundamental to doing great work. As a Truss Delivery Manager you will facilitate our teams’ delivery while demonstrating our core values. We look to this role to foster a healthy and predictable work environment by creating new processes where there are gaps, continuously improving existing processes, or removing unnecessary processes when they no longer serve the team.
We are seeking delivery leaders who will have a significant impact on the services offered by the government to US citizens. This position is for a level 3 or 4 delivery/project manager as described in our leveling guide. As a company, Truss advocates for a healthy work/life balance. We actively cultivate an energetic environment that is respectful of your personal and time boundaries, while allowing you to continuously enrich your skill-set alongside a team of curious, caring, and helpful people.
Here’s what we hope you’ll bring:
  • Superlative communication skills, in person and in writing
  • Familiarity with agile development patterns and the tools and processes that support them (sprints, standups, retros, etc.)
  • Familiarity with a distributed work environment and the tools and patterns that enable this to succeed (Zoom, Slack, GSuite, etc.)
  • Ability to evaluate project health and provide regular status to the rest of the leadership team, including recommendations for areas of improvement
  • Ability to identify, manage, and organize competing priorities, and collaboratively come up with plans to address them
  • Ability listen well, change perspectives, and resolve conflict, with an emphasis on team outcomes over individual outcomes
  • Ability to track and manage complex functions essential to project success (e.g. project budget, contract compliance, project onboard/offboarding, etc.)
  • High attention to detail
  • (bonus) Experience working with government systems and/or bureaucracy
This position will allow you to: 
  • Work with a high-performing agile product delivery team
  • Have a positive impact on users of government systems
  • Work with project leadership to support team needs
  • Facilitate cohesion and collaboration within the team to create a more efficient and enjoyable working environment
  • Work as part of a distributed team, sometimes involving travel
  • Identify, elevate, and help resolve project risks
  • Build relationships with clients with diverse backgrounds and needs, and help them to help us succeed
  • Hack bureaucracy

If you have more experience than is reflected here, that’s great! We’ll be pleased to tap into your broader, deeper skill set. We value inclusion and welcome diverse viewpoints. You must be eligible to work in the US and you must reside in the US. Unfortunately, we are unable to sponsor work visas at this time. We encourage all interested candidates to apply!

Apply for job

items.title: Associate General Counsel, Claims
items.content:
Associate General Counsel, Claims at Markel

Remote

Company Information:

What we look for

Our exceptional and motivated employees are our greatest strength. Our employees provide the highest level of customer service and help maintain our position as a leader in the global marketplace.

Markel Style

The Markel Style is what makes us stand out from our competitors. It’s our core value which should underpin how we do business, while influencing our behavior and performance. We are looking for people who have potential and share our passion to live the Markel Style, which is described in more detail below.

If you think you have these core attributes we want to hear from you.

Job Summary:

  • Associate General Counsel, Claims is a technical resource within the Markel Claim Organization; assists with providing consistent interpretation and application of policy coverages across all business lines; manages claim matters involving allegations of bad faith or which seek extra-contractual damages against Markel companies; assists in reviewing pleadings, motions, release and discovery in declaratory judgment actions filed on behalf of the Company or filed against the Company which do not allege bad faith; coordinates with Corporate Legal on specified matters of regulatory compliance.
  • Associate General Counsel, Claims is a critical thinker in case-management; engages in independent analysis and evaluation of claims involving allegations of bad faith, which seek extra-contractual damages, or in which such exposures are alleged or may be created by the handling or outcome of a non-extra-contrctual matter; engages in independent analysis of cases handled by other product lines on an as requested basis; makes recommendations to the Assistant General Counsel, Claims on cases requiring elevated review and approval. Acts in a consultant role in case conferences.
  • Associate General Counsel, Claims identifies training opportunities and assists in providing training to the Claims Staff as needed
  • Associate General Counsel, Claims is accountable to contribute in every way possible to execute established initiatives.

Job Responsibilities

  • Manage matters involving bad faith allegations or which seek extra-contractual damages against Markel, including notification to Senior Claims Management and the Legal Department of potential Errors & Omissions exposure
  • Manage matters involving suits against the Company which involve underwriting and claims issues, regulatory issues or issues of importance to Markel, where we reasonably believe the claim will be amended to addbad faith allegations or to seek extra-contractual damages
  • For those Divisions which do not have designated Associate General Counsel, Claims to provide coverage advice, provide advice to Claims Examiners, Managers and Directors in the areas of coverage interpretation and coverage application
  • Review proposed declaratory judgment actions and makes a recommendation to the underlying Claims Director as to whether such actions should be filed.
  • Review pleadings, affidavits, corporate disclosures (as requested), draft discovery responses and settlement agreements in suits against the Company
  • Assist in reviewing and responding to policy limit demands, 93A notices, civil remedy notices and 998 demands
  • Assist in deposition preparation
  • Provide technical guidance to Examiners, Managers and Directors on an as requested basis
  • Provides training as to bad faith and on other topics on an as requested basis
  • Review potential rescission actions and provide recommendations to Underwriting and the underlying Claims Director for proceeding
  • Participate in case conferences with Examiners, Managers, Directors and /or Underwriters on an as requested basis and ad hoc basis
  • Review and/or drafting of correspondence to personal counsel for insureds and business partners as requested.
  • Provide information to business partners about changes in the legal environment
  • Coordinate with Corporate Legal on matters of regulatory compliance
  • Complete quarterly surveys on suits against the Company
  • Assist in reviewing responses to claims-related Department of Insurance Complaints and/or Civil Remedy Notices
  • Presentations to Claims and Underwriting as requested
  • Assist with special projects as requested

“Why work for us?”

Diversity and inclusion

Markel is truly a global and diverse company. We believe that diversity makes us better business partners and that embracing people’s differences can bring amazing results and fuel innovation. We have a portfolio of businesses and product lines that operate around the world.

Community involvement

Markel has a rich heritage of supporting communities across the world where our customers and employees live and work. Giving back is part of our history and our future. Our employees share in this philosophy through volunteering, mentoring and fundraising.

Commitment to open doors

Markel is committed to creating the best work environment. Our open-door policy is essential in recognizing business issues as they rise and to address the changing needs of our diverse and global workforce. Challenging management is a component of the Markel Style—some of our best ideas start from a conversation between a manager and an employee.

Entrepreneurial spirit

As the Markel Style states, we pursue excellence, strive for a better way, and share the success of others. Markel associates proactively seek new business opportunities, bringing further success to Markel.

Full time

items.title: Principal Technical Program Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Principal Technical Program Manager at InVision

Remote | International

Location: Remote

InVision is the digital product design platform used to make the world’s best customer experiences. We provide design tools and educational resources for teams to navigate every stage of the product design process, from ideation to development. Today, more than 5 million people use InVision to create a repeatable and streamlined design workflow; rapidly design and prototype products before writing code, and collaborate across their entire organization. That includes 100% of the Fortune 100, and organizations like Airbnb, Amazon, HBO, Netflix, Slack, Starbucks and Uber, who are now able to design better products, faster.

Our team is in search of a Principal Technical Program Manager to help us change the way digital products are designed.

About the Team:

As a Principal Technical Program Manager, your role is to plan and deliver large, complex projects. You will work closely with multiple teams across engineering, design, and product management to scope, estimate, and prioritize work. You will manage programs from beginning to end to ensure we are delivering amazing results. Success begins with an idea and culminates in a successful launch and beyond.

What you’ll do:

  • Build strong relationships with leaders across Engineering, Design, and Product Management
  • Develop program plans & schedules covering all phases of the program lifecycle
  • Keep the cross-organizational/cross-functional team focused on the most important issues impacting execution
  • Manage and track program execution to ensure successful, high-quality, on-time delivery
  • Suss out and understand the bottlenecks in the system and ruthlessly open them up including making and communicating tradeoffs
  • Communicate clearly and regularly to executive stakeholders
  • Anticipate, recognize and work through risks, resistance or setbacks

What you’ll bring:

  • 10+ years of experience delivering large programs and excellent results
  • Technical experience and knowledge of developing SaaS products – grounded in modern web technologies and agile processes
  • Passion for building partnerships and experience leveraging those to achieve success
  • Mastery of communicating and influencing at multiple levels
  • Relentless passion and persistence and a focus on meeting commitments
  • Variety of ways to visually and verbally represent program level status to multiple audiences
  • Software/digital design experience is a plus!

About InVision:

InVision offers an incredibly unique work environment. The company employs a diverse team all over the world. Each InVision team member is given the freedom and tools to do their best work from wherever they choose.

The benefits we offer in the United States and Canada include competitive health plans and retirement plans. Some InVision-wide benefits offered to all employees across the globe include a flexible vacation policy, monthly coffee shop stipends, annual allowances for books related to your profession, and home office setup & wellness reimbursements. InVision is an international employer so some benefit offerings will vary from country to country.

InVision is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Junior Services Project Manager at Ciena

Remote
  • Remote-US
  • Full time
  • R010676

Ciena may well be the most important technology company you’ve never heard of. The innovations that wow us (driverless cars), and those we now take for granted (the ability to mobile-stream your favorite show) are the products of ingenuity from some brilliant and forward-thinking companies. But those companies rely on Ciena, another vanguard of innovation, to create and advance the underlying networks that bring their breakthroughs to our doorsteps. VR, AI, IOT, 5G … literally none of it would be possible without the mind-boggling technology that makes the internet itself work. For more than 25 years, Ciena has been the global leader in networking strategy, and our technology has been part of the critical infrastructure running within the most advanced companies in the world.

What will you do at Ciena?

SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Assist Service or Sr. Service Project Managers in providing overall management for implementation of medium to large size E,F&I projects, with medium/high complexity, within a Customer network.
  • Primary responsibility of Junior Service Project Managers is to work with more senior Service Project Manager and assist with all aspects of project management in order to become fully proficient in core competencies such as resource management, project planning, managing project financials and managing project execution
  • Collect all relevant project information required to scope and budget project deliverables
  • Coordinate all required project resources and well as providing support to manage those resources during execution
  • Coordination of of required project deliverables to customer

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Accountable for Services (E, F & I) Project Financials, Timelines and Quality
  • Validate Project “Scope of Work” against Sales Order to Develop detailed project plan
  • Provide Project SOW Package to Functional teams to facilitate Internal Resource Planning and/or Partner RFQ’s
  • Make certain that deviations to the project schedule are investigated and properly followed up
  • Works closely with Engineering, Resource Management and Partners on project implementation within the E, F & I Services Organization
  • Partners directly with internal and external customers to translate requirements into structured and executable tasks and milestones
  • Facilitate communication between internal groups, internal functions, and outside suppliers/customers as necessary in support of the project execution
  • Document and communicate project status, obstacles, risk assessments and resolutions
  • Accountable for developing and coordinating carefully designed and approved action plans to successfully complete E,F & I projects
  • Assure all parties maintain close communication and coordination regarding project status and milestones
  • Maintain project schedules and report to Management regularly or as agreed
  • Participate in, or lead, process improvement initiatives as assigned
  • Provides input to department budgets as assigned

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

  • Bachelor’s degree in related field (business management, project management or engineering) from a college or university
  • Some experience in field operations or supply-chain operations
  • Experience with Microsoft Office Suite

CANDIDATE PROFILE

  • Customer Focused – Takes personal responsibility, demonstrates responsiveness and corrects issues promptly.
  • Critical Thinking / Analysis- Understand Basic relationships and sees straightforward linkages.
  • Judgment – Evaluates situations objectively and makes straight forward decisions.
  • Decisiveness – Delivers routine decisions
  • Organizational Awareness – Understands formal and informal structure of the organization
  • Outstanding planning, scheduling, and coordination skills
  • Superior Communication, Organization and Leadership Skills.
  • Is self motivated and can work from high level departmental goals
  • A team player that will work well in a cross functional team environment
  • Must have proficiency with various software applications including Microsoft Office (Word, PowerPoint and Excel).

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of personnel so classified.

Rewarding experience. Meaningful outcomes.

Making a difference in people’s lives through design and implementation of leading network technologies. That’s what motivates us.

A distinct way to work

Free thinking, free discussion, and collaboration are the norm. Expect more satisfying outcomes – both personal and professional.

Ciena values the diversity of our workforce and respects its employees as individuals, regardless of race, nationality, religion, sexual orientation, gender or age.

Ciena is also committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. If contacted in relation to a job opportunity, you should advise Ciena in a timely fashion of the specific needs / accommodation measures which must be taken to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. Information received relating to any specific needs / accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.

What you can expect from us

  • You will receive notification of your successful application
  • Successful applicants will be contacted by Talent Acquisition for an initial discussion
  • If suitable you will be considered for the short list and our formal interview process
Apply for job

items.title: Director of Business Operations
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Director of Business Operations at FindKeep.Love

Remote

Work From Home // Remote Position

The Role:

We are looking for a driven Director of Business Operations to maximize our company’s operating capabilities, oversee optimizations, and guarantee client satisfaction. This position presents an opportunity to work from home for a growing marketing company that values efficient, smart, high-performing employees. The Director of Business Operations will collaborate with management to execute business strategies, manage our full-funnel client service operations and guarantee client retention and acquisition.

The right candidate will have a strong analytical background, excellent organizational skills, and a passion for working in a fast-paced, startup environment.

The Company:

We are experts in customer acquisition, and our site FindKeep.Love is a growing sweepstakes platform that allows brands and consumer-facing companies to acquire more customers via online sweepstakes and email marketing campaigns.

We are a team of fast, sharp, high-performing executors, and we’re looking for like-minded individuals who love to build products and get things done.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Provide optimization recommendations and strategic planning to improve daily and long-term business processes
  • Prepare and complete action plans — implement production standards and quality checks, resolve problems, and identify trends
  • Forecast goals, analyze variances and initiate corrective actions to ensure company and team success
  • Analyze process workflow, employee bandwidth, hiring needs, and tech optimizations
  • Manage growing Sweepstakes Partnerships Team to ensure strong production, happiness, and daily task completion
  • Serve as primary point of contact when there are customer / client issues related to customer service, quality, or onsite mishaps
  • Work closely with GM and Management Team to set and/or implement policies, procedures and systems to follow through with implementation
  • Work closely with cross-functional partners to perform analyses of sales and marketing funnels and ensure we are utilizing our services effectively

Please provide your salary requirements in the cover letter section of this application. Those without this information will not be considered for this role.

Education and Experience:

A candidate with a bachelor’s degree with excellent communication skills. 3-5 years of operations service experience preferred. MBA a plus, but not required.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Demonstration of critical thinking capabilities, exceptional analytical and quantitative; an ability to turn data into optimizations
  • Exceptional planning abilities and attention to detail
  • Strong knowledge of Excel: pivot tables, vlookup, etc
  • Comfort with analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics)
  • Ability to project manage/prioritize multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Naturally curious and are driven to find creative solutions that others haven’t considered
  • Comfortable within a fluid and fast-paced environment
  • Strong communication skills
  • Ability to work as a team member, as well as independently.
  • Dependable with proficient attention to detail
  • Ability to delegate, motivate, and get the job done
Apply for job

items.title: Head of Operations and Content
items.content:
*UENI* is a “do-it-for-me” solution that sets us apart from DIY website builders and expensive digital agencies. We take an innovative approach to getting small businesses online by reducing the friction for a business owner to do so. UENI structures the data it collects from a business and creates a website for each business and listings on other high traffic platforms. We thus enable these businesses to complete online for the first time.


Today we are signing up 2000 businesses every day and we operate in the UK, Spain, France, the USA, LATAM, India and we are growing our global presence every month.


As the Head of Operations & Content, you will oversee all initiatives around creating the customer website and other online and offline presence, across multiple platforms and formats to drive quality, engagement, retention, and positive customer behaviour. Where we refer to ‘Content*’, this refers to *customer content within the UENI product.
The position collaborates with the departments of product, marketing, customer service, dev and human resources to help define both the content strategy and new content creation, the day to day operations of the content team and the reporting processes for the benefit of other departments.


This opportunity is targeting someone process-minded, highly literate, extremely ambitious and keen to take a lot of responsibility. We are moving fast and our content team is central to our continued successful growth.


*Responsibilities*
Ultimately, your job is to work as an operations manager, leading the development of content initiatives to drive growth in the content offered to the various categories of business, the completeness and granularity of categorization and most importantly the daily management of content teams across multiple markets and locations.


This includes:

* Ensuring all content is created according to the company plans of rapid expansion in new markets, consistent in terms of quality, efficiency, and optimized for search and localized user experience for all markets. This is to be done for each market and category.
* Mapping out a content strategy that supports and extends marketing initiatives, both short- and long-term, determining which methods work for the different markets and categories. Continuous involvement of strategy is a must amidst fast-paced growth in different languages.
* Developing a timeline for content creation across business categories, languages and markets, and defining the owners to handle the stages of content creation and quality control.
* Supervising content team, writers, quality control; to be an arbiter of best practices across the content team. .
* Developing standards, systems and best practices (both human and technological) for content creation, venue build, quality control, assistance to Customer Success dept, and adaptation to evolving needs based on UENI’s business strategy
* Integrating content activities within the product and marketing scope of work.
* Conducting tests to gauge content effectiveness. Gathering data and handle analytics (or supervise those who do) and make recommendations based on those results. Working with owners of particular content to revise and measure particular content and marketing goals.
* Leveraging market and CS data to drive plans and adjustments in content team activities.
* Working with the product and technical teams to implement improvements of content team tools to ensure efficiency, cost reduction and daily productivity.
* Conducting periodic competitive audits.
* Ensuring consistent global experience and implement appropriate localization/translation strategies through an appointed representative for each language.
* Leading the hiring and supervising of the content team in all markets and roles.

*Requirements*

* Bachelor’s degree in English, Journalism, Public Relations, Operations or Business. Project Management or Marketing experience is a plus.
* At least 5 years of experience managing a team and staffing – Either deep experience in digital content creation (websites, social media, directories etc.) or in operations management/project management.
* Technically savvy and hands on: able to jump into company tools to manage processes, review content quality, and ensure that team productivity is adhering to business plan targets
* Multilingual abilities a major plus.

*Skills Required*
The HOC requires a combination of operation management and content management, with the most important aspect being to think “customer first”. In essence, the HOC is the creative and operation manager that must be empathetic toward the pain points of the customer whilst being able to deliver an efficient content creation strategy with the team.

*Specific* *skills **required* *include*:

* Proven editorial skills. Outstanding command of English (or primary customer) language.
* The ability to lead and inspire teams of creative personnel and content creators to achieve the company’s stated goals and targets (eg growth in subscriber base, growth in paying customers, reduction in unit costs).
* Leadership skills required to define and manage a set of goals involving diverse contributors in various markets.
* Project management skills to manage venues creation and quality control schedules and deadline. Ability to work under pressure and in a dynamic environment.
* Skill at both long-form content creation and real-time (immediate) content creation.
* Business-minded and driven by data to improve processes, improve efficiency, and increase quality of content to better meet customer needs
* The ability to think like an educator, intuitively understanding what the customers need and how they want their businesses to be represented online.
* A passion for new technology tools (aka, using the tools you preach about) and previous experience in the usage of those tools.
* Excellent negotiator and mediator.
* Incredible people skills and a willingness to work with remote teams and colleagues around the world.
* Basic technical understanding of web publishing, editors, website builders, etc.
* A willingness to embrace change and to adapt strategies on the fly.
* Great reporting skills
* Committed to continually learning the latest platforms, technology tools and solutions through interaction with product department, in particular the CMS.

items.content:
Software Development Manager/Swansea/SQL/.NET C#/ASP.NET/Agile/Scrum

A successful, legal software solutions firm are looking to recruit a software development manager at their Swansea office on a permanent basis.

The main purpose of this role is to ensure high quality software components are developed by applying cutting edge software engineering practices. Responsibilities will include overseeing the development, implementation, and execution of project plans, ensuring scope and schedule are established for projects and assignments, and management of a team of engineering resources.

Main duties in this role:
Work closely with Product Managers and Scrum Masters to define and prioritize the product deliverables

Establish software development best practices

Conduct regular review with management on program progress, risk assessment with proposed resolution alternatives in the delivery of complex, cross organizational and technologically challenging projects

Establish and drive program schedule, review, analysis, and monitor of all critical paths related to key deliverables

Provide leadership in generating cross product and project task plans, resource planning, identifying interdependencies and risk management plans

Ability to communicate up and down the organizational ladder from CEO to front line software developer

The main skills and experience required for this role are software team development and the ability to mentor and inspire teams, experience of delivering complex products and a deep understanding of software development and experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies. It is also important that you have experience with Windows (.NET C#) based software projects.

Preferred Technical Skills include:
Perforce / TFS / GIT or alternative version control experience

Technical PC experience in a Windows environment preferred

Oracle and/or Microsoft SQL Server knowledge

Experience with Visual Studio for Web / Desktop / Server development

Microsoft .NET C#, ASP.NET MVC, HTML, JavaScript

2+ years of experience leading local and remote development teams

Experience with software test automation tools and CI / CD practice

If you are interested in this opportunity are keen to hear more please do not hesitate in sending your CV.
Swansea
Permanent

items.title: VP of Engineering
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=4, go=3, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
VP of Engineering

Company: SafeBoda
Location: Barcelona, ES
Level: Senior
Language: English
Product/Project Management
Skills:
  • Engineering Management
  • Hiring
  • Product Roadmap
  • Team Leadership

    • Intro

    Motorcycle taxis are immensely popular and serve as the lifeblood of many cities in Africa, but they are extremely unsafe and disorganized. At the click of a button, SafeBoda provides a safe, more convenient, mobile-first transportation platform for Africa’s booming young population.

    On the high-frequency use of our transportation service, SafeBoda is providing value to consumers, our drivers, and passengers, with additional financial services, payments, and other on-demand services to keep Africa moving forward. We have a passionate and highly engaged team and we are looking to quickly grow it to speed-up the organization’s growth and make sure we can revolutionize transportation and cities.

    At the heart of Poblenou (the centre of innovation and technology in Barcelona), and 600m away from the beach, SafeBoda opened late 2018, the Barcelona Tech Hub.

    We are a venture-funded company, just completing a Series B financing, that is already having a huge impact for millions in East Africa.

    In November 2018, SafeBoda was announced among the 2018 AppsAfrica award winners at an event held in Cape Town, South Africa. SafeBoda beat four startups from Nigeria and South Africa to become the Best African App.

    Our Product Team

    Operating in Uganda, Kenya and in the next few months also in Nigeria and Tanzania, SafeBoda is expanding rapidly.

    In order to develop the best products, we believe that diversity and shared knowledge are key, that’s why currently we have 2 offices for our Product Team:

        • HQ in Kampala with CTO and Head of Product based there
        • Barcelona Tech Hub

    Any new candidate can decide where to live and work while contributing to our mission. We try to ensure that new hires go to Kampala for some weeks to experience the product regardless of where they will be based.

    Our Product & Engineering team is currently represented by 11 different countries!

    Right now we are looking for a VP of Engineering who will be the head of SafeBoda's Engineering function.  You will lead the continued growth of the engineering teams with an emphasis on fostering a strong engineering culture.

    For more information about our company, product team and stack, click here. And if you want to know more about our product, you can also download our applications for Android and iOS. 

    As a VP of Engineering at Safeboda you will:

    • Lead, mentor and inspire a distributed engineering team to perform at a high level and deliver world-class products
    • Recruit, develop, and scale a talented technology team committed to developing innovative solutions aligned with the company’s business model, values, and vision
    • Lead the development, establishment, and application of measures and best practices for people growth and development
    • Create a positive culture to maximize productivity and minimize attrition
    • Utilize performance review cycles to reiterate expectations and discuss methods to achieve and exceed them
    • Act as a strong advocate for quality in the product development process for software engineering
    • Manage the overall operational, budgetary, and financial responsibilities and activities of Engineering
    • Plan and implement systems and processes to fulfil the mission and the goals of the Engineering efficiently and effectively
    • Establish and maintain relevant controls and feedback systems to monitor and ensure the success of the team
    • Partner with the CPO to align long term technical strategy with product strategy

    Main requirements

    • At least 10 years of overall engineering experience
    • At least 5 years of experience leading engineering teams
    • Degree in Computer Science or any related field
    • Experience managing successful engineering teams (remote-based a plus) including hiring/terminations and performance management
    • Knowledge of current trends in software design, architecture and web services 
    • Works comfortably in a collaborative setting, and is comfortable working with executive leadership
    • Willing to travel frequently to our engineering hubs
    • Fluent in English

    Perks

    • Flexible work hours - We’re pretty ﬂexible when it comes to managing workload and time. It’s about delivery! You can start from 8h to 9.30h and on Friday leave at 15h!
    • Discovery days - Every 3 Fridays we spend the whole day to hack, read, talk to customers, try a new experience... explore and create what you want to!
    • Vacation - up to you! - You can freely pick when to do your 24 days of vacation
    • Grow yourself  - At SafeBoda, learning is a habit. We empower people and we want you to grow with us. Tell us the areas you wish to improve in and if it makes sense for the business, we’ll do what we can to help you do just that
    • Free water and coffee
    • Be part of a passionate team that is changing the mobility landscape in Africa
    • Opportunity to travel to East Africa and interact with the product and our multi-cultural team

items.content:
Creative Director (2D Courses) at School of Motion

Remote
School of Motion is looking for an experienced Creative Director to lead up our 2D Design & Animation curriculum.

We are on the prowl for an experienced CD who is ready for a new type of challenge. School of Motion produces extremely comprehensive, effective, and unique Motion Design courses that run on our custom learning-management-system. Our classes feature world-class instructors, challenging homework assignments, an engaging community, and a team of industry-pros working as teaching assistants to help our students achieve success.

As Creative Director, your responsibilities will include:
  • Working with our Course Production team to plan out and develop a comprehensive 2D Design & Animation curriculum.
  • Working alongside our producers and instructors to develop detailed outlines for new courses.
  • Developing creative for new classes, including lessons, examples, exercises, interviews, and more. Sometimes this may mean fleshing out a made-up brand with made-up advertisement that relies on made-up creative and a made-up script. You’re building worlds, here.
  • Ensuring the highest-quality of all course materials. Providing feedback to instructors as they create lessons.
  • Coordinating / directing artists and studios as needed. We are constantly hiring outside talent to build assets and creative for our classes.
  • Working with our Marketing team to help promote our courses and curriculum. In addition, help develop content for our YouTube channel, podcast, and blog.
  • Helping to identify and to vet Instructors and Teaching Assistants.
  • Traveling a few times per year to oversee video shoots for course content, marketing elements, and annual company retreats.
Required / Desired Skills & Experience
  • 7-10 Years of experience in the industry at a minimum, ideally in high-level roles at a top studio, agency, or company.
  • Expert-level knowledge of the most common tools in the 2D Motion Design pipeline. (After Effects, Photoshop, Illustrator). Knowledge of additional tools is a bonus.
  • Strong writing skills are required. CD’s will often write scripts, treatments, and various other copy.
  • Strong background in Animation & Design required. Knowing the tools is not enough.
  • Editing chops are a huge plus, as you may need to produce animatics / edits as part of course development.
  • Strong interpersonal skills are a must.
  • You must be comfortable speaking on camera. Hamming it up is encouraged.
  • Having a large rolodex of designers, animators, and other talented folk is a huge bonus. We work with freelancers and studios all the time, and existing relationships always make that process smoother.
Salary & Benefits
  • Salary is dependent on experience, but this is a senior-level role and the salary will reflect that. $100K+.
  • We cover 100% of your health insurance and a portion for your spouse and children. Dental and Vision insurance are also available.
  • We have an extremely flexible time off policy.
  • Access to a 401K plan after one year of employment.
  • Profit based bonus program.
More Details
  • This is a full-time, senior-level position with a competitive salary + benefits.
  • While School of Motion does not discriminate on the basis of citizenship or national origin, we may only employ United States citizens and people who are authorized to work in the United States. As long as you meet that criteria, you can work from wherever that is comfortable for you! We’re a fully remote team that primarily operates on Eastern Standard Time, and if you are local to Sarasota, Providence, Detroit, or Los Angeles then you can come work with us in person.
  • We have a very flexible schedule at School of Motion. Most of our team work on EST time, but we’re a results-driven company, not an hours-driven one. There are, of course, deadlines and scheduled meetings / activities, but for the most part you are given autonomy with regards to your schedule.
  • Saying that we have a very casual work environment is an understatement, just be you.
Our Core Values:

Our core values embody our team dynamic and our voice. We are rebellious, helpful, effective, playful, and curious. If you would like to work with us, you should be all of these things too:

  • Rebellious: We don’t like to do things just because they’ve always been done that way. Be skeptical of the status quo and constantly improve.
  • Helpful: There is no such thing as “not my job”. Help out in any way you can, and don’t hesitate to reach out for help.
  • Effective: We do things fast and smart. We automate if it makes sense. We skip the meeting if its not immediately beneficial to the mission.
  • Playful: No Bad Vibes. Don’t take yourself too seriously, it’s only Animation.
  • Curious: Have interests, pursue them ruthlessly. Share your weirdness.
About School of Motion

School of Motion was founded in 2013. Since then, we have served thousands of students from all over the globe in our quest to break down the barriers to learning, mastering, and working in the field of Motion Design.

We are a fully-remote company with a team that is distributed across the United States.

School of Motion is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind.

School of Motion is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at School of Motion are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, family or parental status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

Worried about confidentiality issues? Don’t be. Your application to School of Motion will be submitted in confidence, directly to the hiring staff. 

Location: US Locations Only

Apply for job

items.title: Director of Active Defense
items.content:
Director of Active Defense at Auth0

Remote

Location: Remote

Auth0, a global leader in Identity-as-a-Service (IDaaS), provides thousands of enterprise customers with a Universal Identity Platform for their web, mobile, IoT, and internal applications. Its extensible platform seamlessly authenticates and secures more than 2.5B logins per month, making it loved by developers and trusted by global enterprises. Auth0 has raised more than $110 million to date and continues its global growth at a rapid pace. We are consistently recognized as a great place to work based our outstanding leadership and dedication to company culture, and are looking for the best people to join our incredible team spread across more than 35 countries!

Auth0 gives companies simple, powerful and developer friendly building blocks so they can free up resources to focus on innovation. We strive to be the identity platform of choice of developers and Enterprises. We take our culture very seriously and are looking for people who are drawn to both our mission and our culture.

We are a security company and Auth0’s Security team is in the privileged position of supporting a security first culture for a company that wants to make the internet safer.

We are looking for a Security leader to run our Security Operations department within the Auth0 Security Engineering organisation. This includes running dedicated teams focused on Detection and Response, Cloud Security and general Security Operations. You don t have to have run a SecOps team before, but you need to have been part of leading a team doing it well. You need to be a passionate people manager, and you need to be ready to take the next step in your career.

This is an exciting time to join Auth0 as we are growing quickly and this role is an opportunity to drive the expansion of our Security team.

Auth0, a global leader in Identity-as-a-Service (IDaaS), provides thousands of enterprise customers with a Universal Identity Platform for their web, mobile, IoT, and internal applications. Its extensible platform seamlessly authenticates and secures more than 2.5B logins per month, making it loved by developers and trusted by global enterprises. Auth0 has raised more than $110 million to date and continues its global growth at a rapid pace. We are consistently recognized as a great place to work based our outstanding leadership and dedication to company culture, and are looking for the best people to join our incredible team spread across more than 35 countries!

Auth0 gives companies simple, powerful and developer friendly building blocks so they can free up resources to focus on innovation. We strive to be the identity platform of choice of developers and Enterprises. We take our culture very seriously and are looking for people who are drawn to both our mission and our culture.

We are a security company and Auth0’s Security team is in the privileged position of supporting a security first culture for a company that wants to make the internet safer.

We are looking for a Security leader to run our Security Operations department within the Auth0 Security Engineering organisation. This includes running dedicated teams focused on Detection and Response, Cloud Security and general Security Operations. You don t have to have run a SecOps team before, but you need to have been part of leading a team doing it well. You need to be a passionate people manager, and you need to be ready to take the next step in your career.

This is an exciting time to join Auth0 as we are growing quickly and this role is an opportunity to drive the expansion of our Security team.

Responsibilities

  • Create a vision for modern cloud-centric security Operations at scale.
  • Develop a roadmap for that vision and be accountable for its delivery.
  • Lead teams of Security Engineers to deliver great security infrastructure and develop the leaders of those teams.
  • Collaborate with our other Internal Security Engineering and Compliance teams to build a single Security vision for Auth0. And, build strong relationships with external security teams and organisations.
  • Build processes, frameworks and metrics to improve delivery and measure your success.
  • Hire a diverse team – fostering a collaborative and an inclusive environment.
  • Develop a strong relationship with Auth0 s Product Engineering teams; influencing their roadmaps

Requirements

  • Several years of experience in a security engineering management role.
  • Previous experience working as a Security Engineer and delivering engineering projects. I.e. you are still technical enough to contribute to key design decisions.
  • Proven record hiring and attracting talented Engineers in this competitive market.
  • Great organisational and project management skills.
  • You re an excellent communicator and are comfortable working in a distributed environment.
  • Comfort managing a remote, globally distributed team.

Extra Points

  • Exposure to agile release processes and supporting tools and infrastructure.
  • Experience managing other managers.
  • Experience in a high growth start-up environment, building and iterating on teams to match a high rate of company-wide growth.
  • Experience in large scale Cloud Environments.

Auth0 is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Auth0 conducts all employment-related activities without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, genetics, or status as a Vietnam-era special disabled and other covered veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Auth0 participates in E-Verify and will confirm work authorization for candidates residing in the United States.

Apply for job

items.content:
Head of Marketing

We are looking for a creative and ambitious marketing professional to become an integral part of our expanding start-up business, PRELO.

PRELO began with a simple idea. An idea cultivated with one single laptop and a desire to create something special. Now it has been defined as a platform that has the potential to disrupt the property rental industry, and we want you to join us as we continue our expansion in the UK market.

So what actually is PRELO?

PRELO was born to create a world where anyone can feel at home anywhere; with convenience and community at its core.

Whether you are moving from one neighborhood to another or one city to another it is a complete pain in the ass! You waste so much time on different websites and apps to research neighborhoods, to find accommodation, to negotiate with landlords, to set up utilities, and everything else that comes with moving to a new location.

Why not let PRELO do it for you? PRELO leverages technology to help streamline the entire moving process from housemate and home discovery, right through to community engagement in your new location.. Marry that with our dedicated community management team and you have all you need to move and feel at home, anywhere in the world.



PURPOSE OF THE ROLE

The Head of Marketing is a key role which will drive brand awareness and revenue generation across the UK and EMEA regions. Head of Marketing has strategic responsibility for Marketing and Brand Management, as well as PR and Communications which includes, but not limited to; visual identity, brand tone and the creation and distribution of marketing content across online channels.



KEY FOCUS AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY

- Developing a new business and marketing strategy that builds brand awareness and long-term revenue streams for the business.

- Develop, with the CEO, a dynamic and ambitious senior leadership team to drive the business through its accelerated scaling projections.

- Manage the new company branding project to identify and create a globally recognisable brand that reflects the overall vision of the company.

- Full autonomy to develop and lead the overall marketing and brand strategy.

- Strengthen brand activities through compelling and creative storytelling marketing activities.

- Building, managing and motivating a people-focused team via coaching, mentoring and training. Plus dealing with day-to-day issues that may arise.

- Proactively developing relationships at C- level with prospective clients. (Initial focus is creating brand awareness within fortune 5000 organisations; in particular within the HR, Recruitment and Global Mobility business departments)

- Providing thought leadership within the PRELO organization, to our clients, and at industry events, developing networking opportunities and maintaining a positive external profile.


Requirements:
- A strong background in Digital Marketing.
- Strong knowledge of content strategies and social platforms.
- Come with a mindset of being invested, involved and helping in all areas of the business.


This is not an ordinary role in an ordinary company, it is much much more. It is suited to someone who is a leader, who works off their own initiative and thrives in an environment where they can be given the freedom to implement your own ideas and methods.

The person will have the ability to build their own team from the ground up to drive PRELO to be a globally recognisable brand

Salary is negotiable and this role will also include shareholder equity within the company

Location: Negotiable. Flexible and Remote options available.


Underlying Principles when working with PRELO

- Empathy: the ability to understand and share the feelings of your audience, colleagues and stakeholders.
- Think like a media company first.
- Creative Content is Key.
- Speed: get s**t done, don’t get hung up on approvals, do first and learn later.
- Accountability: Are you happy to stand over the work you are doing?
- Provide Value: Provide more value to your colleagues, employees and stakeholders than you ask for.
- Communication: transparency with your colleagues and stakeholders.
- Have fun, be cheeky, focus on a healthy work/life balance and respect your colleagues, stakeholders and target audience.
