items.title: Independent Drug Monitoring Manager
items.content:
Independent Drug Monitoring Manager at PRA Health Sciences

Remote

Job Locations: (All) | US-Remote

ID: 2019-55415

We believe that our people are the future of the industry. We provide a culture in which our employees can enjoy personal satisfaction, professional achievement and have the ability to strategically map out long-term career plans. If you’re ready to be a part of something inspiring join us and Discover Your PRA.

Who are we?

We Are PRA.

We are 16,000+ employees strong, operating in more than 90+ countries. We are committed to saving lives and we are constantly striving to be the best at what we do. Our impact is real and we see it every single day. We help get life-saving drugs into the hands of those who need them most.

Responsibilities

What will you be doing?

Supports the execution of clinical trials in the area of unblinded drug management. Responsible for the general facilitation of the Independent Drug Monitoring process between the IDM Team and the study team.

  • Lead study teams in management of CROs for IDM process; including (input to) the development of pharmacy related materials (e.g, forms and manuals) and system set-up (e.g, IVRS and EDC).
  • Resolve and document urgent/critical unblinded and pharmacy related issues and investigate trends (IDM)
  • Ensure existence and accuracy of relevant IDM process documentation, communication and monitoring plans
  • Ensure adherence to timelines and quality of the IDM process and follow up with vendors appropriately to resolve any issues
  • Act as the main point of contact for resolution of any ad-hoc questions associated with IDM issues
  • Provide input to refine GCO IDM process in alignment with stakeholder needs and in compliance with systems, and strategies by identifying innovative process improvements, determining feasibility, and collaborating with appropriate parties to implement when appropriate
  • Work proactively to increase global awareness of IDM processes and train and educate stakeholders
  • Work closely with stakeholders that are globally located
  • Contribute to ensuring optimum utilization of resources and compliance with project deadlines for IDM
  • Oversees all (Lead) IDM activities
  • Reviews IDM monitoring visit reports (initiation, periodic & close-out) (defined %)
  • Monitors status and resolution of major/critical issues via Issue logs and visit report review process
  • Translates, documents and escalates major/critical issues to GTM and the trial’s medical monitor in a blinded manner
  • Provide inputs in audit CAPAs
  • Assist in database locks in reviewing unblinded queries (if needed)
  • Provides updates to GTM on pharmacy-related and compliance issues in a blinded fashion
  • Ensures training is provided to the (Lead) IDMs and staff involved in the management of TTs.
  • Potential of Co-monitoring of IDMs and Lead IDM
  • Potential for Management of day-to-day operational support of IDM
  • Identify and promote best practices. Adhere to SOPs, ethics and departmental compliance as determined by GCO management as well as R&D companies, corporate, HCC and QA guidelines
  • This is not an exhaustive, comprehensive listing of job functions and tasks. Other duties may be performed as assigned.

What do you need to have?

  • University or Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in appropriate scientific or business disciplines.
  • Candidate is required to have at least 5 years of experience in clinical trial operations.
  • Fluency in English.
  • Experience in project management and/or logistics is mandatory.
  • Must demonstrate innovative spirit, strong interpersonal and leadership skills and complex project management.
  • Knowledge of databases and/or project management systems is also a plus.
  • Previous work in an international environment desirable.

To qualify, applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States, and should not require, now or in the future, sponsorship for employment visa status.

PRA is an EEO/AA employer and is committed to providing opportunities to minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities.

Apply for job

items.title: Director of Human Resources
items.content:
Director of Human Resources at Mattermost

Remote

SAN FRANCISCO BAY AREA OR REMOTE

PEOPLE

FULL-TIME

At Mattermost, we value high impact work, ownership, self-awareness and being focused on our people and customers. If these values match who you are, we hope you’ll learn more about working at Mattermost and reach out to talk to us!

Mattermost provides an open source enterprise-grade messaging platform to the world’s leading organizations that allows teams to collaborate securely and privately anywhere. With over 10,000 server downloads/month our customers include Uber, Tesla, Bank of America, Samsung, Affirm, The US Department of Defense and more. Our private cloud solutions offer secure, configurable, highly-scalable messaging across web, phone and PC with archiving, search, and deep integrations with hundreds of SaaS and on-premises technologies. Our company serves customers around the world with a distributed organization spanning the globe.

About the Role:

You will have a direct hand in driving the next phase of growth at Mattermost. This is an exceptional opportunity to optimize how we scale a fast-growing startup while providing a world-class employee experience. The ideal candidate is an experienced and passionate leader who has helped influence and build a great and high performing culture at an early to mid-stage growth startup. In addition, we are seeking a leader familiar with or passionate about a remote-first culture.

Responsibilities:

  • Formalize Global HR Ops and Infrastructure: Create, implement and maintain scalable processes, tools, systems and training necessary to support the employee experience and business needs globally
  • Managing, operating and reporting from HR systems including BambooHR, TriNet, Lever and other systems as developed
  • Efficiently manage fast-paced HR operations that support Mattermost rapid global growth plans
  • International and multi-state compliance and compensation – Work with in-house and external advisers to ensure compliant HR operations
  • Fair compensation and benefits internationally tied to local market and talent and opportunity profiles, along with company levels and descriptions
  • Global PEO selection and management
  • Strategic HR Advisor: Be a trusted adviser to the executive team and managers on operational and strategic People initiatives and decisions including talent development, talent management, performance management and rewards
  • On-boarding: Refine and build-out our on-boarding process to rapidly ramp new hires into high functioning team members aligned with clearly defined cultural values and norms
  • Talent Development: Working with senior leadership to implement training and performance management programs that rapidly and strategically grow our managers and individual contributors
  • Voice of our Colleagues: Guide leadership on making Mattermost an amazing place to work by connecting with managers and individual contributors in a remote, distributed, multi-time zone organization to discover and understand the specific and broad sentiment across the company with a mix of surveys, group and 1-1 conversations
  • Diversity and Inclusion: Partner with leaders to develop and execute a diversity and inclusion strategy as a competitive advantage enabling Mattermost to source from a broader, underrepresented talent community.

Requirements:

  • A successful track record building, evolving and delivering people operations programs from the ground up in a fast-growing organization
  • Eight plus years of broad-based People/HR leadership, building and implementing operational programs, with at least three plus years managing teams
  • Experience in Human Resources / People Operations including Operations, Engagement, Development and Rewards
  • Experience building relationships with distributed teams and success in a remote-first culture
  • Developing and implementing Performance Measurements
  • Demonstrated experience creating and executing a metrics-driven, consultative service-oriented People strategy for a global organization
  • Strong interpersonal savvy and self-awareness with strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Undergraduate degree in business, human resources or equivalent professional experience preferred
  • Enterprise software start-up experience is preferred
Apply for job

items.content:
Senior Project Manager – Cardiac at Registry Partners Inc

Remote

Job Overview

  • The Senior Project Manager of Cardiac Registries is responsible for the abstraction of CathPCI cases using the NCDR data dictionary and specification manuals.
  • As Senior Project Manager of the Cardiac Registries, this individual will be abstracting cases to keep their skill set current and assist with case abstractions to meet deadlines, if needed.
  • This individual will follow and maintain the project parameter/project roadmap document as the individual job description for each project assignment, as well as utilizes all industry related reference manuals (data abstraction specification manuals/resources), interpreting and applying all rules successfully.
  • The Senior Project Manager of the Cardiac Registries will be expected to meet Validation Expectations as outlined in the Validation Policy and Procedure;
  • meet defined Productivity Standards within four weeks of abstracting on a new project for each case type assigned; complete all tasks related to project implementation, setup and training of assigned project;
  • completes project related documentation as outlined in the Registry Partners standard procedures;
  • manage NCDR CathPCI projects in accordance with ACC/NCDR and/or regulatory requirements, as well as RP policy/procedure; supervise NCDR abstractors by managing workflows, task assignments, trainings, validation of work, and documentation; consult industry-related Q & A resources as needed;
  • consult with Registry Partners Management/Validation teams for abstracting questions/clarifications as needed; and consults with Registry Directors and Senior Vice President as appropriate, to evaluate client questions and concerns before responding.
  • The Senior Project Manager must have a willingness to potentially learn/cross-train/transition to other NCDR projects and be accountable for and follow, assigned work schedule and fulfill committed work hours each week.
  • The Senior Project Manager of Cardiac will primarily interact with Clinical Data Abstractors for the projects he/she is responsible for managing each week;
  • as well as working directly with Validation Managers and other Senior Project Managers, Executive Management Team members, IT Support, Security Team members, and with existing and potential clients.

We are seeking Full-Time candidates who have current experience in both NCDR Cath and PCI.

Qualifications

Requirements and Experience:

  • A minimum of 1 year of current data abstraction experience with the NCDR Cath and PCI registry, 2 – 3 years of current experience preferred
  • Experience and current abstraction work history of other NCDR case types (ICD, CP-MI, TVT, LAAO, etc.), preferred
  • At least one year experience in management, preferred
  • Computer savvy and proficient in utilizing NCDR industry data abstraction specifications manuals, data abstraction software systems and EMR applications
  • Willingness to learn/cross-train/transition to other NCDR projects
  • Personal Computer with Windows 8 operating system or higher
  • High-Speed Internet Access (5 Mbps Download & 2 Mbps Upload speeds)
  • Successful completion of pre-employment skills assessment exam

Certifications/Licenses/Degrees:

  • Active Registered Nurse (RN), Registered Health Information Administrator/Registered Health Information Technician (RHIA/RHIT), or Certified Professional in Healthcare Quality (CPHQ), preferred

Other Skills:

  • Must be reliable, responsible, and dependable
  • Initiative to identify and solve problems
  • Displays staffing ability and mentors as needed
  • Understands priorities and adapts to change in task assignments
  • Deals with challenging situations with professionalism while maintaining composure
  • Abide by strict confidentiality regulations as defined by HIPPA and company policy
  • Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal), as well as highly organized, proficient time management and critical thinking skills
  • Ability to work independently

Compensation/Benefits

All team members are employees of Registry Partners, Inc., not contractors. Employees have a flexible schedule, achieve a work/life balance, and can work remotely from all 50 states. Full-time staff members have peace of mind through our full-time guarantee and a full benefits package including:

  • Medical, dental, and vision benefits
  • Paid time off
  • Paid continuing education time
  • Paid holidays
  • 401K retirement planning
  • Short-term disability
  • Life insurance
Apply for job

items.title: Campaign Director
items.content:
Campaign Director at UltraViolet

Remote

Location: (Multiple states)

Department: Campaigns Team

Type: Full Time

Min. Experience:Experienced

UltraViolet is hiring a Campaign Director to help us create a real cost for sexism in the U.S

About UltraViolet:

In 2012, UltraViolet was launched to harness the collective power of millions of people to advance women’s equity through rapid-response digital organizing.

Since then, UltraViolet has been the premier national organization elevating all of the issues that impact women’s lives across identity–from intimate partner and state violence to health care to economic policy–to a national audience. Our goal has been to prove that sexism and rape culture exist by using rapid-response campaigns to expose the impact of the problems on women’s lives, create public accountability, and advocate for solutions.

To do that, over the last seven years, we’ve built and are sustaining a community of 1.2 million committed and engaged activists in every state and congressional district across the country and ignited a new wave of feminist activism.

Moving ahead, UltraViolet will focus on building an intersectional feminist community online by creating compelling stories and offering ways to take action that center the voices and perspectives of women of color, Indigenous women, and LGBTQ people. It is these stories–from our members and our staff–that will drive demand for the kind of changes women need.

If fighting for a world beyond patriarchy, where people of all backgrounds and identities thrive with freedom and dignity, is your passion–UltraViolet is the organization for you!

UltraViolet is an organization run by women, immigrants, people of color, Indigenous women, and LGBTQ+ people. Sexism disparately impacts us, and we strongly encourage people from these and other impacted communities to apply.

Job Description:

  • UltraViolet is wrapping up a multi-month strategic planning process that is shifting the direction of the organization from a singular focus on large-scale digital organizing to a more specific focus on culture change work and talking to politically unengaged women, in conjunction with running robust digital campaigns on issues that impact the lives of women.
  • The person in the Campaign Director role will be part of a team transitioning methodologies, testing new strategies, and honing a laser-sharp focus on making UltraViolet’s vision for the world–a world beyond patriarchy–a reality.
  • You should have a proven ability to run high-profile, rapid-response campaigns that engage hundreds of thousands of people and garner national media attention.
  • If you have an instinct for spotting breakout campaigns, an eye for media-worthiness, and a sharp sense of strategy, this position is for you.

These are the required skills for this position:

  • Five to eight years working in digital campaigning, organizing, communications, advocacy, or other relevant experience
  • Proven experience running scaled digital campaigns
  • Sharp strategic and advocacy knowledge and instincts
  • Experience working in intersectional feminist organizing and/or racial justice organizing
  • Experience managing complex projects from start to finish, independently and as part of a team
  • Proven writing ability in a relevant setting (think action alerts, not articles)
  • Knowledge and experience managing political and cultural issues that primarily impact women, in a fast-paced, rapid-response, media-driven environment

We’re hoping you’ll bring one or two (or more) of these bonus skills:

  • Experience with communications and media strategies, and a proven track record of generating earned media
  • Experience growing member email lists, both paid and organic
  • Experience fundraising from a membership list
  • Experience with and understanding of cultural organizing or electoral politics
  • Experience working with ActionKit or a relevant member database CRM

You will thrive in this role if you’re someone who:

  • Likes the idea of working remotely, since we are an all-remote organization
  • Is comfortable juggling multiple tasks and can thrive in a fast-paced environment, independently or as part of a team
  • Is an excellent project manager and can manage a project seamlessly from start to finish
  • Is able, willing, and excited to turn on a dime when opportunity knocks

Perks of working for UltraViolet:

  • Full health, dental, and vision for employees and generous coverage for your family
  • Four to six weeks of vacation and 12 paid holidays
  • 401(k) with a 5% employer contribution
  • Sixteen weeks of parental leave, plus support for childcare for work-related events and travel
  • A team with a top-notch GIF game and a #pets slack channel, that gets surprise presents (sometimes purple cakes!), and knows how to have fun while getting a lot done in a low-ego environment

Salary:

The salary range for this position is $70,000 to $80,000, plus a home office stipend based on the cost of living in your location.

UltraViolet is an equal employment opportunity employer and does not discriminate against applicants or employees because of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, citizenship status, disability status, genetic information, sexual orientation, or gender identity or expression of an otherwise qualified individual, or membership in any other class protected by applicable law. UltraViolet hires and promotes individuals on the basis of their qualifications for the job to be filled. We strongly encourage diverse applicants to apply.

Apply for job

items.title: Program Director
items.content:
Program Director at One Warm Coat

Remote

Position Description

National non-profit One Warm Coat seeks Program Director. Full-time position working in a virtual office environment. Interested candidates should send a cover letter and resume to onewarmcoat@onewarmcoat.org by July 31, 2019. One Warm Coat is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity.

ABOUT ONE WARM COAT:

One Warm Coat is a national non-profit organization that provides free coats to people in need. Since One Warm Coat was founded in 1992, the organization has facilitated the collection and distribution of more than 6 million coats to children and adults across all 50 states.

POSITION OVERVIEW:

The Program Director will report directly to the President and CEO and will provide support and direction for the Coat Drive Program, Bulk Coat Donation Program, and the Crisis Coat Fund. The Program Director will also manage One Warm Coat’s relationship with over 1,000 nonprofit partners across the United States and ensure that One Warm Coat is compliant with laws and regulations across all 50 states in which it operates. Finally, the Program Director will coordinate the use of the CRM database and process all donations and gift acknowledgements.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Provide excellent customer service to more than 3,500 Ambassadors who hold coat drives each year as part of the Coat Drive Program
  • Manage the Bulk Coat Donation Program, including soliciting and tracking donations of overstock and irregular coats and stewarding the relationships with the donors
  • Handle all details of the Crisis Coat Fund including ordering coats, organizing the warehousing and shipping, and tracking which agencies have the highest need for coats
  • Develop and implement a comprehensive plan to build and maintain strong relationships with One Warm Coat’s non-profit partner agencies
  • Create a process to track One Warm Coat’s compliance and annual registration with more than 40 states
  • Coordinate the use of the CRM database and process all donations and gift acknowledgements

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Candidates for the Program Director position must have:

  • 3 to 5 years of experience working in a non-profit organization
  • Commitment to providing exceptional customer service
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Self-motivation and the ability to work independently, while meeting all deadlines
  • Superb organizational skills and attention to detail
  • Experience in successfully managing multiple projects simultaneously

SALARY AND BENEFITS:

  • Virtual office environment with flexible hours
  • Salary range is $47,000 to $51,000
  • 11 paid holidays each year and 3 weeks paid time off
  • Simple IRA plan
  • Insurance is currently not provided or available
Apply for job

items.content:
Head of People Operations at Wave

Remote | International
  • International Remittance Team

Our mission
In 2018, immigrants worldwide sent over $600 billion home to family and friends, dwarfing foreign governmental aid. In the age of cheap, quick transfers through services like Paypal and Venmo, these people are trekking to stores to pay fees averaging over 7% for transfers that typically take 24 hours or more.

Wave’s mission is to change that by making sending money anywhere in the world easy and affordable. Since 2014, our app has allowed Africans in the US, the UK, and Canada to send money instantly to mobile money wallets & bank accounts in Kenya, Uganda, Ghana, & Tanzania, saving our users over 70% relative to Western Union and MoneyGram.

We recently piloted remittances to Nigeria, where we’re growing quickly, and are looking to scale our team (and team processes) to enable even faster growth. That’s where you come in…

How you’ll help us achieve it
We view our collective culture, valuesand habits as a product whose users are the employees — a product that needs to work well and grow if our remittance product is to change the way money is moved worldwide. We’re looking for someone to work directly with the CEO and management team to shape the direction and scaling of the Wave People product — by recruiting, managing and retaining the diverse team we’re assembling to achieve our mission. We want to build the world’s best remote workforce and workplace, and we’re in it for the long run.

Responsibilities will include:

  • Deeply understand, shape, and be an ambassador for our culture, values, and habits
  • Articulate the story and principles of Wave by interviewing employees
  • Make sure culture is propagated to new hires
  • Make sure recruits see and experience the culture during the hiring process
  • Design strategy and process to attract and retain a high-quality diverse team
  • Update the performance measurement and compensation/benefits strategy
  • Design and execute employee surveys to get actionable feedback on management and culture
  • Develop hiring process stages that address bias in hiring pipeline and job descriptions
  • Ensure employees keep growing throughout their time at Wave
  • Design strategy and process for internal communications and management, including:
  • Playbooks, processes, and tools to make communication just work (synchronous and asynchronous) for our distributed team across three continents
  • Playbooks, processes, and tools to maximize the value of our weeklong quarterly company retreats
  • Lead the People team (currently one recruiter and two generalists) and set the execution bar for achieving all of the above

Key details

  • Location: Our company is 100% remote. You can be based anywhere in the the United States, Canada, United Kingdom, Germany, France or Belgium.
  • This is a permanent position

Major benefits:

  • Subsidized health insurance and retirement contribution matching (both vary from country-to-country)
  • 26 weeks fully paid parental leave and subsidized fertility assistance
  • Unlimited vacation with a 20-day minimum requirement
  • $10,000 annual charitable donation matching

Requirements

  • Native or fluent English.
  • Local work authorization (wherever it is you’d like to be based).

You might be a good fit if you

  • You were the #1 or #2 people leader through the scaling phase of a startup.
  • Have managed successful teams and have the metrics & references to prove it.
  • Are intellectually curious, creative in the way you go about tackling problems, and embrace failure as a means to spark innovation and growth.
  • Possess a bias toward action and testing, and are analytical in your approach.
  • Are persuasive and can convince others to pursue a course of action.
  • Live by and champion our values, including: ruthlessly prioritize, embrace embarrassing honesty, and always put users first.

Bonus points if you

  • Have significant experience working on a remote team as it scaled to 100+ people.
  • Are familiar with the diasporas we serve.

Our team

  • Our team of 30-odd engineers, finance & compliance professionals, marketers, & people ops professionals as well as nearly 60 customer support personnel are fully distributed across North America, Europe, and Africa-working from coffee shops, homes, and coworking spaces- making us one of the larger fully distributed growth-stage startups in the world.
  • Each quarter, we go on a five-day retreat together. In 2018, we’ve been to Vancouver, BC (Canada), Lisbon (Portugal), Austin, TX (USA) and Burlington, VT (USA).
  • We play in bands, teach dance classes, run Vipassana retreats, played semi-pro basketball, and built tools to help Doctors Without Borders respond to the Ebola crisis.
  • We collectively speak over twenty languages, including Akuapem, Amharic, Ewe, Fante, Ga, Igbo, Kalenjin, Luganda, Oromo, Somali, Swahili and Wolof.
  • We’re backed by world-class investors including Khosla Ventures, Founders Fund, Y Combinator and the cofounders of PayPal.

How to apply

  • Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. If interested, please apply via the box below with a cover letter and resume.
  • Confidence can sometimes hold us back from applying for a job. But we’ll let you in on a secret: there’s no such thing as a ‘perfect’ candidate. Wave is a place where everyone can thrive. So however you identify and whatever background you bring with you, please apply if this is a role that would make you excited to wake up everyday.
Apply for job

items.title: Legal Operations Specialist
items.content:
Legal Operations Specialist at Goodway Group

Remote

Learning & Organizational Development

National, United States

Description

Who We Are

Goodway Group is the programmatic partner agencies and advertisers trust to drive campaign performance and media efficiency. Proud to be completely independently owned and operated, Goodway provides programmatic expertise that meets its clients’ needs – and no one else’s. Through managed planning and buying services across all paid digital media, Goodway delivers trustworthy marketing expertise and authentic results because Goodway knows the truth is what matters most.

What You’ll Do

As Legal Operations Specialist, you will serve as the company’s go-to, internal legal resource. In this role, you will respond to all internal legal requests, partner with outside legal counsel to resolve issues, and manage contract review process from beginning to end. The list of job duties below is not exhaustive; we might need your amazing skill set for other tasks, projects, and initiatives:

Legal Requests

  • Respond to internal Legal requests and research legal inquiries in order to respond accordingly.
  • Escalate complex legal and factual issues to appropriate internal resources or outside legal counsel.
  • Help manage time-frames and priorities for internal and external requests.

Contracts

  • Assist with developing and implementing contract lifecycle database.
  • Understand common contract provisions and recognize and flag potential legal issues and risks in contracts.
  • Manage contracting process from in-take to execution. Drive legal efficiency by leveraging the right resources for the right matters, including using external counsel, and technology or service providers as appropriate.

Reporting and Analysis

  • Work with Finance to identify spending trends, potential cost savings, and efficiency opportunities.
  • Collect and analyze relevant data, define objectives to provide metrics that drive efficiencies, improve performance, and optimize spend. Create a long-term strategy, aligning yearly goals and corresponding metrics.
  • Coordinate with project and product managers for drafting written reports to department stakeholders.

General Administration

  • Maintain and organize contracts and legal documents, legal FAQs, templates, contract clause database, and training library.
  • Work collaboratively across the company to determine, document, and communicate best practices and benchmarks for process standards.
  • Develop workflows and processes to ensure the company is in compliance with all applicable regulations, follows appropriate procedures, and to streamline how we function.
  • Develop legal training materials. Deliver training and guidance to employees on practices and procedures for interactions with Legal.
  • Perform administrative tasks relating to document maintenance, tracking metrics, scanning documents, and meeting attendance.

What We Offer

We provide a world-class total rewards program that includes market-competitive pay, rich healthcare and other benefits (our family leave policy is out of this world), employee development opportunities, and a strong virtual work culture.

You’ll Be Successful Because You Are

  • Knowledgeable: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent training
  • Seasoned: 3-5 years of relevant experience
  • Business-minded with a strong understanding of the core business and an ability to translate the needs of Goodway into legal requirements since this role will heavily influence operations, efficiency, and how external counsel interacts with vendors, clients, and internal employees.
  • A Great Collaborator: you have a proven track record of collaborating with cross-functional groups
  • Skilled with Gift of Gab: you have great communication skills with an ability to manage outside law counsel performance
  • Able to thrive in a fast-paced environment and successfully manage multiple deadlines and priorities.
Apply for job

items.title: Director of Human Resources
items.content:
Director of Human Resources

Various
Anywhere
Company: Mattermost
Full Time

Overview

At Mattermost, we  high impact work, ownership, self-awareness and being focused on our people and customers. If these values match who you are, we hope you’ll learn more about  and reach out to talk to us!

value working at Mattermost

Mattermost provides an open source enterprise-grade messaging platform to the world’s leading organizations that allows teams to collaborate securely and privately anywhere. With over 10,000 server downloads/month our customers include Uber, Tesla, Bank of America, Samsung, Affirm, The US Department of Defense and more. Our private cloud solutions offer secure, configurable, highly-scalable messaging across web, phone and PC with archiving, search, and deep integrations with hundreds of SaaS and on-premises technologies. Our company serves customers around the world with a distributed organization spanning the globe.

About the Role:

You will have a direct hand in driving the next phase of growth at Mattermost. This is an exceptional opportunity to optimize how we scale a fast-growing startup while providing a world-class employee experience. The ideal candidate is an experienced and passionate leader who has helped influence and build a great and high performing culture at an early to mid-stage growth startup. In addition, we are seeking a leader familiar with or passionate about a remote-first culture.

Responsibilities
  • Create, implement and maintain scalable processes, tools, systems and training necessary to support the employee experience and business needs 
    • Formalize Global HR Ops and Infrastructure: globally
  • Managing, operating and reporting from HR systems including BambooHR, TriNet, Lever and other systems as developed
  • Efficiently manage fast-paced HR operations that support Mattermost rapid global growth plans
  • International and multi-state compliance and compensation – Work with in-house and external advisers to ensure compliant HR operations
  • Fair compensation and benefits internationally tied to local market and talent and opportunity profiles, along with company levels and descriptions
  • Global PEO selection and management
  • : Be a trusted adviser to the executive team and managers on operational and strategic People initiatives and decisions including talent development, talent management, performance management and rewards
    • Strategic HR Advisor
  • : Refine and build-out our on-boarding process to rapidly ramp new hires into high functioning team members aligned with clearly defined cultural values and norms
    • On-boarding
  • t: Working with senior leadership to implement training and performance management programs that rapidly and strategically grow our managers and individual contributors
    • Talent Developmen
  • : Guide leadership on making Mattermost an amazing place to work by connecting with managers and individual contributors in a remote, distributed, multi-time zone organization to discover and understand the specific and broad sentiment across the company with a mix of surveys, group and 1-1 conversations
    • Voice of our Colleagues
  • : Partner with leaders to develop and execute a diversity and inclusion strategy as a competitive advantage enabling Mattermost to source from a broader, underrepresented talent community.
    • Diversity and Inclusion

    Requirements
    • A successful track record building, evolving and delivering people operations programs from the ground up in a fast-growing organization
    • Eight plus years of broad-based People/HR leadership, building and implementing operational programs, with at least three plus years managing teams
    • Experience in Human Resources / People Operations including Operations, Engagement, Development and Rewards
    • Experience building relationships with distributed teams and success in a remote-first culture
    • Developing and implementing Performance Measurements
    • Demonstrated experience creating and executing a metrics-driven, consultative service-oriented People strategy for a global organization
    • Strong interpersonal savvy and self-awareness with strong written and verbal communication skills
    • Undergraduate degree in business, human resources or equivalent professional experience preferred
    • Enterprise software start-up experience is preferred

items.content:
Head of Culture and Organizational Strategy at Protect Democracy

Remote

Description

Protect Democracy is seeking a Head of Culture and Organizational Strategy who is passionate about running teams and protecting our democracy to help lead and strengthen our culture and internal team processes.

The Head of Culture and Organizational Strategy will work closely with our founders to strengthen our existing culture, while also analyzing, recommending and implementing new organizational design proposals to ensure our geographically spread-out team can continue to operate effectively as we grow this year and beyond. This person will also be in charge of our talent recruitment, development, and retention, alongside our Operations and leadership teams.

Our substantive work advancing our mission of protecting democracy is why we do what we do. But we believe just as deeply that in order to achieve our ambitious mission, we must build an organization rooted in a highly effective and supportive operating model. We, therefore, invest significant resources in building an intentional team culture and strong management systems. Our culture principles guide everything we do. We hire for them, train on them, reinforce them daily, and part ways with people for whom they are not a fit.

We believe that everyone at Protect Democracy is on a constant path of growth, and we invest in cultivating it for every team member by pairing them with a dedicated growth manager who meets with them weekly to provide coaching.

We believe our existing principles and systems have created a uniquely healthy culture, where people can work together and communicate with deep honesty in mission-focused ways, with far less political, bureaucratic or interpersonal distractions than are typical of the modern workplace. We also believe our focus on culture and management, and especially in hiring through this lens, have brought together a team of kind and compassionate people who support one another and make each other better.

As we scale, maintaining our culture and our management systems will be hard enough, but if we are to succeed they will also need to adapt. We are therefore hiring a full-time management expert and strategist to lead our work improving and strengthening our culture and management systems as we scale.

The Head of Culture and Organizational Strategy will be expected to do the following and possess the following qualities:

  • Sophisticated understanding of organizational management strategies and tools and experience implementing organization procedures and organizational change successfully.
  • Ability to think deeply about organizational culture and turn that thinking and analysis into actionable plans to deepen and improve org culture.
  • Ability to envision future organizational paths and needs at C-suite level and be able to make hypotheses, crisply tee up decisions, make recommendations, and explain rationales.
  • Ability to anticipate and design efficient and effective hiring and retention processes that will result in bringing in diverse top talent that fits with org, grows with org and stays.
  • Excellent project management skills, including ability to develop project plans, manage teams, and prioritize and efficiently manage multiple project workstreams to successful conclusions.
  • Exceptional diplomatic skills and ability to build strong relationships, including with people from different backgrounds and ideologies.
  • Excellent critical thinking, writing and communications skills.
  • Passion for protecting our democracy and willingness to place that mission above all other professional considerations.
  • Basic understanding of the political-media landscape.
  • Comfort with full transparency on work and proactive managing up, down, and sideways to keep others informed at all times and comfort giving and receiving constant feedback in all directions.
  • Comfort taking smart, strategic, and calculated risks.
  • Comfort working in a collaborative start-up environment, doing whatever is necessary to build the organization and support your own work.
  • Comfort developing relevant metrics and then meeting them.
  • A healthy mix of idealism, sophistication and practicality, coupled with personal kindness and generosity of spirit.

About Protect Democracy

  • Commitment to a diverse workplace. Protect Democracy is an equal opportunity employer. Our culture principles emphasize that there is strength in diversity as we believe diverse teams are more innovative, creative, and productive. Protect Democracy encourages applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, marital status, citizenship, disability, and veteran status.
  • Competitive pay and phenomenal benefits. All positions are full-time and offer a salary and benefits that are commensurate with experience and designed to be at the leading edge of competitiveness for the social justice and non-profit sector. While we cannot match for-profit sector salaries, our intent is to not make finance a bar to people who want to do this work on the theory that paying for top talent will result in greater delivery of impact towards our mission. For example, our benefits package includes three months of paid parental leave, a 401k plan in which we match employee contributions dollar for dollar up to 6% of salary, and full coverage for an excellent health care plan.
  • Open to applicants from all over the country. Location requirements are flexible. The only requirement is that your location be one that allows you to complete the demands of the position and mission. We currently have staff in DC, New York, California, Boston, Michigan, Virginia, North Carolina, and Georgia.
  • Ample opportunities for personal & professional development. Candidates who do not meet all listed criteria should still apply, as our organizational structure focuses on providing mentorship and opportunities for professional growth.
Apply for job

items.title: Head of Operations & Content
items.content:
*UENI* is a “do-it-for-me” solution that sets us apart from DIY website builders and expensive digital agencies. We take an innovative approach to getting small businesses online by reducing the friction for a business owner to do so. UENI structures the data it collects from a business and creates a website for each business and listings on other high traffic platforms. We thus enable these businesses to complete online for the first time.


Today we are signing up 2000 businesses every day and we operate in the UK, Spain, France, the USA, LATAM, India and we are growing our global presence every month.


As the Head of Operations & Content, you will oversee all initiatives around creating the customer website and other online and offline presence, across multiple platforms and formats to drive quality, engagement, retention, and positive customer behaviour. Where we refer to ‘Content*’, this refers to *customer content within the UENI product.
The position collaborates with the departments of product, marketing, customer service, dev and human resources to help define both the content strategy and new content creation, the day to day operations of the content team and the reporting processes for the benefit of other departments.


This opportunity is targeting someone process-minded, highly literate, extremely ambitious and keen to take a lot of responsibility. We are moving fast and our content team is central to our continued successful growth.


*Responsibilities*
Ultimately, your job is to work as an operations manager, leading the development of content initiatives to drive growth in the content offered to the various categories of business, the completeness and granularity of categorization and most importantly the daily management of content teams across multiple markets and locations.


This includes:

* Ensuring all content is created according to the company plans of rapid expansion in new markets, consistent in terms of quality, efficiency, and optimized for search and localized user experience for all markets. This is to be done for each market and category.
* Mapping out a content strategy that supports and extends marketing initiatives, both short- and long-term, determining which methods work for the different markets and categories. Continuous involvement of strategy is a must amidst fast-paced growth in different languages.
* Developing a timeline for content creation across business categories, languages and markets, and defining the owners to handle the stages of content creation and quality control.
* Supervising content team, writers, quality control; to be an arbiter of best practices across the content team. .
* Developing standards, systems and best practices (both human and technological) for content creation, venue build, quality control, assistance to Customer Success dept, and adaptation to evolving needs based on UENI’s business strategy
* Integrating content activities within the product and marketing scope of work.
* Conducting tests to gauge content effectiveness. Gathering data and handle analytics (or supervise those who do) and make recommendations based on those results. Working with owners of particular content to revise and measure particular content and marketing goals.
* Leveraging market and CS data to drive plans and adjustments in content team activities.
* Working with the product and technical teams to implement improvements of content team tools to ensure efficiency, cost reduction and daily productivity.
* Conducting periodic competitive audits.
* Ensuring consistent global experience and implement appropriate localization/translation strategies through an appointed representative for each language.
* Leading the hiring and supervising of the content team in all markets and roles.

*Requirements*

* Bachelor’s degree in English, Journalism, Public Relations, Operations or Business. Project Management or Marketing experience is a plus.
* At least 5 years of experience managing a team and staffing – Either deep experience in digital content creation (websites, social media, directories etc.) or in operations management/project management.
* Technically savvy and hands on: able to jump into company tools to manage processes, review content quality, and ensure that team productivity is adhering to business plan targets
* Multilingual abilities a major plus.

*Skills Required*
The HOC requires a combination of operation management and content management, with the most important aspect being to think “customer first”. In essence, the HOC is the creative and operation manager that must be empathetic toward the pain points of the customer whilst being able to deliver an efficient content creation strategy with the team.

*Specific* *skills **required* *include*:

* Proven editorial skills. Outstanding command of English (or primary customer) language.
* The ability to lead and inspire teams of creative personnel and content creators to achieve the company’s stated goals and targets (eg growth in subscriber base, growth in paying customers, reduction in unit costs).
* Leadership skills required to define and manage a set of goals involving diverse contributors in various markets.
* Project management skills to manage venues creation and quality control schedules and deadline. Ability to work under pressure and in a dynamic environment.
* Skill at both long-form content creation and real-time (immediate) content creation.
* Business-minded and driven by data to improve processes, improve efficiency, and increase quality of content to better meet customer needs
* The ability to think like an educator, intuitively understanding what the customers need and how they want their businesses to be represented online.
* A passion for new technology tools (aka, using the tools you preach about) and previous experience in the usage of those tools.
* Excellent negotiator and mediator.
* Incredible people skills and a willingness to work with remote teams and colleagues around the world.
* Basic technical understanding of web publishing, editors, website builders, etc.
* A willingness to embrace change and to adapt strategies on the fly.
* Great reporting skills
* Committed to continually learning the latest platforms, technology tools and solutions through interaction with product department, in particular the CMS.

items.title: REMOTE IT Project Manager - Active Directory
tags: DBG:surround``2N(work, remot) 2N OR(option, allow, abl, possibl, permit)
items.content:
Job Title: Principle IT Project Manager (Active Directory or Microsoft Exchange migration)

Duration: 6+ Months

Location: REMOTE

Note: Need project manager that have either Active Directory or Microsoft Exchange migration experience? Specifically, they would be able to work 100% remote. This is in support of Dell EMC as they have yet to migrate their active directory. Need good communication

Others

Overview of the Role

This role will work within the TMX Project Management team to help support a large migration initiative. You will be responsible for planning and coordinating the resources to deploy major releases of new and existing applications as well as overall or subsets of systems, within the predicted cost, time, and quality estimates. Projects and Programs will most likely be very cross functional in nature where multiple teams will need to effectively collaborate together. You will be seen as an IT Professional with a broad range of understanding of IT technologies and business processes. The Principle PM provides leadership and oversight on all aspects of a project, multiple projects or enterprise programs translating business requirements into systems solutions. They manage the delivery of the functional design, technical design, build, test, and readiness components of project and they establish and maintain a close working relationship with all project stakeholders and technical staff to ensure alignment between solutions being delivered to business goals. They possess the cross functional expertise and required technical knowledge to manage all aspects of a Information Technology project (Applications, Infrastructure, networks, and Security).

PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • The Principal Project Manager is responsible for the overall day to day management of one or more medium to small sized projects.
  • Has the ability to influence decision makers to steer technical decisions and designs on the project.
  • Communicates delivery status, issue management and resolution.
  • Focus on alignment with business strategy.
  • Day to day resource management of project team ensuring effective delivery of projects tasks, deliverables, and milestones on time, on budget, and within specification and or agreed upon project scope.
  • Manages program interdependencies.
  • Provides leadership to project team members and junior project managers assigned to the project and associated work tasks in a matrix environment.
  • May provide input to employee performance.
  • Leads negotiations on resource constraints and critical path contention issues across multiple projects.
  • Facilitate stakeholder workshops and team meetings
  • Must fully understand how to use and ensure data is accurately maintained in Dell EMC IT Project Management Tools
  • Responsible for project communications ensuring all project stakeholders based on the level of interest and authority are well informed of project progress and decisions.

Required Skills

  • 8+ years of experience in a Project\Program Manager role specifically within the IT space
  • Strong proven experience building out a successful KPI & Metrics program in previous role
  • Bachelor s Degree
  • Project Management Certifications such as PMP, Scrum Master, other Agile / Iterative methodologies
  • Ability to provide executive level updates and status reports
  • Tactical project management
  • Financial review and status updates
  • Strong people leadership experience with proven track record of building and leading high performing teams
  • Proven ability to manage resources to meet goals across multiple projects/programs
  • Strength in developing efficient and effective solutions to diverse and complex business problems
  • Broad experience of stakeholder management with proven ability to influence at senior level

Additional Skills

  • Communication, interpersonal skills, enquiring
  • Always seeks win /win situations - analytical, creative, takes the initiative.
  • Results oriented with ability to distinguish between "needs" and "wants"
  • Ability to comprehend technical issues
  • Enjoys planning and executing
  • Demonstrates vision of end goal and ability to communicate same to team.
  • High energy and commitment "does what it takes" attitude
  • Handles pressure without getting panicked
  • Facilitator skills, ability to prioritize workload

- provided by Dice

items.title: Contracts Manager - Remote/Work From Home
items.content:
Job Description

Sundance Consulting, Inc. (www.sundance-inc.net) is a Native-Owned/Woman-Owned, award-winning environmental and natural/cultural resources Small Business. Our success has been rewarded by a deep backlog of work and we look forward to continuing to accomplish our goals. We value your innovative thinking, technical expertise, business skills, and your ability to engage with our clients and our project teams. If you are a high-achiever with a client-focus and a passion for quality, innovative solutions, and environmental stewardship, you will be a perfect match with us.

Summary of Position

This position may be located remotely or in one of our corporate offices in either Pocatello, ID or Albuquerque, NM. We are open to applicants interested in both full-time or part-time status.

Perform full range of contracts and procurement services demanded of a fully functioning and growing consulting services firm. Assist and support the development and implementation of firm wide policies and procedures for contracting practices. Manage the full scope of the contracts and procurement functions. The Contract Manager provides oversight of the company's contract process, with duties including the negotiation, drafting, and revising of all contractual and procurement agreements as well as maintenance and renewal of existing agreements including subcontracts and joint ventures.

Duties & Responsibilitie

  • Administer contracts/subcontracts, including negotiation, correspondence, documentation, certification, financial reporting, and product delivery per overall contract requirements.
  • Responsible for handling contract award confirmations, interpreting agreement terms and conditions and identifying potential issues, reviewing agreement amendments / modifications and incorporating changes
  • Ensure contractual documents are compliant with company policies, government specifications and requirements
  • Identify risks and areas of concern on contract terms and conditions and provide contractual advice, guidance and support to the contract lead/program and operations managers
  • Respond to inquiries regarding contract obligations and revisions
  • Negotiate standard terms and conditions
  • Prepare contractual documents, including the preparation of contract terms and conditions, and assembles contract documentation package
  • Participate in management review of proposals/contracts and in the conduct of program reviews
  • Provide day-to-day oversight of the contract administration process
  • Interact with customer/client contract administrators to negotiate terms and conditions of service agreements
  • Provide advice and interpretation of contract requirements
  • Review solicitation requests to ensure compliance with terms and conditions
  • Prepare joint venture agreements, consulting agreements, non-disclosure agreements, and teaming agreements as needed
  • Modify contract schedules and participates in vendor agreement negotiations when required
  • Coordinate with Project/Program Managers to ensure contract requirements are fulfilled
  • Maintain current knowledge of relevant contractual procedures and practices
  • Other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Strong knowledge of federal and state and local contracting, bidding, source selection, and procurement laws and regulations including Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR), Defense Federal Acquisition Regulations (DFAR), and Cost Accounting Standards (CAS).
  • Strong knowledge of generally accepted audit standards and federal cost principles
  • Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Finance, or a related business discipline; and, a minimum of 5 years of related experience
  • Detailed knowledge and thorough understanding of proper drafting, negotiation and use of contracts, subcontracts, P.O.'s teaming and other forms of agreements
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Contract/agreement briefing, negotiation and review experience
  • Experience in monitoring contracts/subcontracts of increasing complexity and value
  • General computer proficiency and familiarity with Microsoft Office programs
  • Ability to satisfactorily pass pre-employment and post-employment drug and alcohol tests.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Strong knowledge of contract law
  • Strong negotiations skills
  • Strong financial, pricing, and business management skills
  • Experience with Joint Venture agreements
  • Knowledge of the practices, procedures, and processes involved in government contracts/subcontracts administration

Sundance is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.

This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.



Job Posted by ApplicantPro

items.title: Project Manager – Innovation Report
tags: DBG:surround``OR(pacif, pst, pdt, western, california, losangel, sanfrancisco, paloalto, sanmateo) 3W OR(time,timezon)
items.content:
Project Manager – Innovation Report at Lean Startup Co.

Remote
JOB DESCRIPTION:

Lean Startup Co. is developing a report to evaluate the adoption of Lean Startup methodology. The report will comprise of quantitative and qualitative content designed to give readers insight to the successes, challenges, and levels of adoption of Lean Startup in varying organizations across the globe. We’re seeking someone experienced in both project management and report development to produce the State of Lean Startup report in October of 2019. This is a project based role, with potential for long-term employment.

Who we are:

Born from the global movement spawned by bestselling-author Eric Ries, Lean Startup Company offers a number of different education formats/options — consulting services, training, coaching, and events — for learning about Lean Startup principles, which provide a cutting edge, scientific framework for innovation and customer development. They’re a crucial set of management tools for the 21st century, designed to help organizations of all sizes build a scalable and sustainable future for themselves.

Our skilled faculty provide year-round transformative practices focused on impact, outcomes, learning, and the mindset necessary to help companies thrive in a fast-paced environment. We serve every size company and sector of the economy — from the aspiring entrepreneur to high-growth startups, nonprofits, and large bureaucratic institutions. We serve our highly-engaged community with professional, practical content, and live events and connect them with experts who can support them on their Lean Startup journey.

The position is 100% remote, and will start as a part-time contract role. We ask that you’re 1) located in the U.S. and 2) available to communicate during Pacific Time business hours.

In order to be successful in this role, you must be able to demonstrate:
  1. Ability to manage multiple stakeholders
  2. Attention to detail
  3. Data mining/analysis
  4. Excellent communication skills
  5. Ability to make progress despite uncertainty and limited oversight
  6. Relentlessness in getting feedback from stakeholders
You’ll fit right into this role and our team if:
  • You have experience with, and ENJOY working in a young, growing startup environment.
  • You’re curious and resourceful. You LOVE solving problems and aren’t afraid to admit you’re obsessed with getting the details right.
  • You have a strong sense of ownership and urgency as it relates to the health of the company.
  • You possess high levels of integrity, autonomy, and self-motivation.
  • You are open to feedback, take ownership of your mistakes, and love applying your lessons learned to get 10x better.
  • You have a keen ability to manage competing and changing priorities.
  • You work well with cross-functional teams and hold yourself accountable for your actions.
Do you have any other requirements?
  • BA/BS in related field preferred.
  • Five years of project management experience
  • Experience speaking with senior leaders in mid to large organizations
  • Familiarity with and enjoy working remotely and collaboratively (Slack, Zoom, Google apps).
  • Bonus, if you:
    • Are a data mining and analysis expert
    • Are a Lean Startup practitioner
    • Have instructional design and/or design experience

*Note – We understand that you are eager to hear back from us. We receive a lot of applications and cannot respond to all of them. Please do not reach out to us regarding your application. If there is a mutual fit, we will contact you to move forward with the next steps in the process.

Location: US Locations Only

Apply for job

tags: DBG:surround``2N(work, remot) 2N OR(option, allow, abl, possibl, permit)
items.content:
Project Manager

Online Gaming / Betting

Agile, Fast paced, Vibrant, Remote working option

Up to £40,000 + Benefits

The Role

Looking for a highly motivated, self-starting, clever project manager to join a growing online gaming development team. You will report directly to the London Senior Project Manager, to assist in running development for the entire company.

You will…

Deliver projects across their lifecycle, including project planning, discovery, development, testing, release and post-release, all while coordinating with the client and internal stakeholders worldwide, and finally providing weekly reports on the status of your project.

Identify risks and issues, develop contingency plans and ensure that the project documentation is completed to a high standard and kept up-to-date throughout the project lifecycle.

Collaborate with internal business units, affiliates and users, facilitating workshops and document project and communication plans.

Provide day-to-day support and troubleshooting of issues on your project and site.

Lead project meetings focused on status reporting, problem resolution, feedback, and fostering open communication within the team on project planning and execution.

Required Skills

  • Project management experience working with agile development teams in a really dynamic environment
  • Certification in Project management methodologies, like Agile, Scrum master, Prince2, etc.
  • High degree of competency with project management and methodology including: scoping, issue & risk identification, general management, tracking dependencies, user acceptance testing, and communication of overall project status.
  • Experience of working with product management teams, including coordination of multiple internal workstreams including development teams, marketing, sales, and customer support
  • Superb communication skills in English
  • Excellent relationship builder with co-workers located locally and remotely
  • Identify issues in process or development, and find the solutions to them
  • Experience in working cross functionally to drive the high-level solutions as well as resolve lower level operational issues when needed with experience translating between business and technology
  • Self-starter - you must be proactive in your role, and understand what will be required from you to complete your projects
  • Expert in using Jira to manage IT development sprints

Nice to Have

Experience in

  • Gaming or developing experience
  • Proficient use of Microsoft Office, including using the same brand stylesheets across all documentation types
  • Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, XD, or other products for creating designs, mockups, and documentation (if you want to help mock-up your projects)


GCS Computer Recruitment Services is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

items.title: Executive Search Consultant (remote option available)
tags: DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
items.content:
gpac, a family-owned executive search firm, is looking for a highly motivated individual to partner with as an Executive Search Consultant. Our company was founded nearly 30 years ago and has become one of the largest, single-site firms in the nation and is continuing to grow. This particular opportunity allows you to work remotely. You also have the option to train and work onsite in one of our locations.
Gpac offers an excellent work-life balance in a fast-paced work environment. There is tremendous earning potential all from the comfort of your own home. As a part of our network, you will be surrounded with passionate teammates pushing one another to exceed each other's own goals. This is a position that allows you to help transform people's lives by placing them in their ideal positions with our clients while transforming your life as well.
We have a tried and true recipe for success that has allowed us to become an industry leader and become one of the largest and most successful executive search firms in the country with over 200 search consultants. We do not require previous recruiting experience because we provide the proper initial training. We also have continuous coaching and guidance once you join our team whether onsite permanently or working virtually.
This is a commission-driven position with the opportunity to earn 50-80% commission.
Requirements
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Must be comfortable establishing relationships over the phone
  • Act with Integrity, confidentially, and an ethical mindset
  • Effective negotiation skills
  • A degree is preferred but not required
  • Consistently performing outbound activity to source clients and candidates
This is an excellent opportunity for someone who has an entrepreneurial mindset, is goal orientated, has a competitive spirit, and thrives on the opportunity to have unlimited earning potential in a commission-driven position.
We believe we have one of the most unique and gratifying opportunities, both personally and professionally while providing a company culture that is unmatched! If you are serious about finding a life-changing career opportunity, gpac is the place for you! Gpac is rapidly growing and is currently in the process of interviewing to add new partners to the team. There's no time like the present.
Casey Faber is eager to speak with you. Please email your resume to [Click Here to Email Your Resum?] .
Come join the Pac!
GPAC (Growing People and Companies) is an award-winning search firm specializing in placing quality professionals within multiple industries across the United States since 1990. We are extremely competitive, client-focused and realize that our value is in our ability to deliver the right solutions at the right time.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, age, color, sex (including pregnancy), religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, military status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable laws or regulations.

GPAC (Growing People and Companies) is an award-winning search firm specializing in placing quality professionals within multiple industries across the United States for the past 29 years. We are extremely competitive, client-focused and realize that our value is in our ability to deliver the right solutions at the right time.

items.title: Senior Delivery Manager
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Healthify

 

Senior Delivery Manager


DESCRIPTION

We’re looking for a Senior Delivery Manager to join our product development team! You will manage the projects, dependencies, and risks across our product development teams. You should apply if you are a delivery manager who is passionate about improving lives through technology. We're eager to meet candidates of all backgrounds who are excited about our mission to build a world where no one’s health is hindered by their need.





About Us

At Healthify we're rethinking how healthcare organizations and communities work together to connect struggling populations to social services.

Our founding team of technologists and social workers came from a background of working with vulnerable patients in Baltimore hospitals. They saw how social needs - like access to food and housing - dramatically impacted healthcare outcomes and costs and were moved to create Healthify with the mission of building a world where no one’s health is hindered by their need. Our products are now used by some of the country’s largest healthcare organizations

Since our founding, we’ve been backed by impact investors and VCs - from Kapor Capital to Primary Venture Partners - and we’ve built a team that’s both diverse and mission-driven. We enjoy meeting people who share in our commitment to cultivating a thoughtful and safe work environment, and who are results focused. People from marginalized and underrepresented communities are encouraged to get in touch!

REQUIREMENTS

About the Role

The Delivery Manager will:


* Report to the Director of Engineering

* Lead the team in sprint planning and retros

* Identify and measure essential goals

* Help the team manage requirements, dependencies and risks

* Empower the team to meet their commitments

* Communicate updates to the executive team

* Lead the creation of the delivery function at Healthify

* Advocate for continuous improvement across the product development team

* Provide mentorship and coaching to team





About You


* 5+ years of experience as a project or delivery manager

* Have worked with agile teams and understand best practices

* Have a growth mindset with a desire to improve every day

* Excellent communication & collaboration skills

* Use data to promote decision-making and are comfortable justifying those decisions

* Value a work/life balance both for yourself and the people you work with




...and the following would be nice:


* Experience with multiple agile methodologies

* Experience in or with mid-stage startups

* Have worked remotely and understand the challenges remote teams face




BENEFITS

Together, we live into our Core Values


* We lead with empathy: We believe in kindness, empathy, assuming good intentions and finding mutual understanding from our teammates, customers, and users.

* We lean into vulnerability: We're not afraid to ask for help or give and receive feedback. We build off our failures and don’t shy away from tough conversations.

* We rise above the status quo: We hold our work to a high standard. We continuously learn and improve so that we can develop excellent products for the people and communities we serve

* We match grit with wit: We love a challenge and the opportunity to get creative and solve interesting problems




...and to further support them, we offer:


* Unlimited Vacation

* Equity

* A comprehensive tech set up

* $500 one time equipment budget with refreshes

* $1000 annual continuous learning budget

* Pretax MetroCard options

* Zero cost gym reimbursement options

* Free memberships to ClassPass & CitiBike

* Access to an FSA

* 401k with 4% matching

* 100% covered Medical, Dental & Vision insurance

* Inclusive Parental leave

* Flexible work schedule with work-from-home options

* Twice weekly team lunches

* A commitment to diversity & inclusion

* Code of conduct with reporting procedures

  • Lead the team in sprint planning and retros
  • Identify and measure essential goals
  • Help the team manage requirements, dependencies and risks
  • Empower the team to meet their commitments
  • Communicate updates to the executive team
  • Lead the creation of the delivery function at Healthify
  • Advocate for continuous improvement across the product development team
  • Provide mentorship and coaching to team

About You

  • 5+ years of experience as a project or delivery manager
  • Have worked with agile teams and understand best practices
  • Have a growth mindset with a desire to improve every day
  • Excellent communication & collaboration skills
  • Use data to promote decision-making and are comfortable justifying those decisions
  • Value a work/life balance both for yourself and the people you work with

...and the following would be nice:

  • Experience with multiple agile methodologies
  • Experience in or with mid-stage startups
  • Have worked remotely and understand the challenges remote teams face

BENEFITS

Together, we live into our Core Values

  • We lead with empathy: We believe in kindness, empathy, assuming good intentions and finding mutual understanding from our teammates, customers, and users.
  • We lean into vulnerability: We're not afraid to ask for help or give and receive feedback. We build off our failures and don’t shy away from tough conversations.
  • We rise above the status quo: We hold our work to a high standard. We continuously learn and improve so that we can develop excellent products for the people and communities we serve
  • We match grit with wit: We love a challenge and the opportunity to get creative and solve interesting problems

...and to further support them, we offer:

  • Unlimited Vacation
  • Equity
  • A comprehensive tech set up
  • $500 one time equipment budget with refreshes
  • $1000 annual continuous learning budget
  • Pretax MetroCard options
  • Zero cost gym reimbursement options
  • Free memberships to ClassPass & CitiBike
  • Access to an FSA
  • 401k with 4% matching
  • 100% covered Medical, Dental & Vision insurance
  • Inclusive Parental leave
  • Flexible work schedule with work-from-home options
  • Twice weekly team lunches
  • A commitment to diversity & inclusion
  • Code of conduct with reporting procedures
Apply now

About Healthify

Our mission is to build a world where no one’s health is hindered by their need.

We're effecting change for the most vulnerable among us by building software that social workers, nurses, patient advocates and care coordinators at Hospitals and Health Insurance companies use to connect their patients with social services. Our software addresses "social determinants," such as access to food, housing, childcare and jobs, which determine over 60% percent of our population's health. Our aim is to move the needle on healthcare outcomes and cost for these populations. After only 5 years, we've managed to touch the lives of over 6 million people in need. Our products are currently in use by some of the top health plans and Hospitals in the country such as BlueCross BlueShield and Johns Hopkins Healthcare.

Our team is made up of tenacious social workers, technologists, operators, and engineers all united around our mission. We love people who are humble, dynamic, authentic, and passionate about solving some of the hardest problems in healthcare and building a better future.

We support diverse individuals and communities in need. To do this effectively, we believe it’s crucial to build a team that is equally diverse. We enjoy meeting people who share in our commitment to cultivate thoughtful and safe work environments, and understand the meaning and importance of our mission. Individuals from marginalized and underrepresented communities are highly encouraged to apply.

Benefits

  • Unlimited vacation days
  • Wellness reimbursement of $150 a month
  • 401k with up to 4% matching
  • Metrocard Reimbursement
  • A commitment to Diversity & Inclusion
  • Competitive compensation
  • Equipment budget for all new employees
  • Equity for all employees
  • Remote work & WFH friendly!
  • Continuous Education Budget

We’re looking for a Senior Delivery Manager to join our product development team! You will manage the projects, dependencies, and risks across our product development teams.
