items.title: Weekly spiritual articles / guides (Numerology, Law of Attraction, etc.)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Weekly spiritual articles / guides (Numerology, Law of Attraction, etc.)

Company: Grow Media
Location: Anywhere (Native English)
Job Type: Contract
Description

I'm looking for a clear, concise, and engaging writer to create high-quality authority articles in the spiritual niche (Numerology, Astrology, the Law of Attraction, meditation, etc.) from the perspective of a Tarot reader.

About the project

I run a popular Tarot website, and I am looking to expand our content to include engaging guides and resources on a variety of topics, from Numerology to Rune readings.

The ultimate goal is to create exceptional content for the community that goes beyond "what is Numerology" and engages the reader. I want them to finish each article feeling empowered, knowing what their next steps are to find the guidance they are searching for.

Since it's primarily a Tarot website, I think it is important to reference Tarot cards in each of the articles. It would also be good to link to other relevant (internal) articles, to tie everything together.

For example, if you were writing an article on "What is the Law of Attraction (and the exact steps to follow to manifest something into your life)" it would be good to talk about a few Tarot cards that represent manifestation.

The articles will be created weekly, and I think the target should be 1,500 - 2,000 words. There's a lot of freedom here, so hopefully this topic interests you.

This is a long term project, and if it goes well we can expand it to 2 or 3 articles a week (if you have time) or keep it at 1. There is a huge amount of content to create but I am very flexible.

What I am looking for

For me, the most important thing is working with a writer that gets things done and doesn't come up with excuses. Having experience with Tarot cards is a plus, but if you're willing to learn I am willing to teach you. A background in SEO is also useful, since one of the secondary goals is to have the articles rank for important keywords.

I'm not fussed on education, etc., but your ability to write native english is critical. Also, I really like clear and concise language - I hate it when people are needlessly wordy to fill up space, and to make themselves sound smarter than they actually are :)

I also want to listen to you, and do what I can to make this work and fun and enjoyable for you. I want to work with you for YEARS, so let me know what you need and I will do my best to make it happen.

If you have a daily rate I can book you for one day a week, or if you prefer the word count way that can work too.

How to Apply

1) Please share the best article you've ever written, and briefly tell me why it's the best

2) Please let me know why you are applying to this job specifically.

3) Briefly talk about your background, and why you think it's relevant to where you are now (and this project)

4) I want to work with great writers, so the rate is 100% negotiable. Let me know what you think is fair compensation for your services and I will pay it.

5) I am going to be hiring several writers as a test, and then awarding the permanent job to the article I like the most. The topic will be "the Law of Attraction", so let me know what you would include in that article and why. (Note: I am not trying to get you to write a free article. The purpose of the question is to better understand your process, with a relevant example. I will pay you to write the full article you suggest at your full rate if I think we're on the same page.)

6) I would love to see your twitter/instagram/blog/work history. etc. so feel free to share whatever you want and I'll take a look at it.

Please email your application to hireme (at) jeremydavid (.) com

Thank you!

items.title: Senior Engineering Program Manager
items.content:
Senior Engineering Program Manager at Pocket

Remote

at Pocket

San Francisco, Mountain View, Remote US

At Pocket, our mission is to enable people to consume stories worthy of their time and attention. Our apps and platform are essential ways that over 100M people discover and consume content on the internet.

Do you enjoy planning and executing large and complex software projects? Do you have a knack for driving consensus among teams with conflicting priorities? Can you move seamlessly between discussions with senior level executives and front line engineers? We are looking for a hardworking Program Manager who is committed to delivering great products.

Pocket is seeking a Senior Engineering Program Manager who is an exceptional leader, who thrives in getting into the details and uses their organizational skills to help create a high-performance team. We are looking for someone who has a thorough understanding of web and mobile software development to collaborate closely with product, software engineering, design, research, QA, and other dependency teams to help prioritize, manage, and track work. The position is very hands-on and will require a deep understanding of the product requirements in order to facilitate an efficient, innovative, and fulfilling product development process.

We’re a small team that has the resources and support of a large company. Pocket was acquired by Mozilla in 2017, and together we are committed to an internet that elevates critical thinking, reasoned argument, shared knowledge, and verifiable facts.

Come work with us and make a big impact.

What you’ll do:

  • Drive initiatives that span development teams and in some cases product lines.
  • Partner with Product and Engineering to facilitate the definition of project scope, goals, and deliverables.
  • Detect, communicate, track, and manage program risks and flag problems before they happen.
  • Drive on-going process improvements to improve execution and efficiency of the teams within their domain area by pulling from standard methodologies or by inventing something new.
  • Act as a conduit of information between engineering and other internal groups (both technical and non-technical) to ensure everyone understands decisions and status.
  • Identify stuck projects or programs and drive them forward.
  • Negotiate and build consensus across a highly matrixed organization.
  • Bring energy and enthusiasm to the team.

What you already have:

  • 3+ years of hands-on project or program experience at a startup or tech company.
  • Solid experience with a variety of software development methodologies, including Agile.
  • Full project lifecycle experience from project inception to go-to-market for consumer-facing web and mobile products.
  • Excellent written and verbal interpersonal skills.
  • Great attention to detail.
  • Sharp analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Experience working with a geographically distributed team.
  • Ability to comfortably communicate with executive management and cross-functional teams.
  • Confidence with systems such as Jira, GitHub or similar.
  • Familiarity using an OKR framework to track progress.

About Pocket

Learn more on our blog. To learn more about the Mozilla acquisition of Pocket, please visit our blog.

Mozilla is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity throughout our recruiting and hiring process and is dedicated to growing diversity in our workplace.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Apply for job

items.title: Treasury Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=8, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=5, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Treasury Manager at Xapo

Remote | International
  • Finance – Anywhere, Anywhere
  • Location: Anywhere, Anywhere
  • Department: Finance
  • Employment Type: Consultant
  • Minimum Experience: Experienced

POSITION OVERVIEW

Xapo is a fast-growing, global fintech company with a mission to build a safe and global way to use money. We’re a fully distributed team, with 250+ Xapiens working from 50+ countries.

We’re seeking a collaborative, proactive problem-solver to join us as Treasury Manager at Xapo. This full-time position is planned to be remote, meaning you can work from anywhere!

As Treasury Manager you will be responsible for supporting the global cash and FX management of Xapo. This will primarily include actively monitoring treasury positions and payment flows, ensuring that there is sufficient liquidity to facilitate settlement obligations, whilst minimizing intraday liquidity usage. You will be working closely with other teams, such as the Dealing and Trading Desk and the Treasury Risk team to ensure all cash resources of the Group are efficiently utilized and remain within established policies and limits. As Manager you will ensure all nostro positions at other financial institutions are funded whilst surplus liquidity is deployed to yield the highest possible return. You will also support other treasury areas with emphasis on the design, development and implementation of treasury management systems and controls within scope.

This role requires a professional, with competent treasury knowledge (cash management, liquidity and FX), excellent communication and organizational skills to manage the global cash management for the Group across various time-zones.

BALANCE FOR BETTER

At Xapo, we embrace our differences and actively foster an inclusive environment where we all can thrive. We’re a flexible, family friendly environment, and we recognize that everyone has commitments outside of work. We have a goal of reaching gender parity and strongly encourage women to apply to our open positions. Diversity is not a tagline at Xapo; it is our foundation.

BACKGROUND

Xapo’s Finance function manages the group’s Balance Sheet, maintaining a balanced structure within an established risk framework. The Liquidity Management Desk manages and invests the liquidity resources of the Group and initiates all relevant treasury operations across payment networks, FX and derivative markets. All activities of the Liquidity Management Desk must be performed within an established treasury risk framework to monitor and optimize capital, credit, liquidity and market risk exposures.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • In-depth and broad involvement in all treasury areas focusing on cash and liquidity management, cash flow forecasting, and FX management
  • Performing end-to-end process of transactions concluded for treasury cash management and FX dealing
  • Performing currency cash forecasting with cash ladders and execute FX hedging strategies
  • Front line interaction with a network of key FI partners and FX brokers
  • Reviewing and improving efficiency of the Group’s global cash management to allow for prompt management of surplus funds. Fine-tuning treasury-related control mechanisms to ensure full compliance with internal policy and applicable government regulations (EU, UK, Gibraltar).
  • Managing flow across all agent bank, payment processors, and card programs
  • Day to day management (and formalisation) of all cash forecasting cycles including variance analysis
  • Collaborating with other areas of Finance and the wider business around the cash impact (forecasting and monitoring) of trading results and business initiatives
  • Developing metrics to ensure monitoring of Xapo’s risk appetite and reporting against limits to senior management
  • Producing regulatory reporting (COREP) within scope
  • Identifying and supporting change to systems, processes and working practices in order to achieve continuous operational improvements.
  • Supporting various ad-hoc initiatives across the group involving the Treasury/Cash Management area (e.g. Cash Management System upgrades)

KEY REQUIREMENTS

  • Minimum of 7 years of previous experience working in a bank treasury / cash management function
  • BSc or MSc in Finance / Economics or similar
  • Detailed understanding of cash management tools with “hands on” experience in managing cash positions in a previous role.
  • Domain expertise in cash payments infrastructure in Europe: UK (Bacs, Chaps, FP), EU (SEPA) and SWIFT, combined with liquidity management and reserve requirements at central banks (BoE, ECB)
  • Knowledge of relevant (liquidity) banking regulations (e.g. Basel III / CRD4, LCR, NSFR)
  • Consistent track record of translating analytics into improved funding and liquidity forecasting which results in: i) Reduced cost ii) Transparency over balances and exposures (including intraday) iii) ability to optimise the cash management desk
  • Able to apply commercial judgement to ensure risks and opportunities are identified and understood
  • Strong work ethic, ownership mentality, ability to prioritize, manage multiple projects, and execute in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
  • Keen problem-solving skills, with high levels of accuracy and attention to detail
  • The aptitude and desire to learn and develop at pace, attaining necessary qualifications and skill sets.
  • Excellent partner and communication skills to liaise with other colleagues and teams
  • Ability to support and challenge colleagues from different functions in a constructive and effective manner
  • Educated to degree standard with a relevant professional qualification
  • Flexible working hours / able to adapt swiftly
  • Strong sense of urgency and enthusiastic in achievement of high-quality standards

OTHER REQUIREMENTS

  • A dedicated workspace.
  • A reliable internet connection with the fastest speed possible in your area
  • Devices and other essential equipment that meet minimal technical specifications.
  • Alignment with Our Values.

WHY WORK FOR XAPO?

  • Shape the Future: Improve lives through cutting-edge technology, work remotely from anywhere in the world
  • Own Your Success: Receive attractive remuneration, enjoy an autonomous work culture and flexible hours, apply your expertise to meaningful work every day
  • Expect Excellence: Collaborate, learn, and grow with a high performance team

ABOUT XAPO

At Xapo, we’re building a way for users all over the world to send, receive, spend, and store their money globally and safely. We’re firm believers that no matter who you are or where you’re from, you deserve easy access to digital financial services.

Launched in 2014 by Wences Casares (CEO) & Federico Murrone (COO), Xapo has made an unparalleled investment in security infrastructure, assembled a renowned advisory board, and raised $40M from top venture capital firms in Silicon Valley & the world.

Xapo is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe a team that represents a variety of backgrounds and perspectives is critical to our success as a global company. A diverse, inclusive workplace enables us to create products that best serve our customers all around the world. It is the foundation of Xapo.

Apply for job

items.title: Legal Assistant
items.content:
Legal Assistant at Emtec

Remote | Entry-level | Freelance | Part-time

Job Location: U.S.

Job ID: 2019-5618

Company Overview

Emtec is a Global consulting company that provides technology-empowered business solutions for world-class organizations. Our Global Workforce of over 700 consultants provide best in class services to our clients within the Healthcare & Life Sciences, Utilities, Business Services, Banking, Insurance & Financial Services, Education and Manufacturing sectors. Our clients span the emerging, mid-market and enterprise space. With multiple offices worldwide, we are uniquely positioned to deliver solutions to our clients leveraging Oracle, Salesforce, Microsoft and Infor with a focus on Mobility, Cloud and Analytics. Emtec’s singular mission is to create “Clients for Life” – long-term relationships that deliver rapid, meaningful, and lasting business value.

At Emtec, we have a unique blend of Corporate and Entrepreneurial cultures. This is where you would have an opportunity to drive business value for clients while you innovate and continue to grow and have fun while doing it. You would work with team members who are vibrant, smart and passionate and they bring their passion to all that they do – whether it’s learning, giving back to our communities or always going the extra mile for our client.

Position Description

Our busy IT consulting firm is currently seeking a qualified applicant to fill the temporary position of Legal Assistant. The Legal Assistant will report directly to the Corporate Counsel and be responsible for carrying out administrative services and providing support to the legal team.

This is a temporary contract role requiring remote work 20-30 hours per week beginning August 1, 2019, and ending December 31, 2019.

The ideal candidate for this position has a strong work ethic, is a self-starter, pays close attention to details, and is comfortable working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.

Responsibilities include, but not limited to:

  • Conduct initial contract reviews and redlining
  • Contract drafting from templates
  • Draft legal correspondence
  • Assist in trademark filings
  • Abstract legal contracts
  • Research legal issues

Must Have Skills:

  • Juris Doctorate (JD) from an accredited law school or at least 2 years completed from same
  • Competency with MS-Office

Preferred Skills:

  • Experience with SharePoint preferred, but not required

Professional Skills:

  • Solid written, verbal, and communication skills
  • Strong team and individual player
  • Maintains composure during all types of situations and is collaborative by nature
  • High standards of professionalism, consistently producing high quality results
  • Self-sufficient, independent requiring very little supervision or intervention
  • Highly organized and detail-oriented
  • Able to take direction and work independently

items.content:
We are recruiting for an SEO Account Manager who enjoys talking about SEO

You will work alongside our SEO team and manage a portfolio of SEO clients on calls, emails and text. This role would suit someone looking to build on their SEO knowledge and grow with the role.

As a big part of the role is related to creating and nurturing relationships with clients, you will need to be a confident individual with the ability to interact well with others on both a personal and professional level and to thrive in a fast-paced, high-pressure environment.

Responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

Working closely with clients to ensure a full understanding of their business, digital marketing needs and priorities.
Creating trusting relationships with clients by ensuring the client has visibility on our work and the related results/benefits as well as actively engaging
Client website and competitor website analysis including analysis of backlink profiles and strategies
Conducting keyword research and technical analysis on websites including SEO auditing
Writing SEO proposals and SEO reports
Working with ethical link building techniques and developing external relationships
Investigating and working with the latest SEO software
On-site and off-site optimisation
Delivering ROI and suggesting improvements to our SEO department
Liaising with potential and current clients by phone, email and some face-to-face meetings
Other ad hoc SEO tasks

A good knowledge of Google Adwords campaigns.
Conducting on-site and off-site SEO audits and competitor analysis.
Analysing website performance and making recommendations.
Qualifications & Experience

The ideal candidate will be ambitious, resourceful, dependable, technical and have: (We still encourage applications from those without the relevant experience)

1 year + experience in a client-facing, full time SEO position.
Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to empathise with the stress and pain points of clients’ day-to-day jobs
A good understanding of technical SEO issues that may affect a website.
In-depth knowledge of Google Analytics and Google Search Console
Knowledge of some SEO tools such as Moz Pro, CognitiveSeo, SEO Profiler, Majestic, Ahrefs etc
Be able to demonstrate the ability to make sound decisions and meet deadlines
A strong commitment to “white hat” SEO practices and a passion for digital marketing
A desire to continue expanding their SEO knowledge, demonstrated by keeping up to date with industry news, such as Search Engine algorithm changes
Strong communication and organisational skills and the ability to multi task and prioritise your own work load as well as efficiently delegate work to other team members
ABOUT

Pearl Lemon are a multiple-award winning SEO & Lead Generation Agency based in the heart of London but serving clients worldwide. With a team of 15 dotted across the UK, USA, Romania, India, Pakistan, Philippines and more they operate around the clock and communicate predominantly through Whatsapp that function more like a silicon-valley-startup and have a work-ethic comparable to investment bankers. It’s not a surprise when you consider their founder Deepak Shukla is an ex-Deloitte consultant and 30x marathon runner.

BENEFITS OF WORKING WITH PEARL LEMON

Work from the office or from home
Flexible working hours
Company trips, nights out
Learn Very Very Fast
Work with TedX Speakers
Work with ultramarathon runners, speakers of multiple languages
Work with a fully digital and remote team across different timezones
Build and grow entirely in the cloud
International work-cations where we meet and work in a foreign country for a week
Worst case - learn tons, get an amazing reference and move forward
Best case - go full time, build your personal brand and work from anywhere in the world
Take your digital skills you learn with us and apply to any job in any industry

items.content:
Job Title : Senior IT Project Manager
Location : Chantilly, Virginia
Duration : 6+ Months
Remote option available

Job Description:

The Financial Systems project manager is responsible for overall coordination, status reporting and stability of projects and project oriented work efforts of large complexity. She/he will, working alongside the implementation partner, establish the project framework and execute project management processes and methodologies to ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget, adhere to high quality standards and meet customer expectations. The position is responsible for tracking key project milestones and adjusting project plans and/or resources to meet the needs of customers. She/he ensures that senior management and all stakeholders are provided with regular project status and performance updates. This position is with the IT PMO department.

The Project Manager position requires frequent and close contact with IT managers, Business team, IT Team members, Executives, contractors, vendors, and offshore resources. The individual in this role must be able to manage multiple mini projects at one time, have excellent communication skills, be detailed oriented, well organized and able to translate technology to business in simple terms. In addition, they must be able to function with minimal direction and be able to provide creative solutions to various types of situations.

Key Responsibilities:
Responsible for all aspects of project management including project planning, defining and tracking project schedules, issues/risk management and escalation, status reporting, communications, budget management, problem solving,
Responsible for prioritizing tasks/deliverables, enforcing timelines, communicating status and delivering on-time, on-budget with optimal quality and meets customer expectations.
Responsible for managing multiple projects at one time.
Responsible for managing an offshore vendor team.
Able to manage work across multiple stakeholders including IT, vendors, offshore resources, business management and leadership.
Able to clearly communicate and lead groups of technical and non-technical team members to set schedules and align resources.
Able to translate Procurement System and Financial System terminology into laymen s terms for business team members to understand
Highly self-motivated and focused to complete tasks required without management oversight; essentially, needs to be able to get things done without waiting for someone else to do it
Provide regular status reports to PMO leadership and key stakeholders while assisting in strengthening the business relationship management and portfolio management processes to ensure there is a clear understanding of business demands, new programs, projects and initiatives.
Ensure that standards and best practices are understood and followed while providing recommendations to IT Management on ways to improve
Responsible for the implementing project management principals and follow the client's PMLC process as defined by the PMO.

Desired Knowledge, Skills & Competencies:

Knowledge/ Skills Areas :
Project/Program Management
Implementation of large procurement and large (ERP) financial systems
COTS Software Package Implementations
Systems/Software Development Life Cycle
Agile/Scrum Methodology
Technology Awareness
Process Excellence Core Competencies
Strong communication skills
Business Acumen
Results and Performance Driven
Sense of Urgency
Prudent Risk-taking
Attention to Detail
Communicates Proactively
Self -Starter

Qualifications:
The successful candidate will have a minimum of 10 years of directly related experience in progressively responsible positions in information technology within a medium to large and complex organization

Knowledge in all aspects of the project management life cycle and with the application of quality assurance, change management and other disciplines/processes related to the support of information technology applications and software products.

Specific qualifications include:
Extensive IT project management experience
Experience within ERP (i.e. Oracle, JD Edwards, or PeopleSoft) and Procurement Systems (i.e. Coupa, SAP Ariba)
Experience delivering solutions across different channels including web, mobile etc.
Proficiency in Project Management methodology and MS Project
Experience managing off-shore resources and vendor teams

Education:
Bachelor s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Information Technology Certification, or equivalent work experience.

items.title: TaxJar: Director of Marketing Operations
items.content:
Director of Marketing Operations

TaxJar is the leading technology solution for busy eCommerce sellers to manage sales tax and is trusted by more than 15,000 businesses. Our mission is to make ecommerce easier for everyone.

Our core values

  • We do the right thing for our customers.
  • We're a team, built on trust.
  • We're proud to be remote.
  • We're in control of our own destiny.
TaxJar’s remote-only team of 100 people is growing fast. We’re currently looking for a Director of Marketing Operations who will lead the team to identify ways to improve key marketing operations, processes and workflows to enhance overall organizational efficiency and effectiveness. You will be reporting directly to the Chief Marketing Officer, you will lead a team focused on building the global brand strategy for our next phase of growth. The right candidate is someone who is incredibly organized, experienced, meticulous, trustworthy, communicative and most importantly, a team player.

*This is a full-time remote position based in the US only.

As the Director of Marketing Operations you will

  • Define the Marketing Operations vision, strategy, systems and analytics
  • Drive strategic direction, prioritize initiatives and resources against key performance metrics, and work cross-functionally to operationalize initiatives
  • Demonstrate great analytical and financial modeling skills with ability to strategize, prioritize and multitask.
  • Coordinate quarterly and monthly executive management deliverables
  • Work in partnership with Sales & Sales Operations to identify key projects to improve marketing employee experience and then help build operational plans to execute against these opportunities
  • Manage and build the Marketing Operations team to ensure effective relationships with key partners to develop and maintain on-boarding, training and development plans to ensure alignment across teams
  • Drive and track adoption of new systems and processes for quarterly and annual strategic planning
  • Create common infrastructure and capabilities around reporting and planning to get things done efficiently and effectively
  • Rapidly develop and test performance improvement hypotheses; then iterate based on feedback

REQUIREMENTS

  • Proven experience managing & scaling B2B Marketing teams with a bias for rapid execution in the SaaS world.
  • Numerous years of experience building and executing successful programs for brands through PR, partnerships and events
  • Ability to understand a wide array of disparate target audiences and their respective motions, focusing on mapping the right messages with the right buyers.
  • Demonstrate success leading and growing a high-performing B2B marketing team - having designed, developed, and driven a marketing operations team strategy,
  • Experience in managing people, processes, and tools needed to build a predictable revenue organization.
  • Solid track record of successfully scaling marketing efforts in a growth-oriented company
  • The ability to build strong partnerships both internal and externally
You’ll be a great fit for TaxJar if you

  • Very analytical; comfort with data and numbers
  • Willingness to travel occasionally
  • Excellent organizational skills, detail orientation and project management skills
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Possess the ability to work cross-functionally
  • Driven to spearhead projects and initiatives that may not yet exist
  • Only want to work remotely

We’re a happy team and we all really love what we do. We've created a space where high-achievers can succeed, but are also safe to fail. We're profitable and focused on growing TaxJar sustainably. We're always learning how to make TaxJar the best place to work for all of us, and not just another tech startup. We’re always looking for an amazing new teammates to come share in the excitement of solving real-world problems with technology.

items.title: Project Coordinator
items.content:
Project Coordinator at CBRE

Remote

Chicago, Illinois, United States

Additional Location: USA, United States

Project/Program Management

19024627

This position is remote and can be based anywhere in the U.S.

JOB SUMMARY

  • The purpose of this position is to provide administrative support to the Project Management team.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Oversees and manages project documentation and coordinates documentation revisions and distributions.
  • Prepares standard project status reports for project delivery team or work group, client and management. Reports typically include: status update, budget, schedule and risk.
  • Coordinates and schedules meeting and communication plan(s) regarding projects among team and/or client. Coordinates and obtains vendor quotations for processing. Coordinates change orders, change directives (CD) and contemplative change notices (CCN) with consultants and vendors. Contract administration, including attending tender openings and recording results, issuing letters of acceptance and regret, updating tender tracking log, setting up tender opening dates and inviting tender participants.
  • Enters project information data (i.e., project status updates, schedule updates, cash flow forecasts) and project documentation into project management technology tools (software applications, web-based tools, job cost accounting tools).
  • Processes documentation for project commitments (i.e., Agreements, Contracts, Work Authorizations, Purchase Orders).
  • Prepares and reviews invoices and pay applications for processing in accordance with compliance requirements as per established governance of clients.
  • Acts as a point of contact for escalated matters among the team.
  • Assists in project close-out procedures for all projects including: arranging archiving of hard copy files; receipts of necessary close out/turnover documents; compliance with close-out checklist; coordination of lien searches; receipt of occupancy and closed building permits and warranty manuals; receipt of As built and CAD drawings for submission to CAFM; and, collection of required documents for project audit. Assists Project Manager in maintaining project metrics for SLA & KPI’s.
  • Assists with project administration deliverables (i.e., meeting minutes; budget tracking; schedule updates; move management; closeout).
  • Other duties may be assigned.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position. May provide informal assistance such as technical guidance, and/or training to coworkers.

QUALIFICATIONS

  • To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.
  • Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE

  • High School diploma or General Education Degree (GED) required. Associate Degree (AA/AS), College Diploma in Architecture or Engineering Technology or equivalent preferred. Minimum of one year(s) of related experience.
  • Previous project management experience preferred but not required.

CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES

  • None.

COMMUNICATION SKILLS

  • Ability to comprehend and interpret instructions, short correspondence, and memos and ask clarifying questions to ensure understanding.
  • Ability to write routine reports and correspondence.
  • Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from clients, co-workers, and/or supervisor.
  • Ability to effectively present information to an internal department and/or large groups of employees.

FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE

  • Requires basic knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate simple figures such as percentages.

REASONING ABILITY

  • Ability to understand and carry out general instructions in standard situations. Ability to solve problems in standard situations. Requires basic analytical skills.

OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES

  • Intermediate skills with project management software and Microsoft Office Suite products.
  • Proven organizational skills. Ability to complete multiple tasks as assigned.

SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY

  • Decisions made with general understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers and supervisor.
Apply for job

items.title: Director of Law and Policy
items.content:
Director of Law and Policy at Voting Rights Lab

Remote | High-paying

United States
Full Time
Law & Policy
Senior Manager/Supervisor

The Voting Rights Lab is searching for a Director of Law and Policy to manage our legislative and policy work across the country. The Director of Law and Policy is a member of the leadership team at the Voting Rights Lab and will develop and manage our Law & Policy Department and staff.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Identify and develop innovative policy solutions
  • Design implementation strategies and ensure our legislative successes translate into real world change
  • Taking the political and cultural contexts around voting rights, voting access and voter suppression into account, make strategic recommendations on policy positions, prioritization and positioning to the organization
  • Draft legislation
  • Analyze legislation as it is introduced and draft amendments to improve it
  • Monitor election policy in all 50 states and keep our Bill Tracker up to date with legislation and developments
  • Develop and implement an early warning system designed to detect, monitor, and address voter suppression efforts in real time
  • Develop the issue expertise to manage our overall voting rights policy portfolio
  • Become fluent in available research and data on voting rights issues
  • Cultivate relationships with experts on voting policy
  • Manage a growing team of consultants and full time staff to achieve these goals as our organization grows

What we’re looking for in you:

  • A minimum of 7-10 years of experience in law and policy related work, law degree preferred
  • A keen understanding of how to draft and analyze legislation
  • A combination of legal expertise and strategic acumen
  • Ability to draft, frame and describe legislation in a way that appeals to diverse interests
  • High attention to detail and facility with legal language
  • An ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously
  • Proven experience in project management including overseeing staff, budgets, internal processes, and overall project plans
  • Ability to analyze information, formulate plans, and convey them in writing and through oral communication
  • Experience working with diverse communities and committed to acting on the belief that racial equity and social justice are critical components to our work

Details: The Voting Rights Lab is a virtual organization. Candidates can be based anywhere in the United States and will work from a home office. You will report to the Executive Director. This could be a full-time salaried position or a contract position.

Salary and benefits: The annual salary range for the full-time position is $125,000 to $150,000 depending on experience. We also offer health benefits including medical, vision and dental coverage, a retirement plan, 25 days paid time off annually, and as well as paid holidays including Dec 24 to Jan 1. We offer ongoing training opportunities and a fast-paced, dynamic, and collaborative work environment.

Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion: At the Voting Rights Lab we welcome and value diversity in our workforce and strive to create an inclusive culture and equitable workplace. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, marital status, citizenship, educational attainment, disability, socioeconomic status, veteran status, and record of arrest or conviction. Applicants are not expected to provide any past or current compensation information during any phase of the interview process.

Apply for job

items.title: Communications + Stakeholder Affairs Director
items.content:
Who we are

We are Tech Nation, the UK Network for ambitious tech entrepreneurs. Our mission is to empower ambitious tech entrepreneurs to grow faster through knowledge and connections. We want to make the UK the best place to imagine, start and grow a digital business to build an economy fit for the next generation. As a high growth startup ourselves, we are a neutral player sitting right at the heart of the ecosystem of high growth digital businesses, policy-makers and corporations.

We empower tech founders to grow faster through our various growth programmes such as Founders’ Network, Upscale, Future Fifty, and Fintech. But not only that, we also offer end-to-end data, insights, stories & resources, a UK wide community that shares the same entrepreneurial culture, and we are the only approved organisation for the Tech Nation Visa scheme rolled out for exceptional talent.

Our Culture

We are a small but fast growing, high performance team with high standards and big ambitions. We strive for excellence in everything we do. Our aim is to be transformative and collaborative in our work. We focus on speed, scale, smart resourcefulness and unbounded optimism. We never start with ‘no.’ We’re solution oriented and focus on the outcome and the impact of any project or priority. We’re a curious bunch, creative and a little quirky. We debate things passionately in team meetings and stand-ups. We agree and disagree on how the world should work, but we all agree on making a big difference through our work at Tech Nation. Which is why we love it here and never take it for granted.

Our values are: originality, meaningful collaboration and real impact


The Role

We are looking for an ambitious and driven Communications and Stakeholder Affairs Director. You will play a key role in the development of the Senior Management team, whilst reporting into the CEO, shaping the growing department and delivering top level comms.

A Day in the Life of a Communications & Stakeholder Affairs Director might look something like this:

• At the core, both internally and externally, the role will communicate creatively and shape the public’s perception of Tech Nation and help author UK tech story, regionally, nationally and internationally.
• Proactively and convincingly articulate, to both external and internal audiences, how Tech Nation brings its mission to life, to the benefit of its stakeholders as well as the culture and economy of the nation, its regions and beyond.
• Build and deliver an external and internal communication plan which sets out the messaging and narrative for the company clearly, succinctly and effectively
• Lead a team of two and an external PR agency to help the company drive results against its plan and KPIs, including Average Value Equivalent, NPS scores and page views generated
• Build new strategic and operational relationships with grant funding organisations who believe in our mission and vision, so we can win bids to deliver more impact
• Plan, write and submit bids with the support of the exec team for new funding to deliver additional impactful services that help build & reinforce entrepreneurial communities
• Put together a coherent and targeted strategic comms and policy-influencing agenda, as well as ensure Tech Nation’s communication is politically sensitive, nuanced and targeted both to government and tech entrepreneurs.
• Work closely with the CEO and ensure emails, briefs and follow-ups are completed in a timely manner.
• Deputising for the CEO as required in public arenas and representing Tech Nation in the media and public forum
• Work collaboratively across the team, particularly with executive team and with external partners and stakeholders.
• Use accepted company’s practices to track your progress.
• Manage expectations at each step with all involved, from internal team members to external stakeholders.
• Be KPI and OKR driven in your way of working

As well as sharing our ambitions and values, you will

• Have experience in technology policy or similar
• Significant experience in developing and executing high-profile communications initiatives that can enhance the reputation of the company
• Proven track record of working across a number of diverse issues and have a strong interest in the motivations of political stakeholders and seek to effective engagement to bring about change
• Highly diplomatic individual with a passion for the impact of technology on the UK
• Have successfully worked with remote teams
• Ideally have experience working with UK national government
• Strong analytical and verbal skills; quick thinker and clear communicator
• Ability to quickly assess a room and think through how best to position the company
• Demonstrate superior judgment based on skills, intuition and experience
• Have a record of establishing credibility with senior stakeholders
• Execution focused and have a proven record of success in complex environments
• Results-driven, high-performing, high-quality work attitude
• You must demonstrate the maturity to work independently on a day-to-day basis and have the wisdom to know when to collaborate, delegate and/or escalate

What's in it for you?

• Untangl, which include access to a cash plan that covers health, protection and well being.
• Perkbox - choose your own perks!
• A shiny new macbook
• A 4% employer pension contribution
• A flexible work environment
• Cycle to work scheme (up to £1,000)
• Season ticket loan (up to £5,000)
• Quarterly team away days

Where to from here?

We welcome those with alternative identities, backgrounds, and experiences. Our team includes women, men, mothers, fathers, the self-taught, the university-educated, and people of a wide variety of nationalities, ages, and socio-economic backgrounds.
Obviously, we’re looking to ensure it’s a solid fit from both sides: we want you to step into a role you love, and we want to offer you a place you’re proud to come to every day.

Now that you’re done reading, apply!

We know that diverse teams are strong teams, and welcome those with alternative identities, backgrounds, and experiences to apply to life at Tech Nation. We are committed to a fair and accessible recruitment process for all candidates. We would be happy to meet any accommodation requests during the application or interview process, please just let us know.

NOTE: U.S. Citizens, GC and those authorized to work in the U.S (without Sponsorship) are encouraged to apply.

Agile Coach 10+ years of experience working within or in leadership roles in agile scrum teams working at scale under SAFe methodologies. Technical lead, Product Owner, RTE, Product Manager experience a plus.

Minimum Qualifications:
Related Business/ Technical Knowledge, Skills and Expertise:
* Agile Project/Program Management experience in the deployment of leading edge, multi-vendor technologies in a highly complex commercial environment.
* Has basic knowledge of software architecture
* Has demonstrated clear leadership skills and experience working with large project teams
* Has demonstrated advanced presentation skills
* Understands the organization, goals, and evaluates program deliverables for near and long-term, business improvements
* Advanced JIRA, MS Office and Smartsheet skills
  • Capable of preparing presentations, reports.
  • Self driver, leadership qualities
  • Education and Experience:
    * Requires BS/BA degree or equivalent, and 5+ years related experience in networking/telecommunications industry Project Management role
    * Has professional project management training credentials (PMI)
  • 2-3 years of experience in business analysis, project management, consulting
  • Experience utilizing JIRA and MS Office for project planning and tracking
  • Facilitate the stakeholder meetings
  • Strong analytical skills in root cause analysis and issue resolution
  • Strong communication skills
  • Certifications in PMP, Certified Scrum Master (CSM), Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP), Agile Scrum Master (ASM), Professional Scrum Master I (PSM I), or Scrum Master Certified (SMC) are preferred
Your responsibilities:
  • You will be accountable for guiding, coaching, training in scrum methodologies and assisting the team in Scrum / Agile principles and driving process improvement.
  • You will work with the team to deliver value and coordinates within and outside of the team to facilitate the completion of the team's backlog and guiding the team to adding stories to its backlog as appropriate.
  • You will proactively identify impediments and appropriately resolve using network of peers (Scrum of Scrums) and formal channels (including escalation if required)
  • You will drive/manage/oversee all aspects of multiple simultaneous fast-paced assigned projects with distributed teams
  • You will coordinate the release plan, communication plan, risks and issues management plan, (these are PO duties)
  • You will assist Product Owner in managing scope of team(s) and facilitating changes.
  • Facilitates team's Agile Scrum ceremonies (Release Planning, Sprint Planning, Backlog Refinement, Daily Scrum, Sprint Review/Demo, Sprint Retrospective
  • Ensures (using SCRUM and AGILE) appropriate, complete and timely team achievement of all documentation, tracking and reporting metrics (including: user stories, project progress, resource utilization, change requests, issues, risks, risk mitigation plans, test scripts, test results) and ensure delivery timelines.
Qualifications:
  • Solid understanding of software development life cycle models as well as expert knowledge of SCRUM and Agile with knowledge of traditional project management principles and practices and the ability to blend them together in the right proportions to fit a project and business environment
  • A proven track record of successful Agile product delivery or lean product development
  • Prior experience with SCRUM/Agile methodologies with enterprise-level application development projects. PMI-ACP, CSM, or equivalent preferred
  • Experience overseeing multi-function product teams with at least 6-9 team members including Product Managers, Developers, Analysts, and QA Personnel
  • Balanced business/technical background:
  • Sufficient level of technical background to provide highly-credible leadership to development teams and to be able to accurately and objectively evaluate complex project risks and issues
  • 3-5 Years of Experience
  • BA or BS or equivalent experience is required; MA or MS is a plus
  • Solid understanding of and demonstrated experience administering JIRA across multiple SCRUM teams
  • Strong interpersonal skills including mentoring, coaching, collaborating, and team building
  • Strong analytical, planning, and organizational skills with an ability to manage competing demands
  • Proven ability to lead software development projects and ensure objectives, goals, and commitments are met
  • Excellent oral and written communications skills and experience interacting with both business and IT individuals at all levels including the executive level
  • Creative approach to problem-solving with the ability to focus on details while maintaining the "big picture" view
Contact:
Category Code: JN008

Software Applicants only

About Us

We are a London based tech startup and a team of entrepreneurs with a proven track record. We are revolutionising the manufacturing industry by building an intelligent platform using AI and ML that enables product designers, engineers and FTSE 100 companies to get instant quotes and instantly order custom parts.

We make custom manufacturing really easy!

We’re hard-working with a relaxed culture, supportive of flexible working, with a strong and collaborative vibe. Everyone is very sociable, with regular company-wide lunches, drinks and a supportive entrepreneurial environment. We use the best bits of agile with a real focus on learning, retros, stand-ups, code reviews and plenty of chances to pair up and solve problems.

You’ll get first-hand experience of fundraising (we have just been backed by an extremely notable VC), rapid product development, being part of an extremely talented team of which their will be the peer to peer learning opportunity, incredible growth curves and everything else that comes with being part of a young, exciting business.

When you start you’ll be able choose whatever toys you need to get the job done, a laptop, a widescreen monitor and your choice of comfy chair or standing desk. Plus 28 days holiday, a competitive salary (with regular reviews and feedback), and other perks.
Currently we are a small agile team, looking to recruit with immediate effect in order to scale at pace.

Who are we looking for?

We're looking for an experienced, talented, and highly-motivated Head of Engineering to join our team. You will be responsible for evolving and scaling our team and platform, assisting us to revolutionise the manufacturing industry. There is a lot of scope for responsibility and the individual should be comfortable with managing a team and sitting with the board of directors.

Key Responsibilities

• Passion for Building and working with a strong team of engineers
• Comfortable with contribution to the hands on aspect
• Proven track record of delivering complex platforms
• The ability to use technology to solve complex domain problems

What technologies are involved?
Over the last year we have developed platform 2.0 that is market ready, but have ambitious plans to scale and expand the offering to our users. The work will involve many greenfield projects, and also enhancements to the current platform. The platform has a web front end with in browser 3D graphical interface and custom Machine Learning based quoting software on the back end.

Key Requirements

• A wealth of knowledge across multiple technologies
• Highly analytical and a keen eye for details
• Data driven/quantitive approach for decision making and measuring impact
• Believes in coaching engineers to achieve their full potential
• Excels under pressure in a fast paced startup
• Overseeing a broad set of company deliverables and the ability to wear multiple hats as required in a startup
• Responsible for data science, computational geometry, machine learning and AI based projects

Additional experience within any of the below is a bonus;
• 3D interfaces (WebGL, Three.JS, CAD)
• Geometric computational analysis
• CAD/CAM software development
• Manufacturing/Mechanical Engineering knowledge
• CNC machining/Injection Moulding

If you are,
1. open to an exciting challenge,
2. keen to have a real impact on our growth, and
3. believe you have what it takes - apply now!

Full time salary circa £60-85k depending on experience + Share Options

Benefits
• Free in-office 3D printing!
• An extra day off for your birthday
• Ability to work from home
• Competitive pay
• Generous Holiday
• A sociable team with weekly office events
• We get to work with the most innovative designers every single day!

items.title: Operations Manager At A Mental Health Startup
items.content:
Who we are

We’re on a mission to make therapy mainstream.

For anyone going through a tricky time, the choice is between either a months-long NHS waiting list to see a counsellor or forking out upwards of £60 a session to see a private psychotherapist. Both come with the baggage of an inflexible time commitment and an archaic infrastructure. We’re determined to make a third way possible: available whenever you need it, free at the point of use, and approachable rather than intimidating.

We’re a technology company, yes, but we don’t believe unquestionably that technology is our salvation. If face-to-face counselling could be easily accessed by everyone who needed it, we wouldn’t need to exist. But technology does have a historical knack for putting previously inaccessible resources into the hands of large numbers of people at a fraction of the cost.

Wouldn’t the world be a better place if everyone could access the benefits of therapy?

We have raised funding from top tier UK investors including Passion Capital and Seedcamp and work with some amazing companies such as Monzo and Rightmove.

The Role

In order to scale therapy to millions, there are lots of interesting problems to solve: the best way to hire high-quality therapists, how to build a strong sense of community for remote workers and how to ensure that all of our users have a seamless experience on Spill.

We have already put in place some processes, but there is a lot more to build. As the first full-time operations person at Spill, you will have a big opportunity to shape how we think about scaling therapy, and make an impact from day one.

Description

As the operations manager at Spill, you’ll be responsible for designing, building, and deploying the processes we need to manage our counsellors, our welcomers, and our users.

We’re looking for someone who is systematic, rigorous, and logical. You will need to come up with solutions that are simultaneously robust, scalable, and lightweight. You will also need to be able to switch between big-picture thinking and quick and effective execution.

You should also be excited about helping shape the direction and culture of our operations team going forward.

Who you are

You are smart, conscientious, scrappy and effective - you know how to get stuff done. However, you can also step back from day-to-day execution and think of ways to automate and scale the things that you do, through a combination of automation and process design.

Requirements

You have:

- a science degree, preferably in Maths

- an ability to work under pressure

- a capacity to execute in spite of uncertainty and ambiguity

- a demonstrable ability to learn quickly and a willingness to learn

- excellent written and spoken communication

- excellent logic and ability to formulate persuasive arguments

- excellent interpersonal skills that will allow you to support a large team of people, remotely

Extra credit

A passion for therapy and self-improvement.

items.title: Operations Manager at a Mental Health Startup
items.content:
Who we are
We’re on a mission to make therapy mainstream.

For anyone going through a tricky time, the choice is between either a months-long NHS waiting list to see a counsellor or forking out upwards of £60 a session to see a private psychotherapist. Both come with the baggage of an inflexible time commitment and an archaic infrastructure. We’re determined to make a third way possible: available whenever you need it, free at the point of use, and approachable rather than intimidating.

We’re a technology company, yes, but we don’t believe unquestionably that technology is our salvation. If face-to-face counselling could be easily accessed by everyone who needed it, we wouldn’t need to exist. But technology does have a historical knack for putting previously inaccessible resources into the hands of large numbers of people at a fraction of the cost.
Wouldn’t the world be a better place if everyone could access the benefits of therapy?

We have raised funding from top tier UK investors including Passion Capital and Seedcamp and work with some amazing companies such as Monzo and Rightmove.

items.title: Principal Engineer/Head of Tech
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=10, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=4, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=9}
items.content:
ABOUT THE ROLE

Driftrock is on the hunt for a Principle Developer/Head of Tech to lead our engineering team.

This role is a chance to remain hands on with the codebase, whilst managing a team of passionate engineers who genuinely care about what they do.

WHO ARE DRIFTROCK?

Driftrock was started with the aim of making marketing better. There’s no excuse for being chased around the internet by images of products you’ve already bought!

Instead, Driftrock's software glues together data to build a picture of the customer to help deliver useful marketing messages across advertising, messenger chat and websites, while helping protect privacy.

We're located at the base of the Shard, next to London Bridge station, although have a flexible working policy. Engineers often work remote or home when needed.

TECHNOLOGY

Driftrock’s tooling provides our users with a way to receive, transform, track and optimise leads and actions from various marketing channels. We glue this data together on the fly to build a picture of the customer.

The technology is a mixture of Elixir, Ruby and React applications hosted on Kubernetes and Google Cloud. We make use of Redis and Postgres for data storage and RabbitMQ for event processing.

THE ROLE

As Principle Developer/Head of Tech, you will lead our engineering team, working directly into the CEO and collaborating with other teams to continually improve our product and drive innovation.

You will be expected to:

. Manage a team of engineers helping them develop their skills in a productive, fun environment.
. Continuously optimise processes and the working environment to scale a successful team.
. Lead from the front, building RESTful APIs, event-based systems and front-end applications;
. Work with well-known public APIs like Google and LinkedIn;
. Collaborate with other teams to improve the product and customer experience;
. Support production systems and manage cloud infrastructure.

ABOUT THE TEAM

We’re a small team of 14 people at Driftrock and growing. Our product development team is currently 5 people, this means you'll be able to have a huge impact on the culture and practices of the team.

We believe in continuous improvement and we are constantly refining and improving how we work and communicate. One of the ways we do this is by performing fortnightly retrospectives, which are often run by different team members.

Currently we make use of daily standups and weekly prioritisation meetings to ensure we're pulling in the same direction and maintaining our focus of delivering value to our end users early and often.

REQUIREMENTS

. You should have some experience managing or mentoring engineers and a view on how to create a productive teams.
. You have had some exposure to Ruby, Elixir or Javascript (we do not expect you to have experience in all of those languages);
. You should demonstrate a desire to continuously learn to improve your (and that of your teammates) technical, managerial, product and personal skills;
. You should have a passion for crafting products that are genuinely useful;
. You are happy working in a small team, collaborating closely with other engineers as well as our product and sales teams;
. You can provide new and diverse viewpoints for our technical and product discussions and be comfortable making technical decisions;
. You are interested in, and have a view on agile practices such as continuous delivery, TDD, pair programming, code reviews and retrospectives;
. You are keen to ensure there is a high standard of quality and security in the software we produce as a team;
. You have the right to work in the UK.

BENEFITS

LIVE MORE

We’ve spent a lot of time creating a culture that allows us to enjoy life, be parents, spend time with the people we care about. We think this makes us more productive and creative.

. Flexible office hours - start or finish late depending on how you like to work;
. Remote working - we are able to support remote working;
. Maternity and Paternity - Family comes first, so we have a package that means you can spend the time you need with your growing fam.

LEARN MORE

We believe we’re most happy when we are learning and building new things.

. An open culture where we learn from each-other and together;
. Budget to attend conferences or courses;
. Flexibility to take courses or time on personal goals.

PLAY MORE

We’re a tight team, who enjoy spending time together.

. Plenty of team lunches and after-work drinks;
. Bi-monthly socials at some fun venues and events in London;
. Our annual, highly-competitive park olympics.

EARN MORE

We believe in valuing are employees as people and know that it’s important you feel secure with what you earn, and your financial security.

. Everyone has share options in the company with very favourable option agreements. For example, when you leave the company, you can keep vested share options as options rather than having to buy them or losing them like most companies;
. We have a 6 monthly personal pay review process meaning to help you set goals and increase your pay based on what you achieve;
. A company pension plan.

We will not be considering any recruitment agencies for this role.

"By applying for this job you hereby give us permission to store your data on our secure applicant tracking system and to contact you with regards to Driftrock job opportunities.

We process your data for recruitment purposes only. We would like to keep this data until our open role is filled. When that period is over, we will either delete your data or inform you that we will keep it in our database for similar future roles for subsequent 12 months.

Here’s a link to our privacy policy: https://www.driftrock.com/privacy-policy/. In this policy, you will find information about our compliance with GDPR (data protection law.) You can find how to send us a request to let you access your data that we have collected, request us to delete your data, correct any inaccuracies or restrict our processing of your data.

You have the right to lodge a complaint about the way we handle your data with UK supervisory authority (Information Commissioner’s Office) or you can contact our DPO at dpo@driftrock.com for more information or concerns.”

items.title: Dataquest: Director of Marketing
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=16, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Director of Marketing

Dataquest is an interactive online learning platform for data science. We’re passionate about helping students go from 0 to job ready. We help students deeply learn concepts, build projects, work together, and gain the confidence they need to start new careers. Read more about our philosophy  here, and read what students think  here.

We want to help tens of millions of students worldwide change their lives through data science education, and you’ll play a key role in helping us get there. We are looking for a Director of Marketing to ensure that the company has a robust digital presence, is attracting steady signups, and is converting those signups to customers.

Who Should Apply?

We’re looking for an experienced marketing professional with a passion for driving growth, who is able to employ unique marketing techniques. You should be mid-to-senior level in your career with at least two years of experience as a Head/Director/VP for a marketing team. We need a skilled marketing strategist who is able to drive creativity and enthusiasm in others. Ideally, you’re someone who is also excited by the numbers, as the goal is to increase the company’s market share and maximize revenues in order to thrive against competitors.

How You’ll Contribute:
  • Design and implement comprehensive marketing strategies to grow brand awareness and attract new members
  • SEO and Organic Traffic generation
  • Paid advertising
  • PR
  • Partnership development
  • Manage and mentor the marketing team by providing quality guidance and feedback.
  • Produce ideas for promotional events or activities and organize them efficiently.
  • Plan and execute campaigns
    • New product features
    • Course launches
    • Special events
  • Setting up, monitoring, and reporting KPIs.
  • Responsible for ensuring a quality online presence
    • Marketing Website
    • Advertising
    • Email Marketing
  • Conduct general market research to keep abreast of trends and competitor’s marketing movements.
  • Control budgets and allocate resources amongst projects.
  • Become the organization’s agent towards external parties such as media, stakeholders and potential clients and build strategic partnerships.

    • Requirements

    Must Have:

    • Proven experience as Marketing Director.
    • Experience monitoring and optimizing paid media including Facebook Ads and Google PPC/Display advertising.
    • Experience with online marketing
    • Website optimization
    • Email marketing
  • Excellent people management, leadership, and organizing skills.
  • Analytical and creative thinking.
  • Excellent written communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Up to speed with current and online marketing techniques and best practices.
  • Thorough knowledge of web analytics (e.g. Google Analytics).

    • Nice to Have:

    • Experience building PR strategies and working with a team to execute successful outreach.
    • Experience building partner relationships and creating cross-promotional partnerships.
    • Experience working with and/or leading remote teams.
    • Experience working in a startup environment.

    Why You Want to Work at Dataquest:

    • The opportunity to see your impact on the lives of our students every day.
    • Be a part of an engaged and mission-driven team.
    • The chance to contribute to product direction and decisions.
    • We’re fully remote!
    • A supportive environment where you can get help when you run into blockers.
    • Flexible vacation and sick leave.
    • Annual Professional Development Allowance.
    • Medical, dental, and vision benefits (for full-time US-based employees only).
    • 401(k) and life insurance plan. (for full-time US-based employees only).
