items.content: OverviewBriteCore is seeking a Scrum Master who is a servant-leader responsible for coordinating Agile development across two or more teams as well as scaling across multiple teams. They are tasked with promoting and supporting Scrum framework theory, practices, rules, and values. They coach and mentor teams and other Scrum Masters in lean-Agile mindset and practices, empowering the teams to deliver business value early and often.About the PositionResponsibilitiesManage and coach team performance Motivate team to work as a unitFacilitate team efforts Have the ability to share the big picture view and tie all the pieces together to the visionHelps guide and lead the team on the SAFe process Guides the team to focus on daily and iteration goals based on the PI objectivesLeads the team improve and take responsibility for their actions. Teaches problem solving techniques and helps the team become better problem solvers. Facilitates and setups meetings (daily stand-up, Iteration planning, Iteration Review, and Iteration Retrospective.Supports the Product Owner in their efforts to manage the backlogEliminates an issues blocking the team to produce their iteration objectivesCommunicates with management and outside stakeholders; helps [protect the team from uncontrolled expansion of work.Helps coordinate inter-team cooperation and helps the team operate well on the train.Representative in the Scrum of Scrums meetings and pass the information back to the team and coordinates connections needed. Assists the team in preparation for ART activities, including PI Planning, System Demos, and the Inspect and Adapt.Requirements5 plus years of combined experience working in a complex Agile environmentBachelors DegreeDeep knowledge and expertise in Lean and Agile frameworks like Scrum, Kanban, etc.Thorough understanding of one or more Agile at Scale frameworks e.g. SAFe, LeSS, S@S, etc.Strong facilitation and communication skills: ability to facilitate teams through tough conversations and maintain a positive and supportive team environmentAbility to challenge and remove team, organizational and/or cultural impediments, thereby promoting and supporting change that increases the Scrum teams productivityAbility to resolve conflicts within the team before they become an issueStrong facilitator Agile champion, promoter, protector, and team coach Collaborator who seeks consensus among peersOrganized planner with diligent execution skillsProcess-oriented problem solverLifelong Learner Our CompanyBriteCore is an enterprise management platform for Property Casualty Insurance carriers. When a significant liability or property loss occurs, our customers are there to put lives and businesses back together.Our team manages complex financial and legal transactions at scale through a modern SaaS platform. BriteCore is responsible for the entire P&C value chain including rating, distribution, policy administration, claims management, and financial reporting, among others. Our customers are extremely stable and loyal organizations that depend on us for the majority of their software needs.BriteCore is a fast-growing company that has raised significant capital as an emerging leader in our industry. Our staff has doubled over the past 12 months as our customer base has expanded in both scope and scale. Our strong reputation for innovation and total commitment to customer success have produced steady growth over many years.Our CultureValues, Goals, and ObjectivesBriteCore is a values-driven organization structured around objectives. You can read about our values, goals, and objectives here:Values - https://drive.google.com/open?id=126fsK6gc3VxCYhV4lb6ArbH2QMQnhbP3chAEa5FW4rkGoalshttps://drive.google.com/open?id=1SlLYlGREyKlAQ4Nr4iE6hITaJI08EvVDczSDVBDFVS0Objectiveshttps://drive.google.com/open?id=10oatvqbdZV3hhdu48GOPdxbv483iw88zcZSFCkdI1OStaffOur staff is composed of very high performers who are also great team players. We promote a creative and productive environment for capable performers that value team performance more than personal accolades. Many of our staff members are recognized experts and leaders in various technology and insurance fields, but everyone works together to promote great customer experience and productive team dynamics. We take excellent care of our staff and emphasize sustainable personal and career development over short term wins.Benefits and CompensationCompetitive salary based on experienceComprehensive health insurance coverage including medical, dental, and vision3% Retirement matchFlexible schedule with unlimited PTOFlexible learning time — explore your ideas and new technologies on the clockRemote WorkBriteCore is a remote-first company which offers flexibility around location and working hours. We ask that all team members overlap core business hours between 11am-3pm Central Time, but beyond that, you are free to adopt a location and work schedule that best accommodates your preferences. As a remote company, we depend on clear written communication, proactive engagement, and high autonomy. Intrinsic motivation and self-organization are hallmarks of a great BriteCore team member.

items.title: Director of Accounts
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=6, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=4, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Director of Accounts at Sinitic

Remote | International
  • Accounts
  • Full Time
  • Remote

SINITIC

We’re on a mission to make certain that the conversational AI revolution benefits everyone. Machines are increasingly awesome at understanding English, but what about the 5+ billion people who need to communicate in their native language?

Sinitic automates multilingual customer support with a vertically-integrated product suite and proprietary Natural Language Processing (NLP) engine for Chinese, Tagalog, Vietnamese, Japanese, Thai and other languages. Our core tech includes IP for mixed-language understanding and semi-supervised chat history structuring (we really love NLP). We’re a fast-growing SaaS business with great call center clients from the iGaming and RegTech industries.

HOW WE WORK

Build fast with usage: We deploy functional product and iterate fast with real-time usage. With this approach, Sinitic rapidly implements cutting-edge NLP tech.

Lead first into frontiers: We target customer segments in underserved markets around the world. With this curiosity, Sinitic ventures first where others overlook.

Stay Hyper-Global: We’re a team with Ukrainian devs building Canadian software powered by Thai NLP for Swedish clients based in the Philippines.

OUR TECH & ROADMAP

The backbone of Sinitic consists of several python (micro) services communicating through a message queue server. Our clients have call centers with 24/7 operations, therefore testing and high-availability are critical to us. We are currently hosted on a multi-region GCP infrastructure and rely heavily on Kubernetes and Google Cloud SQL (Postgres) to achieve high levels of stability and performance.

The heart of Sinitic is driven by our passion to ensure that the conversational AI revolution benefits everyone from all corners of the Earth. To do this, we’re building automation products that go after every mundane task in the customer support domain: livechat, ticketing, chatbot training, upselling, scheduling, and more.

DO YOUR BEST WORK, FROM ANYWHERE
As a remote-first company, our top priority is to implement new ways of enabling your maximum productivity, happiness, and contributions to the team. To accomplish this, we receive incredible support from the Creative Destruction Lab, Next Canada, Ontario Centers of Excellence, the National Research Council of Canada and GCI Ventures. We’re building a team of ambitious, global-minded, can-do winners who want to absolutely succeed over the next years. Together, we’re doing the finest work of our lives.

ABOUT THE ROLE

The Director of Accounts leads a multinational team with personnel interchanging between two broad roles: account executives (who discover new business) and account managers (who implement and grow existing business). Sinitic is a scaling startup focused on niche industries where personal, cross-cultural relationships are crucial to growing revenue. As such, the Accounts department is structured to compete assymetrically with no pronouced division between pre/post sales, and instead applies the most suited team member(s) to accounts in order to build excellent relationships across all cultures and languages. At its core, this role is about strategically multiplying the department’s human resources in order to punch above its weight globally, and win then grow key accounts. This role is not about quotas, hard-pitching, and the linear processes of traditional software sales departments.

ABOUT YOU

  • General Experience: 10+ years in business development and key account management for software development firms.
  • Industry Experience: Extensive knowledge of the iGaming industry with relationships spanning Philippines, Malta, Gibraltar, UK, and/or Cost Rica.
  • Assymetric Thinker: Ability to adopt prinicples of “force multiplication” to compete globally with minimal resources.
  • Team Leader: Support a distributed team of account executives and managers from prospecting to upselling.
  • People Developer: Effective at developing your team members’ sales and implementation skills so they are comfortable interchanging between roles as required.
  • Product Expert: Demonstrate natural ability to understand and present a complex B2B SaaS product suite.
  • Great Listener: Act as the “voice of the clients” in all management and product meetings.
  • Relationship Builder: Go the extra mile to build lasting relationships with potential and existing clients.
  • Flair for Marketing: Identify case studies and competitive advantages to pass onto the marketing team.
  • Truly Global: Personify the company’s global mission with a progressive and multicultural background.
  • Cool Cookie: This is a startup. We plan ahead but must be nimble and fast to adapt. If we asked your friends, they would say you’re the calmest person they know in tough situations.

NICE TO HAVES (BUT NOT DEALBREAKERS)

  • Knowledge of iGaming contact center operations
  • Multilingual

COMPENSATION & BENEFITS

  • Above market salary
  • Competitive commission
  • 20 vacation days

Sinitic is committed to equality of opportunity for all team members. All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply irrespective of age, disability, gender, sexual orientation, citizenship or migrant status, pregnancy or maternity, race or religion. We value diversity in our lives and business.

Apply for job

items.title: ColorElephant: Experienced Digital Project Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
Experienced Digital Project Manager

About the position

We are growing and looking to recruit for our remote team an experienced Project Manager with experience managing digital project. There is a great focus on someone with experience managing  web or mobile development projects and ideally in an  agency / software house as those present different challenges to an internal or non development PM role. 

You are someone who is a go-getter, pride yourself in working for an organisation that puts clients first and are solution-oriented. You will work to support our clients in the implementation of their projects. You'll have great people skills and a lot of experience managing projects with multiple stakeholders (developers, designers etc) with a superb control of time and budget. 

You are our most visible face for our customers so you need to embody our values. Proficiency (spoken and written) in english is  mandatory for this position.  For this position, we expect you to be a tech-savvy professional with an in-depth understanding of how technology can help our clients achieve their business goals.

Position's responsibilities are:

  • Manage and lead projects in both Agile and Waterfall project management methodologies;
  • Attend client update calls and provide clients with timely updates (good or bad) on the progress of their projects;
  • Scope project requirements and prepare budget;
  • Control project execution and provide internal updates on timeline and budget fulfilment; 
  • Ability to handle and think quickly under pressure, as well as motivate and engage the team to produce the best possible results.
  • Develop a detailed project plan, inclusive of timelines, and monitor progress;
  • Collaborate with internal teams to design, develop and implement digital projects — this includes talking to, getting updates from and clarifying questions from our developers, designers and QA specialists;
  • Maintain, with the support of developers, an up to date documentation of each project; 
  • Communicate with the team and ensure all members are on board with delegated tasks;
  • Continuously assessing working methods and processes and making recommendations for improvement
  • Highlight potential risks or malfunctions and act proactively to resolve issues
  • Embody the enthusiasm, client-oriented approach ColorElephant lives for so clients get a coherent experience from their very first interactions; 
  • Ultimately, you should be able to manage and deliver our projects’ digital lifecycle within quality, time and budget requirements.

Digital Project Manager requirements are:

  • At least 3 years experience in a Product Management, Project Management role; 
  • Experience in an agency or software house is preferred but not mandatory; 
  • Experience with software development is very much preferred, specially if mobile or web; 
  • Fluent in english (spoken and written); 
  • Ability to work from or travel to Portugal and other parts of Europe is not a requirement, but strongly preferred; 
  • Familiarity with Content Management systems and HTML/CSS
  • Hands on experience with project management software, like Trello, Asana or ClickUp. Brownie points for Clickup experience (as we use it);
  • Excellent organization and time management skills
  • Communication and team management skills
  • All of these things people ask for: motivated, focused, hard-worker that likes to grow and learn more, that works well with others and has a positive attitude;

Our Offer

  • Challenging projects to manage for high growth companies;
  • Work from anywhere with our remote policy. We know sometimes the best work is done in the beach (or mountain, or... ) :-) 
  • Competitive Salary for position and location — also possibility of bonuses based on sales closed; 
  • Health Plan and/or Deductions
  • Flexible vacation/days off policy
  • Training / Self-Development Yearly Package
  • Yearly Bonuses Program
  • Paid parental leave / Flexible conditions on return
  • Continuous Training (both on site and online)
  • Attend Annual Company retreat abroad
  • Ability to work in complex projects of Fortune500 as well as small companies.
  • Plenty of Growth Opportunities
  • A lot of ownership on projects working in key areas or full projects; 
  • Support of a Project Manager in all work developed;
  • The opportunity to join an unique and growing company with a 200% growth record for the past 3 years;
  • Contribute with your suggestions and see your feedback and opinion impact products used by millions worldwide
  • A growing team full of talent;

items.content:
Who are we?

We are a fast-growing Kubernetes company with offices in London, Bristol and the Midlands. We pride ourselves on helping startups and enterprises alike in their path to modern cloud-native infrastructure.

We have three major products:

Subscription (Kubernetes support and access to Jetstack Flightdeck)
Training (both in-person and via Flightdeck)
Consulting and engineering
We also have a number of very active and successful open source projects which form a key part of the Kubernetes ecosystem.

Our deep understanding and real-world experience in a variety of environments (cloud and on-premise), enable us to accelerate customer projects and provide them with confidence in their operations.

What will you be doing?

Day-to-day you’ll be managing engineering projects and helping our Field Engineering team to plan complex customer projects.l

The below points shouldn’t be seen as a checklist; it’s a rough guide to what you’ll be doing:

Taking responsibility for budgets and deadlines
Using agile methodologies day-to-day
Managing sprint changes and deadlines
Providing updates to internal stakeholders
Updating our customers accordingly
Managing team resources
Leading retrospective sessions to discuss what worked and what needs improvement

What are we looking for?

We’re looking for a generalist who isn’t afraid of variety. This is a dynamic role so flexibility and strong organisational skills are essential. Experience as a Project Manager would be fantastic, as is exposure to startups.

Your time will be split between our London office, onsite with customers plus you’ll have the option to work from home if you wish.

What can Jetstack offer you?

A competitive salary
Flexible working
A laptop of your choice
Regular socials
Company pension plan
Fast career growth with the flexibility to manage your career path
How do I apply?

Please send a copy of your covering letter and CV - we look forward to hearing from you!

items.title: Director of Development
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=8, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=5, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Director of Development at Mothers Out Front

Remote | High-paying
  • United States
  • Full Time
  • Manager/Supervisor

This is the moment for climate action. An unprecedented number of Americans are expressing deep concern about climate change, and women are exercising their political power like never before. Mothers Out Front is positioned to grow our diverse, mother-led climate movement into a force for the change we need to ensure a livable climate for all children. And we need you to make this happen.

We are a fully remote, dynamic social impact organization with ambitious expansion goals. As our Director of Development, you will help to shape and lead this expansion, including execution of the new Strategic Development Action Plan. You will be part of the senior management team, working side-by-side with senior staff, the Board Chair and other key stakeholders. This is an exciting leadership opportunity for a strategic, collaborative and energetic individual.

About Mothers Out Front

Mothers Out Front builds our power as mothers to ensure a livable climate for all children. We are building a diverse national movement of mothers, grandmothers, and caregivers dedicated to convincing elected officials and business leaders to work for a swift, complete, and just transition away from fossil fuels to clean and renewable energy. We know that mothers have an important role to play in the climate change movement, and, when it comes to protecting their children, mothers are an unstoppable force for change! Our goal is simple: to enable mothers to take active leadership in climate change work by providing the structure, training, and tools for them to work together on campaigns in their communities and at the statewide level.

We work with and draw leadership from the frontline communities who are experiencing the worst effects of fossil fuels from the dangers and challenges caused by extreme weather patterns to devastating health effects like asthma and other respiratory illnesses with particular attention to low-income communities and communities of color.

We are a member-led, national organization that is growing quickly. Founded in 2013, this year’s operating budget is $4.1m. We currently have staff working in eight states and are a fast growing organization with no plans of slowing down.

Job Summary

Department: Development

Reports to: Executive Director, partners regularly with the Board Chair

Supervises: 1 FT Development Associate, 1 FT Development Coordinator and 1 PT Grant Writer — and the opportunity to grow the team to meet our fundraising needs

As the Director of Development, you will oversee, coordinate and execute the Mothers Out Front’s 2019/2020 strategic development action plan. You should have a proven track record of facilitating the creation of long-term philanthropic relationships and growing organizational revenue by employing donor centered tactics, ideally for a progressive social impact organization.

You should have in-depth knowledge of major and principal gift philanthropy, and the necessary skills and expertise to develop and cultivate new relationships and effectively position Mothers Out Front as a leader in the social impact sector. You should be a proven staff manager, team player and organization-wide collaborator.

Your responsibilities will include:

Action Plan Execution and Major Donor Expertise

  • Managing and executing the Mothers Out Front strategic development action plan.
  • Cultivating, soliciting and stewarding existing donors and funders while developing a robust donor/funder pipeline in concert with the Board Chair, Executive Director and other key organizational stakeholders.
  • Implementing your knowledge of venture philanthropy, Donor Advised Funds (DAFs) and family foundations.

External Presence

  • Working in concert with the Executive Director, lead volunteers, and key members of the staff senior management team to strategically elevate Mothers Out Front’s visibility and position the organization as a leader in the field and beyond.
  • Working collaboratively with the Organizing Director and Communications Manager to develop and execute an integrated philanthropy, marketing and communications strategy to elevate the profile of the organization and attract new donors.
  • Facilitating the cultivation and stewardship of relationships with various stakeholders with an eye towards new philanthropy.

Day-to-Day Management

  • Effectively overseeing all development activities, and ensure that such activities are designed and implemented in support of the organization’s fundraising goals.
  • Developing a comprehensive understanding of the organization’s climate change programs and campaigns and fundraising activities, and partnering with relevant program teams to develop and execute philanthropic strategies.
  • Managing a comprehensive donor/funder relations strategy in support of MOF’s strategic development action plan including proactive stewardship, responding to donor inquiries and concerns, acknowledging gifts, etc.
  • Developing systems and reports to assess fundraising activity and efficacy, and to provide metrics and analysis to senior executives and board members.
  • Establishing annual fundraising goals and objectives, including the development and tracking of the department’s annual revenue and expense budgets.
  • 25% travel encompassing both day trips and overnights required and expected.

Your education and experience should include:

  • A minimum of seven (7) years of fundraising experience in a social impact organization, specifically developing and implementing strategies with a focus on cultivating, soliciting and stewarding major gifts.
  • Experience managing and empowering staff through active communication and delegation to foster accountability through clearly defined and measurable goals.
  • Experience developing and executing a strategic development plan that includes major donors, institutional giving and grassroots fundraising.
  • A proven track record of cultivating donor relationships and facilitating the closing of gifts in the $10K+ range. Enthusiasm for contact with donors and prospects; comfort and familiarity with High Net Worth individuals.
  • Demonstrated proficiency and experience in managing competing priorities while maintaining high standards of quality and responsiveness.
  • Demonstrated experience working with databases, and experience in translating data for use in developing plans to meet future challenges; experience with Salesforce preferred.
  • CFRE preferred.

Your knowledge, skills and abilities should include:

  • An ability to work in a remote environment for a fully virtual organization. Highly computer literate.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • Multicultural competence and demonstrated ability to work with people from a variety of ethnic, racial, socio-economic, educational, linguistic, and religious backgrounds, as well as people of various physical abilities, sexual orientations, gender identities, and generations.
  • Excellent solution oriented skills with an ability to respond quickly to changing priorities.
  • Ability to work in a highly collaborative environment where teamwork, collegiality and self-motivation are necessary for success.
  • Strong project management skills, coupled with sharp attention to detail, and a demonstrated ability to effectively manage competing priorities.

Details: Mothers Out Front is a virtual organization. Candidates can be based anywhere in the U.S. and will work from a home office. You will report to our Executive Director and partner regularly with our Board Chair. This a full-time position.

Salary and benefits: The salary range is $100K to $120K+, depending on experience. Benefits include health and dental coverage, a 401(k) plan, flexible spending plan, paid vacation, holidays, sick days, and support for remote work set-up. We offer ongoing training opportunities, a fast-paced, dynamic, supportive, and collaborative setting and we are proudly women-led!

Timeline: We are accepting applications for this position through July 9th and hope to fill the position in August. We have a thorough interview process which involves a phone interview, video interview, writing exercise, reference calls, and an in-person interview for candidates who continue to advance through the process. We also have a commitment to building up a sizable and diverse candidate pool before moving applicants to the final interview stages, which means there may be a delay in getting back to you. Our hope is that our process allows us to make the best possible decision and for you to learn more about us and appreciate your understanding if there is a delay at any point. We will do our best to keep you posted on your status throughout the process and ask that you stay in touch too.

Apply for job

items.content:
Director of Marketing

We've been home-growing and outsourcing our marketing and it's time to get real. We’ve got blue chip customers, amazing retention, strong growth (while bootstrapped), fantastic partners...and no marketing team. This has to be fixed!!!
We're looking for our first in-house marketing pro to lead on key marketing activities across the org. You will work cross functionally with founders, product leads, sales people, customers and our outsourced teams (if you want to keep them!) to shape and deploy successful marketing campaigns
You...
  • are comfortable getting into the weeds and executing 
  • like nerdy concepts and know how to communicate them to normal humans
  • are entrepreneurial by nature - you take on large ambitious projects, or have even started your own company before 
  • love getting bang for the buck
  • have an experimentation mindset, willing to try lots of different things until you find something that works
  • have a great sense of humor, the darker the better
You’ll be responsible for overseeing all marketing efforts for SwoopTalent. You'll be telling us what those are (of course!), but we think it includes: 
  • Email marketing 
  • Blog management & content creation 
  • Social media 
  • Digital advertising 
  • Events 
  • Guerrilla marketing (whatever the heck that means…)
  • Website Management 
  • Partnerships
  • You tell us
Qualifications
  • 5+ years in varied marketing roles within the B2B SaaS sector where you devised, executed and measured lead generation efforts on a large scale
  • Experience creating and executing ROI-driven marketing campaign plans
  • Proven track record of prioritizing and delivering demand generation results within an entrepreneurial, fast-paced environment
  • Nice to have: experience in enterprise IT products
  • Team player with positive thinking that likes to "get things done"
  • Fast learner that can and likes to dive into the details of cutting-edge technologies
  • Imagination and experimentation - you know what got you here won't get you there
...and, clearly, you are very good at engaging remotely with a small global team

items.title: Head of Artificial Intelligence - Remote - EU Time Zone
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=68, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
CVEDIA is a funded AI company that develops deep learning solutions for some of the largest organisations on the planet. Our computer vision simulation platform SynCity is the first of its kind - using gaming development tools and machine learning theory, we've created a custom, simulated universe that can train and validate AI models for things like autonomous cars, boats, and drones, as well as for applications like robotics, industrial AI, smart cities, and agriculture. Our team is located in 19 countries and we pride ourselves on being autonomous, invested, and highly communicative team members.

An engineering process that incorporates synthetic data in an effective manner is both safer and less expensive than one which does not. By making the safest option also the lowest
cost option, CVEDIA is destined play a pivotal role in ensuring the safety of AI sensing systems across all industries and sectors.

The successful candidate will help us to shape both our product offering and our technical vision, working closely with the CEO and the technical team to help us build an
understanding of how synthetic data can best be used to train and validate machine learning intensive systems.

They will help to turn that understanding into a value proposition
that can be communicated effectively to clients across a wide
range of industries and will help to market and sell that
vision with a mixture of public speaking and technical writing.

The position involves taking a leading role in building the data
science capability within the organisation, helping to turn
dataset generation into a repeatable, reliable, value-creating
business process.

If you have a strong background in engineering management and
machine learning, we encourage you to apply.

CVEDIA is a fully distributed company. All team members work
remotely. Core business hours are aligned with European
time zones.

Responsibilities and Duties:-
1. Use your machine learning expertise to provide technical
consulting and input into product development.
2. Use your engineering management expertise to help grow
the technical and process maturity of the organisation.
3. Work within the customer acquisition process to build
elicit requirements and build confidence.
4. Use public speaking and technical writing to help sell
the technical vision to a wider audience.

Qualifications and skills:-
1. Bachelor's degree (ideally a PhD) in Artificial Intelligence,
Machine Learning, Machine Vision, or a related field.
2. Practical experience developing machine learning algorithms,
ideally using Deep Convolutional Neural Networks.
3. Practical experience developing machine vision, LIDAR, RADAR
or Infrared sensing systems.
4. Experience leading an engineering team through periods of
high growth and organisational maturation.
5. Excellent written, interpersonal and verbal communication
skills.

What We Offer

  • Fully distributed team - located in 19 countries
  • 4 weeks paid holiday per year
  • Yearly team meet-up
  • Scrum development process
  • Anti-discriminatory company culture - we won't discount you for things like needing to pick your kids up from school, your age, your ethnicity, or your gender
  • An excited, communicative, and helpful team - we keep our work environment positive, but we also place importance on honesty

Our Values

1. Passion - We need both energy and passion to develop cutting edge AI. To succeed at CVEDIA, you need to have a strong investment in both your career and the role of AI in the future of the planet.

2. Commitment - CVEDIA has the opposite of a "quick-n-dirty" mentality. Every aspect of our technology has been meticulously built, and is always the product of very hard work.

3. Autonomy - Carrying confidence in the work we do individually is required to work at the pace that we do as a team. Academic research, tutorials, and even creating our own solutions with the tools we have are all on the board during a regular day's work.

4. Joy - It's one of our greatest strengths to bring joy and excitement into our workplace. We carry this energy into meetings, project planning, and our dedication to our work, and focus on work that feels meaningful.

5. Communication - Honest discussions are imperative to the flow of work and ideas. Team members need to be able to effectively communicate complex ideas to those who don't work in their field. It's a regular occurrence to spontaneously discuss plans and ideas with any team member on the fly, including our CEO or CTO. Each team member is respected equally and acts as a valuable contributor.

How to Apply

  • Please apply using the "Apply to position" button on the top of this page
  • Please mention your city and country of residence in your application
  • English applications only - a professional speaking and writing command of English is required for this role
  • Due to time zone difficulties, we're currently only accepting applicants in European timezones

items.content:
Head of Marketing at LeadsBridge

Remote | International

Remote | Full time

Apply Now

LeadsBridge is a remote B2B SaaS company that helps clients to bridge the gaps between business assets and advertising campaigns.

Job brief

We are looking for a Head of Marketing who’ll lead all our marketing activities from social media and digital campaigns to advertising and creative projects.

Head of Marketing responsibilities include developing plans to help establish our brand, allocating resources to different projects and setting short-term and long-term department goals. You will run our Marketing department in ways that promote higher profitability and competitiveness.

We are looking for an experienced marketing executive guy that is able to drive growth with a team of 5 people. We’d like to onboard a person with a strong character and with self-confidence in decision making. If you feel you can be the right person for this role and you’d like to be part of an extraordinary team that pushes for the professional growth of people, send your application now!

Head of Marketing responsibilities include:

  • Crafting strategies for all Marketing teammates, including Digital, Advertising, Communications and Creative
  • Preparing and managing monthly, quarterly and annual budgets for the Marketing department
  • Preparing and managing monthly, quarterly and annual reports and team goals for the Marketing department
  • Managing and leading the operative side of our advertising campaigns
  • Managing and leading the operative side of our copywriting and landing pages
  • Brief, update and inspire the Business Development team to drive project management and revenue growth

Responsibilities

  • Craft strategies for all Marketing teams, including Digital, Advertising, Communications and Creative
  • Prepare and manage monthly, quarterly and annual budgets for the Marketing department
  • Set, monitor and report on team goals
  • Ensure our brand message is strong and consistent across all channels and marketing efforts (like events, email campaigns, web pages, and promotional material)
  • R&D buyer personas
  • Identify opportunities to reach new market segments and expand market share
  • Monitor competition (acquisitions, pricing changes and new products and features)
  • Coordinate sales, business development and marketing efforts to boost brand awareness
  • Google Ads and Facebook Ads operations
  • Copywriting and landing pages operations

Requirements

  • Proven work experience as a marketing decision maker, preferably within/near our industry
  • Experience running successful marketing campaigns and Go to Market strategies
  • Solid knowledge of Google Adwords and Facebook Ads
  • Experience with CRM software
  • Leadership skills with the ability to set and prioritize goals
  • Proven analytical obsessed approach.
  • BSc or MSc in Marketing or relevant field
  • At least English B2 level

Benefits

  • Strong professional growth
  • Competitive European salary
  • Remote work. Human contact is still important. For this reason, more than once a year, meetups are organized in which we find ourselves working together.
  • Availability of monthly bonuses for IT equipment purchases or for sports activities. We care about your health!
  • Support of the constant team with the aim of constantly growing you
  • An international team based around the World
  • Unlimited vacation policy
Apply for job

items.title: Director of Learning Design, Math
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Director of Learning Design, Math at Edmentum

Remote
  • Curriculum & Assessment Development DIREC03683
  • Full-Time
  • Minneapolis, MN, USA
  • Dallas, TX, USA
  • Remote, USA

Description

Edmentum is committed to making it easier for educators to individualize learning for every student through simple technology, high-quality content, actionable data, and customer success. Founded in innovation, Edmentum’s powerful learning solutions blend technology with individual teaching approaches. We are dedicated to being educators’ most trusted partner in creating successful student outcomes everywhere learning occurs. Our commitment is built off the emphasis we place on our core values: passion, people, respect, collaboration, and performance.

The Director of Learning Designer, Math serves as an integral thought leader in the company helping to research and develop Edmentum’s strategy for math content and related products. The Director of Learning Design, Math will collaborate across curriculum, research, product management, and platform teams to lead the planning and learning design for math content and products, supporting the VP Learning Design in presenting strategic plans to the Executive Leadership Team. The position will lead the charge in creating learning design recommendations, both digital and print, that lead the company step by step towards becoming part of the core ecosystem within Tier 1, mainstream classrooms. The vision of the right candidate should be strongly grounded in math current classroom practice, educational research, math core products, math digital products, and an interest in innovation in blended learning that meets the everyday needs of practitioners. Scope of responsibilities may begin K-12 and focus later on K-6 or 6-12 as need for specialization arises.

Here’s what you’ll do:

  • Bear the torch for excellence in math learning design both within the company and support the company in making incremental changes in math content learning design and in associated core product offerings.
  • Demonstrated track record in producing into product educational research in thoughtful and innovative ways.
  • Collaborate with the research department on understanding key math research and introducing new research that enhances Edmentum’s instructional thinking, understanding how both scientifically based research and best practices authorship impact market direction and student outcomes.
  • Ability to achieve results through influence across an organization and collaboration with other departments.
  • Represent the needs of the teacher, the learner, and the administrator in math product discussions.
  • Support the product management team in putting together business plans for products related to math, as necessary.
  • Evaluate partners for excellence against an agreed-upon evaluation rubric and interface with the Manager of Product Partnerships, Learning Design management, and the Executive Leadership Team (ELT) on pursuing advantageous math partnerships.
  • Understand and apply effective classroom practice to high-quality learning design in math and in other areas as assigned.
  • Create Learning Design Briefs and other learning design tools to help guide development of courseware and features.
  • Support the Curriculum team in creating math content by providing guidelines and reviewing key sample content.
  • Partnering with Product Management and Curriculum, evaluate all product ideas for math against academic research, market research (customer surveys, user interviews, purchased surveys), and an in-depth knowledge of current educational practice and the workflow of a teacher’s day.
  • Participate in focus groups, customer interviews, field tests, and site visits that explore direction in the math market and that respond to product concepts and prototypes.
  • Collaborate with Product Management and Software Engineering in understanding the potential for math innovation within our products.
  • Collaborate with Content Development, Research, Product Management, Platform Development, and UI/UX on math learning design initiatives.
  • Interface with and potentially recruit math academic experts and investigate how to implement their feedback.
  • Meet all goals of quality, schedule and budget.
  • Represent Edmentum math learning design within Edmentum and externally with customers and at tradeshows and other events.

Here’s what you’ll need:

  • Experience in math classroom teaching and education preferred.
  • Experience in learning design in math (prototyping, guidelines, scope & sequence creation).
  • Five years’ experience in implementing or design math programs.
  • Has hands-on experience with math core programs and an in-depth knowledge of the competitive field in both core programs and ed tech.
  • Knowledge and experience with UDL and accessibility.
  • Ability to build teams and review others’ work with positive guidance.
  • Proven track record in achieving results through collaboration.
  • Highly creative with strong design skills.
  • Experienced in a variety of innovative instructional modalities and design approaches including game-based learning, close reading, project-based learning, and others.
  • Has strong communication skills (oral, written, and business) to function effectively in a leadership role with internal and external clients and liaise with other national education experts.
  • Ability to tailor technical presentations to different audiences.
  • High levels of collaboration and cross-functional skills and experience.
  • Inspirational, motivational, and results-based leadership skills.
Apply for job

items.title: Principle Developer/Head of Tech
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=10, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=4, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=9}
items.content:
ABOUT THE ROLE

Driftrock is on the hunt for a Principle Developer/Head of Tech to lead our engineering team.

This role is a chance to remain hands on with the codebase, whilst managing a team of passionate engineers who genuinely care about what they do.

WHO ARE DRIFTROCK?

Driftrock was started with the aim of making marketing better. There’s no excuse for being chased around the internet by images of products you’ve already bought!

Instead, Driftrock's software glues together data to build a picture of the customer to help deliver useful marketing messages across advertising, messenger chat and websites, while helping protect privacy.

We're located at the base of the Shard, next to London Bridge station, although have a flexible working policy. Engineers often work remote or home when needed.

TECHNOLOGY

Driftrock’s tooling provides our users with a way to receive, transform, track and optimise leads and actions from various marketing channels. We glue this data together on the fly to build a picture of the customer.

The technology is a mixture of Elixir, Ruby and React applications hosted on Kubernetes and Google Cloud. We make use of Redis and Postgres for data storage and RabbitMQ for event processing.

THE ROLE

As Principle Developer/Head of Tech, you will lead our engineering team, working directly into the CEO and collaborating with other teams to continually improve our product and drive innovation.

You will be expected to:

. Manage a team of engineers helping them develop their skills in a productive, fun environment.
. Continuously optimise processes and the working environment to scale a successful team.
. Lead from the front, building RESTful APIs, event-based systems and front-end applications;
. Work with well-known public APIs like Google and LinkedIn;
. Collaborate with other teams to improve the product and customer experience;
. Support production systems and manage cloud infrastructure.

ABOUT THE TEAM

We’re a small team of 14 people at Driftrock and growing. Our product development team is currently 5 people, this means you'll be able to have a huge impact on the culture and practices of the team.

We believe in continuous improvement and we are constantly refining and improving how we work and communicate. One of the ways we do this is by performing fortnightly retrospectives, which are often run by different team members.

Currently we make use of daily standups and weekly prioritisation meetings to ensure we're pulling in the same direction and maintaining our focus of delivering value to our end users early and often.

REQUIREMENTS

. You should have some experience managing or mentoring engineers and a view on how to create a productive teams.
. You have had some exposure to Ruby, Elixir or Javascript (we do not expect you to have experience in all of those languages);
. You should demonstrate a desire to continuously learn to improve your (and that of your teammates) technical, managerial, product and personal skills;
. You should have a passion for crafting products that are genuinely useful;
. You are happy working in a small team, collaborating closely with other engineers as well as our product and sales teams;
. You can provide new and diverse viewpoints for our technical and product discussions and be comfortable making technical decisions;
. You are interested in, and have a view on agile practices such as continuous delivery, TDD, pair programming, code reviews and retrospectives;
. You are keen to ensure there is a high standard of quality and security in the software we produce as a team;
. You have the right to work in the UK.

BENEFITS

LIVE MORE

We’ve spent a lot of time creating a culture that allows us to enjoy life, be parents, spend time with the people we care about. We think this makes us more productive and creative.

. Flexible office hours - start or finish late depending on how you like to work;
. Remote working - we are able to support remote working;
. Maternity and Paternity - Family comes first, so we have a package that means you can spend the time you need with your growing fam.

LEARN MORE

We believe we’re most happy when we are learning and building new things.

. An open culture where we learn from each-other and together;
. Budget to attend conferences or courses;
. Flexibility to take courses or time on personal goals.

PLAY MORE

We’re a tight team, who enjoy spending time together.

. Plenty of team lunches and after-work drinks;
. Bi-monthly socials at some fun venues and events in London;
. Our annual, highly-competitive park olympics.

EARN MORE

We believe in valuing are employees as people and know that it’s important you feel secure with what you earn, and your financial security.

. Everyone has share options in the company with very favourable option agreements. For example, when you leave the company, you can keep vested share options as options rather than having to buy them or losing them like most companies;
. We have a 6 monthly personal pay review process meaning to help you set goals and increase your pay based on what you achieve;
. A company pension plan.

We will not be considering any recruitment agencies for this role.

"By applying for this job you hereby give us permission to store your data on our secure applicant tracking system and to contact you with regards to Driftrock job opportunities.

We process your data for recruitment purposes only. We would like to keep this data until our open role is filled. When that period is over, we will either delete your data or inform you that we will keep it in our database for similar future roles for subsequent 12 months.

Here’s a link to our privacy policy: https://www.driftrock.com/privacy-policy/. In this policy, you will find information about our compliance with GDPR (data protection law.) You can find how to send us a request to let you access your data that we have collected, request us to delete your data, correct any inaccuracies or restrict our processing of your data.

You have the right to lodge a complaint about the way we handle your data with UK supervisory authority (Information Commissioner’s Office) or you can contact our DPO at dpo@driftrock.com for more information or concerns.”

items.title: Telecom Project Manager (Remote)
items.content:
Please note that this is a 6 months contract position.

***Remote position - prefer candidates located in Midwest or East Coast***

JOB SUMMARY
Project manage all aspects of build for Copper, HFC and Fiber Optic Telco Plant in various areas of the US. Must be able to read and understand system designs to ensure the proper construction of aerial and underground fiber optics and copper plant. Document and track that all safety, NESC and Bell standards as well as client quality standards are followed. Job duties include but are not limited to, managing customer interaction, tracking all construction related activities, preparing and submittal of permitting applications, ROE and ROW approvals, invoicing, material logistics, and communication with the deployment team for OSP construction projects in a manner consistent with policies, procedures, quality work standards, customer needs, and applicable local, state and federal regulations. The Project Manager will report to the PMO office and coordinate with the field on all status of construction projects and serve as the primary point of contact for the customer, construction crews, local and state government agencies and utility companies.

EXPERIENCE REQUIRED
7+ years of OSP Project Management experience in HFC /Telco/Fiber Optic plant
5+ years of experience in obtaining ROW permits for various municipalities
5+ years of experience with materials and logistics management related to OSP construction
Highschool Diploma or GED
Ability to travel 25%
Individuals must have experience with running large or multiple HFC/Telco/Fiber Optic plant construction programs, service or plant maintenance, understanding of outside cable plant construction practices, and applicable regulations and standards.
Must have strong computer skills (MS Excel, Outlook, Word).
Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously, working efficiently and effectively under deadlines.
Ability to organize and control personnel and materials.
Must possess a valid driver's license with safe driving record.
Bilingual, preferred (English/Spanish)
PMP certification a plus

Applicants must provide their phone number. Reference job number 4397.

- provided by Dice

    • Science of Seconds GmbH (SOS) is a Berlin-based company that puts its heart and soul into development of technology. SOS develops and establishes quantitative solutions and technology in the fields of blockchain, investments, and information systems. Being fully financially backed, we conduct projects from conception to market launch.

    We are looking for curious and passionate project/product manager, someone who loves to organize, someone who has already experience and knows everything from creating up to implementing proejcts into real world practices. At SOS we value commitment, team spirit, and your personal and professional development. Our mission is to offer our teams a diverse work environment by fostering a very friendly atmosphere. We enjoy to build an energetic culture and to plan fun events and activities.

    We welcome and encourage applicants with diverse experiences and backgrounds for full-time engagement.

    Responsibilities:

    • Overseeing daily operations tied to multiple departments
    • Providing input and feedback for continuous improvement of processes
    • Keeping the team on track to achieve deliverables and KPIs on time
    • Briefing and debriefing the team for each project
    • Project analysis
    • Plan, schedule, monitor and report on multiple, large and small IT projects
    • QA checks before deliveries
    • Close work with CEO

    Requirements:

    • Fluent written and verbal English skills required (another language is a big plus)
    • Ability to work effectively and decisively under pressure
    • Ability to handle multiple projects and multiple project types simultaneously
    • Strong organizational skills and the ability to prioritize tasks
    • Ability to prepare and control a work schedule and deliver within budget
    • Knowledge of standard applications, specifically: MS Office and Project, JIRA, Canban Board, GitLab
    • Ability to lead and motivate team members and to work independently and/or in a team
    • Superior attention to detail and the ability to follow tasks through to completion
    • Knowledge of integration principles between different systems (e.g., REST/JSON) is preferred

    We offer:

    • Working in a small team where opinion matters
    • Office in heart of Berlin
    • Enjoy flexible working hours, occasional remote work, and use the tools and hardware of your choice
    • Join an exceptional multinational team

    We guarantee goal oriented working style with great amount of flexibility and freedom! We support with VISA, work permit, bank account and insurance.
    Interested? Send us your application including CV to [email protected] and we’ll get back to you as soon as possible.

items.title: Chromatic: Project Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=5, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Project Manager

Full-time
US Based
Remote job
Small business
Posted Today – Accepting applications
Chromatic in a Nutshell 

Chromatic is a digital agency with over a decade of experience creating websites using open source technologies and a recognized leader in open source content management systems.  We’ve helped some of the web’s biggest brands solve hard problems in publishing, e-commerce, and non-profit spaces. We provide leadership and expertise to our clients through design, back-end development, and automation.

Role Summary
We are looking for a qualified digital project manager to join our team. You will be supporting the day-to-day management and smooth operation of a wide variety of projects and support retainers across the organization.

Typical Day in the Life
This is a boots on the ground position. This project manager will be on the front lines of Chromatic’s projects, ranging from enterprise site builds to monthly maintenance retainers. A typical day in the life of this PM will consist of attending status meetings, recording decisions, and creating and delivering project health/status reports to clients and Chromatic leadership. This person will work alongside our Director of Client Services to ensure the success of our projects and to maintain/grow our client relations.
 
Responsibilities
  • Monitor and report on project budgets and hours.
  • Monitor team and contractor timesheets.
  • Coordinate and schedule meetings.
  • Following up on tasks and open items.
  • Quality assurance support for all deliverables.
  • Produce various reports (status reports, budget, etc.).
  • Contribute to project documentation (i.e. Project Briefs, Functional Requirements, etc).
  • Create agendas and facilitate meetings.
  • General marketing and writing support as needed.
  • Identify and refine out of scope client needs.
  • Provide assistance with resourcing projects.
  • Enthusiasm, personality, teamwork and a positive attitude count tremendously. Serious candidates will be sure to include an introductory video with their application.
 
The right person for this role…
  • Has proven work experience (at least 2-3 years) as a project manager or coordinator (or similar role) within digital services.
  • Can deftly manage their time (and others’).
  • Can juggle multiple initiatives at once.
  • Loves lists and spreadsheets.
  • Has excellent communication skills - both written and verbal.
  • Has a keen attention to detail.
  • Is a problem solver.
  • Is never afraid to ask questions.
  • Learns to anticipate client and team needs.
  • Is self-motivated with a strong work ethic.
  • Is comfortable leading discussions, even the hard ones.
  • Is eager to learn and own projects end-to-end.
  • Is rarely defensive with others.
  • Has hands-on experience with ticketing systems such as Jira or GitHub.

Some Other Important Traits
  • Chromatic is a distributed team  – strong communication skills, both verbal and written, are of the utmost importance.
  • The desire and ability to brainstorm ideas, do research, remain current with industry trends and best practices.
  • Enthusiasm, personality, teamwork and a positive attitude count tremendously. 
  • Serious candidates will be sure to include a short, introductory video with their application. Don’t overthink it.

What sets Chromatic apart from a typical job?
  • Work from wherever you want, whenever you want: Our office is completely distributed, you may work from wherever is most effective for you. We encourage our team members to work when it is most effective so they’ll do their best work, but we tend to schedule meetings during the North American workday and expect our team to usually be available during this time.
  • Reasonable Bookings: We book our team members with a max of 30-35 hours per week for project work. We believe more than that is asking too much. The other 5-10 hours is reserved for team meetings, community contribution, and professional/skill development.
  • Vacation: Chromatic does not set rigid vacation limits. We encourage our people to take vacation when they want/need it. So long as it is planned and doesn’t interfere with existing contracts or project deadlines, we’re all for it.
  • Sabbaticals: Chromatic offers a sabbatical to all full-time employees after their seventh anniversary. Our sabbaticals are intended to allow team members extended time to rest both their bodies and their minds away from work and outside of normal vacation/PTO time and are accompanied by a sabbatical stipend.
  • Health Insurance: Chromatic provides competitive medical/dental/vision insurance.
  • 401(k): Chromatic provides employees a 401(k) plan along with a 3% employer contribution with immediate vesting.
  • Disability Insurance: Chromatic provides both short and long term disability insurance.
  • Life Insurance: All employees are provided with a term life insurance policy.
  • Donation Matching: Chromatic is proud to offer a Donation Matching Program for our team members. We will match donations to a 501(c)3 organization dollar for dollar, up to $50 per month for a total of $600 annually.
  • Hardware: Chromatic allows our team members to choose the system that they prefer and we ensure everyone has up-to-date equipment/software.
  • Exciting Projects: Chromatic consistently participates in projects with exciting, high-profile brands and some of the most highly trafficked sites on the web; some of which include Outside Magazine, Martha Stewart, NBC / MSNBC, Shape, Casper, State Farm, Adobe.
  • Conferences: Chromatic frequently sends team members to attend and speak at industry conferences. Employees are encouraged to seek out conference opportunities to grow their skills and personal networks. 
  • Company Retreat: Once a year, we gather the entire company to spend quality time together away from our desks – usually somewhere quite beautiful.
  • Streaming Music Subscription: Music is important to us; we provide a Spotify subscription (or equivalent) for all of our employees.
  • Workflow: We firmly believe in a strong, consistent deployment workflow. We insist on proper code reviews on all of our projects. This not only ensures excellent code quality but more so, makes us all better at our jobs.
  • Team & Culture: We work and support each other as a team. We make an effort to get together as often as possible and support each other personally and professionally at every opportunity.
  • Flexible Work Week: Chromatic offers a flexible work week schedule for interested team members when clients/project specifics allow it.

items.content:
Marketing Project Manager

Position: Marketing Project Manager

Reports to: Head of Customer Operations

Role

Responsible for planning, managing and executing key projects on time and within scope to support the defined strategy of Credit Repair Cloud.

Responsibilities

  • Creating and managing projects plan, scope, milestones, targets, and deadlines to ensure the project is finished on time
  • Identifying all tasks that need to be completed and then assigning those task to the appropriate team members
  • Leading the team and hiring outside contractors when necessary
  • Preparing reports for upper management regarding status of projects
  • Monitoring progress and managing issues, obstacles, and risks during the project to finish on time and within budget
  • Reporting, summarizing and documenting progress, completion, and optimization

Results

  • Projects and processes run more efficiently and are fully documented
  • Project Management tasks are done with attention to detail
  • Project status updates are given to management and team members daily, weekly and monthly, according to an agreed schedule

Requirements

  • 2+ years of experience as a Project Manager in a marketing department
  • Excellent and professional communication and leadership management skills
  • Superb attention to detail and high level of prioritization skills
  • Ability to exercise good judgment in a variety of situations
  • Thrive in a fast-paced environment with the ability to handle multiple objectives in one project
  • Understanding of Internet Marketing, specifically ClickFunnels
  • Proficient computer skills including the ability to work with Google Suite apps, Asana, Slack, ClickFunnels, and more. This is a must! 
  • Strong written and verbal communication
  • Ability to work independently on projects and must be able to work under pressure at times to handle a wide variety of tasks and confidential matters with discretion
  • Motivated, energetic with a can-do attitude
  • Helpful and supportive spirit, a problem solver
  • Professional attitude and presentation

Details

  • This is a remote position, but we do expect our team to be working during PST mornings. 
  • 20-30 hrs per week, which will develop to full time within a couple of months.
  • Competitive salary DOE
  • A great working environment with an international, supportive team
  • We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond.

To apply

  1. Please take this free test https://www.tonyrobbins.com/disc/ and attach a public URL in the form below (could be Google Docs). Please take your time with this assessment and answer honestly. It'll help us work together in the future. 
  2. Please complete the form on the job page.

items.title: PRI: Technical Project Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=8, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
Technical Project Manager

PRI is a close-knit team of smart, creative professionals. We love what we do, and we love to write about it. We are looking for a Technical Project Manager to serve as a lead consultant and project coordinator for projects. A bridge between our Client Strategy and Creative teams, the Digital Project Manager will handle tasking, day-to-day communication, and run projects from start to finish.

Who are we? We're a well-respected interactive agency based out of New Jersey. Known for our deep strategic thinking, we create comprehensive web experiences that span across channels (web, mobile and social).

Responsibilities include:

Project/Practice Management

  • Ability to think critically, analyze, and document business problems to assist the project team in defining a project approach that best suits our clients’ needs
  • Creating and managing business requirements and technical specifications, as necessary to define project scope and manage the iterative nature of digital projects
  • Creating and executing project plans, and revising them as appropriate to meet changing needs and requirements
  • Ability to define resource needs, then communicate and collaborate those project needs to other project managers to determine resource assignments across all active projects
  • Ability to identify risks and resolve them pro-actively with consideration for short and long term project impact
  • Managing day-to-day operational aspects of assigned projects and scope
  • Carefully reviewing and contributing to deliverables prepared by team before passing to client
  • Ability to document project meetings, including stakeholder or user interviews
  • Ability to facilitate user research using active and passive research methods
  • Manage cross-functional team responsible for pilot deliverables

Client Management

  • Managing day-to-day client interaction
  • Setting and managing client expectations
  • Identifying needs and evaluating alternative solutions
  • Building a knowledge base of each client's business, organization, and objectives
  • Seeking opportunities to increase customer satisfaction and deepen client relationships
  • Ensuring the project team confirms the direction of its approach and delivers on its stated promises
  • Serves as the first point of contact for clients with new website/marketing projects as well as websites/projects in maintenance and/or maintenance requests.

Project Accounting

  • Tracking and managing team hours, by project, on a weekly basis
  • Managing project budgets & expenses

Communication

  • Facilitating team and client meetings
  • Preparing regular status reports and leading status meetings with clients
  • Keeping project teams well-informed
  • Delivering engaging, informative, well-organized presentations as needed
  • Understanding how to communicate difficult/sensitive information tactfully
  • Resolving and/or escalating issues in a timely fashion

Desired Skills:

  • Hyper-organized, detail-oriented, and able to take ownership of projects to ensure quality and client satisfaction
  • Understand the web development process, from discovery to launch
  • Basic programming skills and able to do light coding where necessary (HTML, CSS, PHP)
  • Experience with web analytics and optimization tools (Google Analytics, Optimizely, Google Website Optimizer)
  • Able to handle multiple simultaneous deadlines
  • Excellent “expectations management” skills
  • Can simultaneously execute towards the big picture and identify the nitty-gritty steps required
  • Experienced project manager and lover of project management tools--Teamwork a plus
  • Understand the basics of online marketing, SEO, and social media
  • An eye for good UI/UX design even though you’re not a designer
  • Love technology and easily adapt to new tools
  • Bachelor’s degree
  • 2+ years experience at an interactive or digital agency or relevant experience
  • Other duties as directed or required.

    Related Jobs See more Business & Management jobs→

    • New
      View company profile
      Nash
      Technical Project Managerfeatured
      Full-Time/Remote

SerpApi, LLC | Head of Sales | Austin, TX | Full-Time Contract | Remote first company | https://serpapi.com

SerpApi is an API to scrape and parse search engine results.

We are looking for someone to take over the leadership of our sales efforts. We are a small startup. Scope of the position includes qualification of leads and existing customers, triage of incoming emails and call leads, customer account management, making existing customers upgrade to bigger packages, customer account setup for custom packages, cold emailings, cold callings, and invoicing.

We value tremendously transparency and open source: https://github.com/serpapi

We're offering full-time 1099 contract @ with a fix and a commission. We are a remote first company and this position is also 100% remote with everything online and async. We expect 40h per week but can organize your time the way you see fit.

Apply at julien _AT_ serpapi.com

items.title: Senior Project Manager
items.content:
Senior Project Manager at GovernmentCIO

Remote

Job Locations: US-Remote

Job ID: 2019-1974

# of Openings: 1

Category: Information Technology

Overview

Government CIO is looking for a Sr. Project Manager to join our team. The candidate should have experience with a civil agency, preferably Veterans Affairs.

Responsibilities

  • Must have experience with diverse IT projects both large and small.
  • Must be well versed in full systems development life cycle, enterprise wide network engineering, strategic information planning, business process re-engineering, structure and management practices.
  • Must be able to identify and mitigate risks to the program.
  • Must be able to manage to cost, schedule and performance.
  • Demonstrated experience successfully managing disparately located personnel.
  • Demonstrated and current experience managing programs with complex data processing requirements.
  • Demonstrated and current experience managing program delivering systems/tools/solutions in production, while transitioning to better technology solutions.
  • Must be able to provide oral and written discussion of analytical findings using narrative and graphic forms.
  • Must be able to use qualitative and quantitative analytical skills to assess the effectiveness of the operations.
  • Identifying symptoms for process improvement.
  • Analytical and investigation skills
  • Ability to work independently with minimal guidance and supervision

Qualifications

Desired:

  • Experience with SAFe/agile development teams
  • Experience leading and transitioning to sustainment / production operations
  • Experience leading process and tools transformations
  • Experience managing projects and project reporting from standard project management tools (examples: Microsoft Project, Rational, Rally, GitHub, Zenhub, VA EPMD tools and VIP Dashboard, Jira, and others)
  • Demonstrates organizational awareness, political savvy, and understanding of effective leadership principles and team dynamics
  • Experience leading virtual / geographically distributed teams

Desired:

  • Experience managing teams in a DEV/OPS model (Development / Operations, full system life cycle)
  • VA Project Management experience

Bachelors Degree is preferred

  • 15 years of experience
  • 8 years additional experience can be substituted for degree

items.content:
Summary
We are looking for a motivated and high-achieving Project Manager who will be helping our CTO to run projects and manage communication with our stakeholders related to all of our activities. If you have a strong sense of project management with knowledge of tech tasks and you are located in Serbia, this may be the job for you.

The Company
causaLens is a deep-tech startup based in London backed by prominent VCs. We are on a mission to develop a machine that predicts the global economy in real-time. We develop the next generation of autonomous predictive technology for complex and dynamic systems. We call it the CLPU (causaLens Predictive Unit). Our technology helps large organisations optimise business outcomes at scale.
Visit www.causaLens.com to find out more.

Benefits:
Successful candidate will have the opportunity to join a fast-growing, agile and international team passionate about innovation. You will be one of the first 20 employees who will impact the future of the company. We will offer guidance, mentorship and opportunities for turbo-charged professional development. This is a remote position, but you will communicate with the team daily. We will also be having company get-togethers on a regular basis.

Responsibilities:

Work closely with CTO to shadow him throughout his tasks
Provide vision and direction to the development team and stakeholders throughout the project and create requirements
Assess value, develop cases, and prioritize stories, epics and themes to ensure work focuses on those with maximum value that are aligned with product strategy
Provide an active role in mitigating impediments impacting successful team completion of Release/Sprint Goals
Managing customer satisfaction within project transition period
Identifying and developing new opportunities with clients
Meeting with project team members to identify and resolve issues
Submitting project deliverables and ensuring that they adhere to quality standards

Core requirements:

Proven experience in a company that is in the tech industry as a project manager
Perfect command in verbal and written English
Outstanding communication, presentation and leadership skills
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Understanding of technical language and software development process
Ability to work independently and remotely in a responsible manner
Creative thinker with a vision that can thrive in a start-up environment
Located in Serbia

items.title: Sr. Scrum Master - W2 (Remote)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=1, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
NOTE: U.S. Citizens, GC and those authorized to work in the U.S (without Sponsorship) are encouraged to apply.
We are unable to Consider OPT or H1B Visa Candidates for this position.

Agile Coach 10+ years of experience working within or in leadership roles in agile scrum teams working at scale under SAFe methodologies. Technical lead, Product Owner, RTE, Product Manager experience a plus.

Minimum Qualifications:
Related Business/ Technical Knowledge, Skills and Expertise:
* Agile Project/Program Management experience in the deployment of leading edge, multi-vendor technologies in a highly complex commercial environment.
* Has basic knowledge of software architecture
* Has demonstrated clear leadership skills and experience working with large project teams
* Has demonstrated advanced presentation skills
* Understands the organization, goals, and evaluates program deliverables for near and long-term, business improvements
* Advanced JIRA, MS Office and Smartsheet skills
  • Capable of preparing presentations, reports.
  • Self driver, leadership qualities
  • Education and Experience:
    * Requires BS/BA degree or equivalent, and 5+ years related experience in networking/telecommunications industry Project Management role
    * Has professional project management training credentials (PMI)
  • 2-3 years of experience in business analysis, project management, consulting
  • Experience utilizing JIRA and MS Office for project planning and tracking
  • Facilitate the stakeholder meetings
  • Strong analytical skills in root cause analysis and issue resolution
  • Strong communication skills
  • Certifications in PMP, Certified Scrum Master (CSM), Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP), Agile Scrum Master (ASM), Professional Scrum Master I (PSM I), or Scrum Master Certified (SMC) are preferred
Your responsibilities:
  • You will be accountable for guiding, coaching, training in scrum methodologies and assisting the team in Scrum / Agile principles and driving process improvement.
  • You will work with the team to deliver value and coordinates within and outside of the team to facilitate the completion of the team's backlog and guiding the team to adding stories to its backlog as appropriate.
  • You will proactively identify impediments and appropriately resolve using network of peers (Scrum of Scrums) and formal channels (including escalation if required)
  • You will drive/manage/oversee all aspects of multiple simultaneous fast-paced assigned projects with distributed teams
  • You will coordinate the release plan, communication plan, risks and issues management plan, (these are PO duties)
  • You will assist Product Owner in managing scope of team(s) and facilitating changes.
  • Facilitates team's Agile Scrum ceremonies (Release Planning, Sprint Planning, Backlog Refinement, Daily Scrum, Sprint Review/Demo, Sprint Retrospective
  • Ensures (using SCRUM and AGILE) appropriate, complete and timely team achievement of all documentation, tracking and reporting metrics (including: user stories, project progress, resource utilization, change requests, issues, risks, risk mitigation plans, test scripts, test results) and ensure delivery timelines.
Qualifications:
  • Solid understanding of software development life cycle models as well as expert knowledge of SCRUM and Agile with knowledge of traditional project management principles and practices and the ability to blend them together in the right proportions to fit a project and business environment
  • A proven track record of successful Agile product delivery or lean product development
  • Prior experience with SCRUM/Agile methodologies with enterprise-level application development projects. PMI-ACP, CSM, or equivalent preferred
  • Experience overseeing multi-function product teams with at least 6-9 team members including Product Managers, Developers, Analysts, and QA Personnel
  • Balanced business/technical background:
  • Sufficient level of technical background to provide highly-credible leadership to development teams and to be able to accurately and objectively evaluate complex project risks and issues
  • 3-5 Years of Experience
  • BA or BS or equivalent experience is required; MA or MS is a plus
  • Solid understanding of and demonstrated experience administering JIRA across multiple SCRUM teams
  • Strong interpersonal skills including mentoring, coaching, collaborating, and team building
