items.content:
Director of Learning Design, Math at Edmentum

Remote
  • Curriculum & Assessment Development DIREC03683
  • Full-Time
  • Minneapolis, MN, USA
  • Dallas, TX, USA
  • Remote, USA

Description

Edmentum is committed to making it easier for educators to individualize learning for every student through simple technology, high-quality content, actionable data, and customer success. Founded in innovation, Edmentum’s powerful learning solutions blend technology with individual teaching approaches. We are dedicated to being educators’ most trusted partner in creating successful student outcomes everywhere learning occurs. Our commitment is built off the emphasis we place on our core values: passion, people, respect, collaboration, and performance.

The Director of Learning Designer, Math serves as an integral thought leader in the company helping to research and develop Edmentum’s strategy for math content and related products. The Director of Learning Design, Math will collaborate across curriculum, research, product management, and platform teams to lead the planning and learning design for math content and products, supporting the VP Learning Design in presenting strategic plans to the Executive Leadership Team. The position will lead the charge in creating learning design recommendations, both digital and print, that lead the company step by step towards becoming part of the core ecosystem within Tier 1, mainstream classrooms. The vision of the right candidate should be strongly grounded in math current classroom practice, educational research, math core products, math digital products, and an interest in innovation in blended learning that meets the everyday needs of practitioners. Scope of responsibilities may begin K-12 and focus later on K-6 or 6-12 as need for specialization arises.

Here’s what you’ll do:

  • Bear the torch for excellence in math learning design both within the company and support the company in making incremental changes in math content learning design and in associated core product offerings.
  • Demonstrated track record in producing into product educational research in thoughtful and innovative ways.
  • Collaborate with the research department on understanding key math research and introducing new research that enhances Edmentum’s instructional thinking, understanding how both scientifically based research and best practices authorship impact market direction and student outcomes.
  • Ability to achieve results through influence across an organization and collaboration with other departments.
  • Represent the needs of the teacher, the learner, and the administrator in math product discussions.
  • Support the product management team in putting together business plans for products related to math, as necessary.
  • Evaluate partners for excellence against an agreed-upon evaluation rubric and interface with the Manager of Product Partnerships, Learning Design management, and the Executive Leadership Team (ELT) on pursuing advantageous math partnerships.
  • Understand and apply effective classroom practice to high-quality learning design in math and in other areas as assigned.
  • Create Learning Design Briefs and other learning design tools to help guide development of courseware and features.
  • Support the Curriculum team in creating math content by providing guidelines and reviewing key sample content.
  • Partnering with Product Management and Curriculum, evaluate all product ideas for math against academic research, market research (customer surveys, user interviews, purchased surveys), and an in-depth knowledge of current educational practice and the workflow of a teacher’s day.
  • Participate in focus groups, customer interviews, field tests, and site visits that explore direction in the math market and that respond to product concepts and prototypes.
  • Collaborate with Product Management and Software Engineering in understanding the potential for math innovation within our products.
  • Collaborate with Content Development, Research, Product Management, Platform Development, and UI/UX on math learning design initiatives.
  • Interface with and potentially recruit math academic experts and investigate how to implement their feedback.
  • Meet all goals of quality, schedule and budget.
  • Represent Edmentum math learning design within Edmentum and externally with customers and at tradeshows and other events.

Here’s what you’ll need:

  • Experience in math classroom teaching and education preferred.
  • Experience in learning design in math (prototyping, guidelines, scope & sequence creation).
  • Five years’ experience in implementing or design math programs.
  • Has hands-on experience with math core programs and an in-depth knowledge of the competitive field in both core programs and ed tech.
  • Knowledge and experience with UDL and accessibility.
  • Ability to build teams and review others’ work with positive guidance.
  • Proven track record in achieving results through collaboration.
  • Highly creative with strong design skills.
  • Experienced in a variety of innovative instructional modalities and design approaches including game-based learning, close reading, project-based learning, and others.
  • Has strong communication skills (oral, written, and business) to function effectively in a leadership role with internal and external clients and liaise with other national education experts.
  • Ability to tailor technical presentations to different audiences.
  • High levels of collaboration and cross-functional skills and experience.
  • Inspirational, motivational, and results-based leadership skills.
Apply for job

items.content:
Director of Product

About the position

The Director of Product is a key member of the leadership team at Creative Commons. Reporting to the CEO, they lead the strategy, delivery, and adoption of CC’s major products including CC Search . CC’s vision is “nothing less than realizing the full potential of the Internet — universal access to research and education, full participation in culture — to drive a new era of development, growth, and productivity.” These products will support CC’s strategy to create a vibrant, usable global commons powered by collaboration and gratitude. 

We take a data-driven and user-centered approach to our work. You are someone who's creative, entrepreneurial, and focused on achieving outcomes. You love a big idea, and know how to break it down, evaluate it, and build a plan to make it real. You can see the complexity of the ecosystem, but also worry about the details, especially those that create utility and delight. You know how to use experimentation, iteration, and data-driven research to create product impact and meet strategic goals.

The Director sets strategy, goals and targets for the design and development of CC’s products, including: product vision and roadmap, feature prioritization and implementation, service and revenue model(s), partnerships, growth and user engagement. You will work in close collaboration with the Director of Engineering and her team throughout the process. You will seek opportunities to integrate CC’s tools with partners that could help us meet our strategic goals. 
 

Primary responsibilities

  • Lead and define the product vision, strategy, and implementation of CC’s major products, including our flagship initiative, CC Search:

  • Identify, research, and target key user segments for existing and new products

  • Translate analytics, data and user feedback into actionable product plans

  • Become an industry expert in how content is created, shared, discovered, and re-used online, including a deep knowledge of the competitive product landscape and user needs

  • Work hand-in-hand with engineering, policy, legal and engagement to define and plan specific product initiatives, identify risks and opportunities, and bring strategy to reality

  • Develop products that complement or build upon existing CC products in support of CC’s strategy and goals
  • Conduct usability research to provide ongoing and up-to-date insights into sharing and collaboration with CC tools online and inform CC’s product development, and promote our continued relevance and impact

  • Lead the Tools & Product team along with the General Counsel and Director of Engineering, working closely with them to define team OKRs and coordinate and communicate project plans and dependencies.

  • Orchestrate partnerships that integrate CC’s tools into new and existing platforms and services that extend the reach and utility of the commons to users everywhere.

  • Work in the open, in public documents and repositories, open chat rooms, public wikis and a global community.

    • Qualifications and requirements 
    • Experience leading product management and partnership processes, including:

    • Experience in developing and/or contributing to strategy, leading and managing projects, and working with distributed teams

    • Experience negotiating, motivating, and collaborating with technical teams in executing on product development and shipping features into software

    • Experience negotiating and communicating with diverse stakeholders to create good outcomes for all parties

    • Excellent interpersonal, negotiation, and problem-solving skills

    • Superior project management, analysis, planning, and strategy skills

    • Familiarity with human-centered design, user profiling, and insights development to support product strategy and design

    • Sound understanding of the Internet, its technical structures, and business models

    • Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills

    • Understanding of basic technical and design concepts related to CC integration and the use of CC tools, including legal, technical, and user experience

    • Ability to work in a distributed team environment, build good working relationships, and produce quality work in a remote work structure

    • Fluent in English; second language competency a plus

    • Familiarity with open licenses and copyright law is a plus, but not required
    Diversity & Inclusion

    We believe that diverse teams build better organizations and better services. Applications from qualified candidates from all backgrounds, including those from under-represented communities, are very welcome. Creative Commons works openly as part of a global community, guided by collaboratively developed codes of conduct and anti-harassment policies.

    Work Environment and Location

    Creative Commons is a fully-distributed organization — we have no central office. This position is available to applicants working in the range of the Eastern to Pacific time zones, in a remote working environment. You must have reasonable mobility for all necessary travel, including meetings with CC partners and organizations, selected conferences, twice-annual all-staff meetings and the Global Summit — this usually means about 6 - 8 trips per year. We provide a subsidy towards high-speed broadband access. Laptop/desktop computer and necessary resources are supplied.

    Salary and Benefits

    Creative Commons is a leading non-profit employer, offering competitive salaries and benefits, including health and wellness plans, annual retirement contributions, and a positive, supportive work environment. We offer competitive salary in the range for this position from $95,000 - $120,000 USD, commensurate with relevant skills, experience, and location.

    How to Apply

    Please email your cover letter and resume as a single PDF to “jobs@creativecommons.org” with the subject heading of “Director of Product / [Last Name].” Phone calls and messages will not be returned.

    Related Jobs See more Product jobs→

    • View company profile
      BriteCore
      Director of Productfeatured
      Full-Time/North America

items.title: Project Manager
items.content:
Project Manager at Animal Legal Defense Fund

Remote
  • Animal Legal Defense Fund
  • Reports to: Project Management Program Director
  • Term of Employment: Full-time, Exempt, At Will
  • Location: Cotati, CA; remote applicants will also be considered

Description: The Project Manager provides planning, tracking and management of the Animal Legal Defense Fund’s (ALDF) legal campaigns, enabling our program staff to effectively meet their strategic objectives to advance the field of animal law. The Project Manager fulfils a similar role for ALDF’s cross-functional events, to ensure they are executed on time, on budget and within scope. The Project Manager is an integral part of ALDF’s Project Management Program and works closely with interdepartmental teams to produce successful projects and meet the requirements of key stakeholders.

Essential Responsibilities:

Campaign Project Management (60%)

The Project Manager will be responsible for managing the planning, progress and execution of ALDF’s major campaigns, including:

  • Working with the project stakeholders to develop a project charter, outlining the scope, budget, deliverables, priorities, risk assessment, roles and responsibilities, and protocols for the campaigns
  • Participating in project team selection and clearly communicating expectations to team members and stakeholders
  • Creating a project management and execution plan and maintaining all project documentation
  • Developing a work breakdown structure and estimating the resources required for each task
  • Managing tasks via Project Pro software and providing regular updates to stakeholders regarding progress, milestones, potential delays and risk management plans
  • Being accountable for project team performance and results and acting as a mediator between stakeholders and project team members
  • Effectively managing project scope and dependencies and ensuring any changes to scope are documented and approved
  • Identifying team conflicts and potential project delays and working with the project team to resolve these issues or escalate to the appropriate senior or executive staff
  • Identifying and completing project close-out tasks and leading post mortem meetings to review achievements and recommend improvements for future projects

Event Project Management (35%)

The Project Manager will also be responsible for managing the planning, progress and execution of a portfolio of ALDF’s cross-functional events and receptions, including:

  • Completing all deliverables outlined under the “Campaign Project Management” heading above, as they relate to Event Project Management
  • Ensuring projects remain on time and on budget
  • Participating as a member of the steering committees for assigned events

Program Support (5%)

The Project Manager will also be responsible for the following:

  • Communicating key project details and updates to staff and board members and producing planning memos, as required
  • Providing on-site support for ALDF’s large, annual events, as needed
  • Managing staff and volunteer roles and schedules at events, as needed
  • Other duties as assigned by the Project Management Program Director

Key Qualifications:

The ideal candidate will:

  • Understand and be fully committed to the mission of the Animal Legal Defense Fund
  • Have a minimum of 5 years’ of project management experience
  • Have a proven track record of successful team management, be a skilled negotiator and have the ability to hold team members accountable for their performance
  • Have excellent facilitation, presentation and leadership skills
  • Be able to work independently and be a skilled problem-solver
  • Be able to think strategically and juggle multiple tasks and deadlines while Crotatmaintaining composure
  • Be a skilled writer with strong attention to detail
  • Have excellent planning, organizational, critical thinking and prioritization skills
  • Have excellent interpersonal skills and be able to communicate effectively with colleagues, vendors, and the public
  • Be “computer literate” with working knowledge of common computer applications including Outlook, Word, Excel, Adobe Reader, web browsers, social media platforms, etc.
  • Be experienced using Microsoft Project Pro or similar software
  • Have excellent references relevant to similar positions held
  • Have a valid driver’s license and insurance

In addition to the above qualifications:

  • Experience with event planning is preferred but not required
  • Knowledge of the key people and issues within the field of animal law is preferred

Compensation:

Competitive salary with excellent benefits, including; 100% employer paid comprehensive health care plan, including a flexible spending account, dental benefits, life insurance, generous Paid Time Off, a 401k retirement plan with employer match, up to 5% of annual salary. Maintaining a healthy work/life balance is a core value for the Animal Legal Defense Fund.

Work Environment:

The workplace is a busy, two-story office located in Cotati, California. The workplace is business casual and includes companion animals. Products made from animals or animal parts are prohibited in the office. Remote applicants will also be considered.

Apply for job

items.title: Head of Content (Operations)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
UENI is a "do-it-for-me" solution that sets us apart from DIY website builders and expensive digital agencies. We take an innovative approach to getting small businesses online by reducing the friction for a business owner to do so. UENI structures the data it collects from a business and creates a website for each business and listings on other high traffic platforms. We thus enable these businesses to complete online for the first time.

_Today we are signing up 2000 businesses everyday and we operate in the UK, Spain, France, the USA, LATAM, India and we are growing our global presence every month._

As Head of Content you will oversee all initiatives around creating the customer website and other online and offline presence, across multiple platforms and formats to drive quality, engagement, retention, and positive customer behavior. Where we refer to *‘Content*’, this refers to *customer content* within the UENI product.
The position collaborates with the departments of product, marketing, customer service, dev and human resources to help define both the content strategy and new content creation, the day to day operations of the content team and the reporting processes for the benefit of other departments.

This opportunity is targeting someone process-minded, highly literate, extremely ambitious and keen to take a lot of responsibility. We are moving fast and our content team is central to our continued successful growth.

*Responsibilities*
Ultimately, your job is to work as an *operations manager*, leading the development of content initiatives to drive growth in the content offered to the various categories of business, the completeness and granularity of categorization and most importantly the daily management of content teams across multiple markets and locations.

This includes:
* Ensuring all content is created according to the company plans of rapid expansion in new markets, consistent in terms of quality, efficiency, and optimized for search and localized user experience for all markets. This is to be done for each market and category.
* Mapping out a content strategy that supports and extends marketing initiatives, both short- and long-term, determining which methods work for the different markets and categories. Continuous involvement of strategy is a must amidst fast-paced growth in different languages.
* Developing a timeline for content creation across business categories, languages and markets, and defining the owners to handle the stages of content creation and quality control.
* Supervising content team, writers, quality control; to be an arbiter of best practices across the content team. .
* Developing standards, systems and best practices (both human and technological) for content creation, venue build, quality control, assistance to Customer Success dept, and adaptation to evolving needs based on UENI’s business strategy
* Integrating content activities within the product and marketing scope of work.
* Conducting tests to gauge content effectiveness. Gathering data and handle analytics (or supervise those who do) and make recommendations based on those results. Working with owners of particular content to revise and measure particular content and marketing goals.
* Leveraging market and CS data to drive plans and adjustments in content team activities.
* Working with the product and technical teams to implement improvements of content team tools to ensure efficiency, cost reduction and daily productivity..
* Conducting periodic competitive audits.
* Ensuring consistent global experience and implement appropriate localization/translation strategies through appointed representative for each language.
* Leading the hiring and supervising of content team in all markets and roles.

*Requirements*
* Bachelor's degree in English, Journalism, Public Relations, Operations or Business. Project Management or Marketing experience is a plus.
* At least 5 years of experience managing a team and staffing - Either deep experience in digital content creation (websites, social media, directories etc.) or in operations management / project management.
* Technically savvy and hands on: able to jump into company tools to manage processes, review content quality, and ensure that team productivity is adhering to business plan targets
* Multilingual abilities a major plus.

*Skills Required*
The HOC requires a combination of operation management and content management, with the most important aspect being to think “customer first”. In essence, the HOC is the creative and operation manager that must be empathetic toward the pain points of the customer whilst being able to deliver an efficient content creation strategy with the team.

Specific skills required include:
* Proven editorial skills. Outstanding command of the English (or primary customer) language.
* The ability to lead and inspire teams of creative personnel and content creators to achieve the company's stated goals and targets (eg growth in subscriber base, growth in paying customers, reduction in unit costs).
* Leadership skills required to define and manage a set of goals involving diverse contributors in various markets.
* Project management skills to manage venues creation and quality control schedules and deadline. Ability to work under pressure and in a dynamic environment..
* Skill at both long-form content creation and real-time (immediate) content creation.
* Business-minded and driven by data to improve processes, improve efficiency, and increase quality of content to better meet customer needs
* The ability to think like an educator, intuitively understanding what the customers need and how they want their businesses to be represented online.
* A passion for new technology tools (aka, using the tools you preach about) and previous experience in the usage of those tools.
* Excellent negotiator and mediator.
* Incredible people skills and a willingness to work with remote teams and colleagues around the world.
* Basic technical understanding of web publishing, editors, website builders, etc.
* A willingness to embrace change and to adapt strategies on the fly.
* Great reporting skills
* Committed to continually learning the latest platforms, technology tools and solutions through interaction with product department, in particular the CMS.

*What we offer*
* Join an outstanding team culture, working together to help the business achieve its goals and living the UENI values.
* Competitive salary & equity options package
* Holiday increases with each year of service
* Excellent opportunities for personal growth and career development in a people focused organisation.
* More than 300+ discounts with Perkbox
* Employee referral scheme
* Cool office in Hammersmith area with access to gym, fruit, events and plenty of coffee, beer and prosecco

Vice President of Marketing at Achieve Test Prep

Remote

VP Marketing

Remote / Virtual / Home-based

FULL TIME | ACHIEVE | UNITED STATES

Job Information

Location: Remote

Industry: Education

City: Virtual

Zip/Postal Code: 07101

State/Province: New Jersey

Why Achieve?

We believe our employees empower our company and are the reason behind our success. We are the nation’s largest educational consultant and test prep center specializing in credit-by-examination degree paths, headquartered in Wayne, New Jersey.

Most working adults find it challenging to overcome the many obstacles associated with obtaining their college degree. Achieve acts as a counselor, advocate, and partner helping students achieve their degree in less time, with less effort, and for less money utilizing an alternative path to earning college credit known as credit-by-examination. Essentially, Achieve helps students bypass all of the busywork associated with taking certain college courses the traditional way, by instead passing just one test-out exam. While our credit-by-examination programs can shorten the path to any degree at virtually any college, the field where we have the greatest impact is the nursing profession.

Employee engagement and development is one of the keys to our success at Achieve! Embracing a work-from-home model for the entire company, all employees enjoy a better work-life balance through flexible work schedules. Does Achieve sound like the place for you? Apply today!

  • We are seeking an experienced leader for planning, developing, directing and implementing the organization’s brand strategies.
  • This position would be responsible for comprehensive external marketing that would illustrate the organization’s values and mission.
  • The position requires developing strategies and content across all digital platforms directly to our user base.
  • This position requires an individual that can strategically implement emarketing / digital marketing and lead the day-to-day functions in a virtual work environment.
  • Previous work experience developing and executing strategic marketing, research, and social media is required.
  • This position reports to the President/CEO.

Required Education and Experience

  • A minimum of 10 years recent experience in emarketing / digital marketing
  • Demonstrated track record of accomplishments in cutting edge emarketing / digital marketing platforms including SEO/SEM, Google, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn.
  • Previous work experience developing and executing strategic marketing, research and social media
  • Demonstrated track record of taking existing products to existing and new markets, and taking new products to existing and new markets.
  • Ability to function both tactically and strategically

Please include your salary expectations in your cover letter.

items.title: Career Director – Middle States
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=10}
items.content:
Career Director – Middle States at Trilogy Education Services

Remote

Location: Remote

About Trilogy:

Powered by big dreams and small egos, Trilogy is reimagining how skills-based learning can change the face of education. We work with experienced instructors, innovative employers, and top universities to create boot camps that prepare highly-motivated students for high-growth careers.

OUR VALUES

We put students first

We put students first because they deserve nothing less – and our university and employer partners expect nothing less. Every aspect of Trilogy’s success depends on this.

We never stop improving

We believe that continuous improvement is the source of innovation. We lend an ear to both our fans and our critics to deliver better programs, better service, better communication, and better value.

We bring a “can do” attitude

We are a team of entrepreneurs who confront challenges head-on and figure things out. We value action, effort, commitment, and learning.

We succeed only as a team

Teamwork is critical to our success, and we place a tremendous value on how we work together in our immediate teams, between our business units, and across the entire company.

We are seeking:

A highly driven and passionate Career Director to provide high-quality coaching to our graduates. We strive to ensure our students have the skills, knowledge, and resilient mindset needed to secure the job or promotion they are seeking upon graduation from our programs. You will be responsible for:

  • ensuring students have access to the resources and support they need in order to become Employer Ready and enter the job market;
  • teaching students how to develop a successful job search strategy;
  • coaching students through their job search;
  • encouraging them to persist in the face of setbacks and disappointments; and
  • listening to, and addressing, and student concerns or challenges during their job search process.

You will coordinate with our Industry Insights and Impact team (an employer-facing team) to match students to employment opportunities.

You will report into a Regional Career Director.

High-level view of who you are:

  • You are excited to engage with students and provide to them daily coaching, support and encouragement throughout the job search process.
  • You utilize high-quality coaching techniques to build relationships, drive results, and build the skills and mindsets of students to foster independence for lifelong success in their careers.
  • You are skilled at identifying areas in which students both excel and need to improve, and can deliver that feedback in ways that feel supportive to students and ignites them to take action.
  • You can build rapport quickly over the phone or video; students feel comfortable opening up to you and respect and listen to your recommendations.
  • You are interested and excited about becoming an expert in the career opportunities and employer needs of the industries our students are entering Web Development, Data Analytics, Cybersecurity, UX/UI, Financial Technology, and Digital Marketing.
  • You have an eye for detail and are dedicated to maintaining accurate records and reports in Salesforce.
  • You know how to analyze data, draw learnings from it, and implement your findings to improve your career coaching.
  • You know how to work successfully in a remote environment.

As a Career Director, you will achieve the following results:

  • Ensure students who engage with Career Services are Employer Ready and secure employment with a qualifying job within 180 days of graduation
  • Partner with the Industry Insights and Impact team to refer students for available opportunities aligned with their interests and passions
  • Maintain accurate and timely records of activity in Salesforce, including highly detailed notes about a student’s activities and job prospects
  • Take a consultative approach to help students identify the roles and opportunities that align with their passions; help students tailor their professional materials for those specific opportunities
  • Build positive and trusting relationships with students across the country through phone, email, and video conference channels so that you can motivate and support students as they engage in sourcing potential jobs, interviewing and negotiating salaries
  • Ensure all students who participate in Career Services are highly satisfied with their experience
  • Respond to all student emails, texts, and voice messages within the same working day
  • Encourage students to take advantage of the full suite of Career Service offerings including online workshops and events, and in-person Demo Days; collaborate with Profile Coaches to ensure all students have multiple opportunities to complete a high-quality profile
  • Interact with all students in a professional, service-oriented approach
  • Utilize satisfaction data to understand strengths and opportunities for growth; implement learnings to increase satisfaction

What makes you a great fit for this role (Requirements):

  • You have at least four years of experience in recruiting, education or process improvement
  • You have previous experience in career services field or in professional coaching
  • You’ve worked in a capacity as a mentor, coach, case manager or other role where motivating others was essential to your success
  • You’ve had plenty of hits and misses, and can clearly discuss the lessons learned from those misses
  • You’ve successfully worked with a wide variety of individuals from diverse backgrounds
  • You are technically savvy and pick up new software quickly. You have experience with, or a desire and ability to learn, various platforms including Google Docs, Zoom, and Salesforce.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Apply for job

items.title: Program Manager – Configuration Management
items.content:
Program Manager – Configuration Management at Leidos

Remote | Freelance

Job #: R-00014701
Location: Remote/Teleworker
Category: Proj and Prog Management
Schedule (FT/PT): Full time
Travel Required: No
Shift: Day
Potential for Telework: Yes
Clearance Required: Public Trust
Referral Eligibility: Ineligible
Group: Health

Job Description:
The Veteran’s Health group at Leidos has an opening for an ITIL Service Asset and Configuration Management Program Manager position. The role can be worked remote from your home office within the United States. This role will be in support of the Veterans Affairs Service Operations Configuration Management team. Program Manager must have experience with diverse IT projects both large and small. Must be able to manage a portfolio of projects. Must be well versed in full systems development life cycle, enterprise wide network engineering, strategic information planning, business process reengineering, structure and management practices. Must be able to identify and mitigate risks to the program. Must be able to manage to cost, schedule and performance.

The Program Manager shall provide change, release and configuration support at the ITIL program office level and support the ITIL functions of Change Management, Release Management, Build Management and Configuration management, as they are executed throughout the ITOPS. These ITIL management disciplines ensure that all components of product releases and infrastructure changes are organized and deployed in a controlled manner enabling a repeatable process. The Program Manager shall review, analyze and standardize release and deployment processes and audit those processes as well. The Contractor shall support the design and implementation of formal procedures, including checks and balances throughout the process. The Program Manager shall identify and mitigate risk to ensure the integrity and recoverability of the production environment and ensure the currency, accuracy, and completeness of the CMDB for all business and technical data elements for IT Operations applications.

Primary Responsibilities
This resource will support our efforts in aligning Change, Release and Configuration Management through the enterprise and they will assist with this increased workload. They will support the Configuration Management team with establishing organizational timelines, policy and procedures to meet organizational goals. The Resource will assist with leading SharePoint Project Management, Timelines and documentation efforts.

Communication:

  • Requires ability to communicate with executive leadership (internally or client) regarding matters of significant importance to the organization/project.
  • Works to convince others to accept areas view/current practices and agree/accept new concepts, practices and approaches.

Knowledge:

  • Has expert knowledge of industry practices, advanced techniques and solutions within a professional discipline to develop new standards, processes, and solutions.
  • Serves as a subject matter expert for ITIL SACM.
  • Recommends and implements new solutions, processes, policies, standards in support of functions strategy and operations.

Basic Qualifications

  • Masters degree plus 15 years of experience, or 25 years of experience.
  • Requires Program and project management expertise for Configuration Management (ITIL SACM experience).
  • Requires expertise in Change, Release and Configuration Management for process analysis and business Integration.
  • Must be able to manage CMDB remediation efforts as well as be skilled in aligning CMDB’s, and other data sources to a Configuration Management System.
  • Must be able to provide completed products; Timelines, Polices, Directives, SOP’s etc
  • Must have expertise in business process reengineering
  • Must have expert understanding of the ITIL Methodology as supported in Change, Release and Configuration management.
  • Must be able to manage CMDB remediation efforts as well as be skilled in aligning CMDB’s, and other data sources to a Configuration Management System.
  • Must be able to provide completed products; Timelines, Polices, Directives, SOP’s etc
  • Must be able to obtain Public Trust Clearance
  • Must be US Citizen or Greencard Holder based on contract requirements.

Preferred Qualifications

  • CA Service Desk experience. ServiceNow experience.
Apply for job

items.title: Project Manager
items.content:
Project Manager at PointClickCare

Remote

REMOTE

CUSTOMER OPERATIONS

FULL-TIME

PointClickCare is the leading cloud-based software provider for the senior care market in North America. Driven by a passion for innovation and technology, we’re building solutions that have a true impact on people’s lives. Recently named one of Deloitte’s fastest growing technology companies and Canada’s best managed companies, PointClickCare provides vast opportunities and a great culture for our employees. PointClickCare is a dynamic environment to advance your career while performing meaningful work with great people.

Job Location:

  • This position is open to Remote – USA and Mississauga, ON Head Office candidates.

Position Summary:

Reporting to the Sr. Manager of Professional Services, you will act as the primary client liaison to lead multiple customer facing EHR implementation projects simultaneously. You will experience managing customer implementations in a Professional Services environment, and have a proven track record for successful attaining project objectives.

You will be responsible for;

  • Thoroughly understanding the customer’s business and technical needs
  • Acting as primary interface to client business units during all phases of the project
  • Perform project kick-off meetings with customers and delivery resources
  • Identify scope, create project plan, manage, monitor and control multiple externally facing customer implementations of our software. Manage the project budget, team resources, communications, and project plans.
  • Ensure that customers successfully migrate to the PointClickCare solution in the most optimal way, with an effective transition to support upon project close.
  • Monitor and report on project progress, problems and recommended solutions to the customer
  • Identify and resolve risks and issues in a timely manner. Escalate concerns to the project team and senior management when appropriate.
  • Report on deployments, schedules, budgets and revenue using internal methods.
  • Foster continued growth of the team’s project management capabilities, improving knowledge and experience within the PMO.
  • Successfully manages several competing priorities.
  • Contribute to the overall goals and objectives of the project Management Office
  • Creating project plan, identifying scope, goals, deliverables, timelines and required resources
  • Managing the day-to-day implementation of operational project aspects, defining project tasks and resource allocation
  • Supporting customers in migration from current to future state in the most optimal way
  • Updating and tracking project timelines and deliverables
  • Providing direction and support to the implementation team and reviewing deliverables prepared by the team
  • Managing project issues and dependencies

The ideal candidate that we are looking for;

  • Has proven demonstrated experience in project management at a skilled level.
  • Could have PointClickCare Knowledge but not required, though previous experience with healthcare systems (EHR, EMR, Pharmacy) would be great.
  • You might have your PMP or Prince II designation which could give you an extra edge!
  • Solid understanding of systems design would be great.
  • Great attitude and work ethic.
  • Strong leadership and relationship building capabilities, with ability to negotiate with and influence others to drive successful project outcomes.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to interact with not only your team and internal customers, but our externals customers also!
  • An attention to detail and a passion to achieve quality outcomes is critical.
  • Self-starter with the ability to take on new challenges.
  • You are a quick learner with strong analytical and problem solving skills.
  • Ability to self-manage, and monitor and track key performance indicators .

Working at PointClickCare goes beyond the resume, because the work we perform makes a true difference in people’s lives. We build innovative healthcare technology for seniors and their caregivers that improve their quality of life and well-being on a daily basis. We believe work is so much more meaningful when you’re doing it with a higher purpose.

For more information on PointClickCare, please visit us on Glassdoor and LinkedIn.

It is the policy of PointClickCare to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, religion, national origin, status, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law. PointClickCare welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

When you apply for a position, your information is processed and stored with Lever, in accordance with Lever’s Privacy Policy. We use this information to evaluate your candidacy for the posted position. We also store this information, and may use it in relation to future positions to which you apply, or which we believe may be relevant to you given your background. When we have no ongoing legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. If you have any questions about how PointClickCare uses or processes your information, or if you would like to ask to access, correct, or delete your information, please contact PointClickCare’s human resources team here recruitment@pointclickcare.com

Apply for job

items.content:
Part-Time Project Management Assistant Needed

Company: Content Conquered
Location: Anywhere
Job Type: Part-time
Description

Content Conquered is seeking a talented marketing project management assistant to work remotely or in our Saline, MI office. 

You’ll be responsible for:

  • Helping manage our clients’ content marketing campaigns by coordinating the completion of written and designed content among our team of freelancers
  • Ensuring project deadlines are met
  • Editing and proofreading written content
  • Facilitating project completion and on-time delivery of custom content

You may also be asked to write content, do research for content marketing campaigns or carry out internal content marketing activities, depending on your experience.

Who You Are

We’re looking for a capable marketing project assistants assistant who’s confident working independently on multiple projects with many moving pieces. You need to be organized and highly detail-oriented, but also creative when identifying innovative ways to serve our customers. You must also be able to work fast in order to meet both internal and external deadlines, without compromising the quality of your work.

Required Qualifications

  • High school diploma/GED
  • 1-5 years related work experience
  • Strong communication skills
  • Strong editing and proofreading skills
  • Strong organizational skills and good attention to detail
  • Uncompromising ability to meet deadlines
  • Experience with Google Docs (or willingness to learn)
  • Experience with or knowledge of digital marketing best practices (specifically, content marketing)

Preferred Qualifications

  • Past professional writing experience, with a portfolio to represent your work
  • Past experience with WordPress or other blogging CMS
  • Being located near Saline, MI is a plus, but is not required

Rate: $18-$22 per hour; commensurate with experience.

To apply, send your resume and any relevant portfolio pieces to [email protected] Please use the subject line "Your Next Project Management Assistant."

Application Instructions
To apply, send your resume and any relevant portfolio pieces to [email protected] Please use the subject line "Your Next Project Management Assistant."

items.content:
Director of Brand and Communications

The Director of Brand and Communications will be responsible for branding, content, community, and external communications for Chili Piper. Through creative branding and content initiatives, you will:

  • Position Chili Piper as the undisputed leader in the up-and-coming movement of Buyer Enablement
  • Develop Chili Piper’s brand strategy to deeply resonate among our target market and collaborate with key stakeholders to drive customer acquisition initiatives through brand storytelling

  • Work with our design team to effectively articulate Chili Piper’s brand identity and position through color, art style, iconography, and design across digital and print media

  • Ensure consistent brand style and messaging across all online and offline external communication channels

  • Create a content strategy involving team members across the company to attract new customers, empower existing customers, position our team as experts in their field, and position the company as a leader in the marketing and sales space

What You'll Do


  • Drive Chili Piper’s Brand

  • Refine and develop our brand identity and ensure it’s positioned consistently across all marketing and customer communication channels
  • Be a major advocate for the brand and inspire the rest of the team to be advocates through content production and social channels (LinkedIn)

  • Work with the demand gen team on media and creative elements in lead gen campaigns

Develop a Community

  • Build and grow a community for customers and advocates of buyer enablement in online groups (Slack groups, LinkedIn Group, etc)

Content

  • Continually develop Chili Piper’s brand and thought leadership through a comprehensive content strategy spanning blog posts, webinars, videos etc.

  • Help inspire team members across all departments to publish thought leadership content on the blog regularly and help promote and distribute it

  • Regularly find speaking and interview opportunities (podcasts & webinars) for yourself and other members of the team

  • Regularly post on company social media profiles and interact with people who engage with our content

Create Buzz with PR

  • Create and foster relationships with customer advocates, journalists, bloggers, and influencers in the B2B marketing and sales space

  • Manage and execute press releases for major company milestones and for general brand awareness among our industry and the VC community

Events

  • Set up Chili Piper hosted events for key customers and prospects

  • Strategize a future Chili Piper hosted conference around buyer enablement

What We're Looking For


  • 6+ years experience in brand marketing and communication leadership, ideally in B2B SaaS

  • Demonstrated success in building, positioning, and cultivating a strong brand

  • Demonstrated effective and persuasive oral and written communication experience

  • BA/BS Degree in marketing, communications, journalism or a related field

  • Experience working with cross functional teams to support a joint outcome

  • Motivated, driven, scrappy, and enjoys a fast paced startup environment

  • Strong proficiency and experience using Salesforce 1-2+ Years Minimum

  • Strong proficiency and experience using Marketing Automation software 1-2+ Years Minimum (Marketo, Pardot, Hubspot, etc.....)

items.title: Head Of Design
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Head Of Design

Berlin

full-time

As one of the most successful FinTech companies in Europe, Taxfix is an exciting place to work. We’re revolutionizing filing taxes — and saving people money, time and stress by putting a personalized digital tax consultant in the palm of their hands.

In just 2 years, Taxfix has raised €42 million from some of the best investors in the world. We achieved this by putting our customers at the core of what we do and helping themsave millions of euros every week.

Our Mission

Our mission is to help people get their maximum tax refunds in a convenient, transparent and timely manner, hassle-free. Our user-friendly Taxfix App enables people to file within 25 minutes, without any prior tax knowledge or complicated forms.

Our talented team creates products that help people improve and simplify their lives. Our diverse group of over 80 people come from over 20 nations, with a shared a passion for product development and creating an outstanding user experience. Join a team of smart, ambitious, driven people who value open communication and processes.

We are looking for a passionate and experienced Head of Design (f/m/d) to join the product leadership team.

You will:

  • Lead a team of designers across four cross-functional product teams, be a mentor and a good coach to your team, and help them develop and grow as individuals.
  • Ensure your team follows an informed decision making process, help them to gain insights from user research and learn from quantitative data.
  • Be responsible for the overall alignment and scalability of our design system and ensure it evolves toward our strategic objectives.
  • Grow a strong team culture that cultivates a collaborative, transparent and inclusive work environment.
  • Attract and recruit new talented designers, and be involved in employer branding initiatives.
  • Spend some time to do some actual hands-on design work.
Requirements

You have:

  • Design experience: You must have 5+ years of experience in a senior UI/UX design role, and have experience working on mobile consumer products, ideally in an agile environment.
  • Management skills: You have 2+ years of experience managing design teams, design projects, and stakeholders.
  • People leadership: You enjoy working with people, and have a track record for building. and leading design teams in a motivated and dynamic environment.
  • Result-orientation: You set clear goals and metrics, shape strategies, and align the team on the right path to success.
  • Pragmatism: Have strong positive attitude, and you can overcome challenges with passion and creativity.
What You Gain:
  • Get to make an impact on thousands of people’s lives every day
  • Be paid a competitive salary with stock options
  • Benefit from remote work opportunities and flexible working hours
  • Have the option to take German language courses
  • Be supported to grow and take leadership from day one
  • Work with the best and learn from other competent and brilliant people
  • Work in a beautiful, inspiring office in Friedrichshain
  • Have the option to bring your best buddy to work. We love dogs!
  • Get relocation and visa support

At Taxfix, we don’t just accept diversity, we celebrate it! We’re proudly committed to equal employment opportunities no matter your gender, race, religion, age, sexual orientation, color, disability or place of origin. We care about one another at Taxfix and are grateful for each person’s individual contribution to our overall purpose and goals.

Join us to build a better future together!

Apply for this job ↬

items.title: Head of CRM/Customer Activation - Fintech
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=8, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=9}
items.content:
*Role:* Consumer CRM
*Where:* London, Cardiff, Remote

*The Company*
Tired of paying huge upfront prices for flights, hotels and holidays? So were we! So we’re changing it, for everyone.

Awaymo let’s travellers spread the cost of flights and hotels with simple instalment plans. Unlike other booking sites, Awaymo customers don’t have to pay for their trip in full before they travel. We have thousands of customers across the UK using our platform (awaymo.com) to search, book, and finance their holidays, interest free.

Our customer base is loyal and passionate (as you will see from our online reviews) and, and we are expanding our product team to deliver the next level of customer delighting products and features.

*The Role*
We’ve got a growing but neglected user base, and we’re looking for a CRM champion to own our outbound audience marketing channel with best in class content planning, creation and campaign execution, activating, engaging, converting and delighting Awaymo account holders at all touch points throughout the customer life cycle.

*You’ll be responsible for defining our CRM strategy from top to bottom, including:*
* Define the CRM Strategy and create a clear implementation plan covering tools, methods and content
* Plan and manage CRM calendar and campaign review process
* Deliver targeted email campaigns, direct mail drops, and other touch points
* Create highly engaging email copy that is personalised to the target audience
* Use data and analytics to inform the CRM & Loyalty strategy
* Follow a strategic approach to segmentation by using a mix of personal and behavioural data
* Optimise performance of automated campaigns through testing and learning initiatives to ensure our metrics remain at or above target
* Drive continual revenue growth from our customer database
* Steer the customer experience and optimisation of our direct communications, to ensure we provide a user-centric, engaging experience for our customers, whilst meeting goals and KPIs
* Implement a clear and concise measurement plan and present to stakeholders regularly with accurate KPIs

*What You’ll Need:*
* Significant experience in a CRM role, implementation change and creating effective CRM plans
* Experience in implementing new software/tools/systems/processes
* Excellent analysis and reporting skills with a clear focus on results
* Experience in developing new targeted initiatives to drive customer behaviour change
* Knowledge of how to talk to the customer across the full customer journey in key brand media channels
* Knowledge and experience with marketing automation and data driven marketing
* Positive attitude, able to work under pressure and within a moving framework
* Be a self-starter and take control of your own work-flow
* Strong understanding of psychology and human behaviour
* Love to solve problems and be challenged
* To be a constant learner. Always growing - both personally and with the team
* Excellent copywriting, communication and presentation skills
* Strong analytical skills and an interest in data
* Fluent in spoken and written English

*Desired:*
* Some experience in programming and ability to code simple HTML emails
* At least 2 years of experience working in fast-paced startup environment
* Travel or fintech experience

*What we offer*
* High-impact role at an industry disrupter
* Casual dress
* Free beer/cider/tea/coffee/water/etc
* Ping pong and air hockey tables
* Team nights out
* Fantastic London location with private offices in WeWork

If you are looking to be on the cutting edge of fintech and travel in the UK, Awaymo is the place for you. Please send your CV to careers@awaymo.com and don’t forget to say which role you are applying for in the subject line.

items.content:
*Role:* Head of Paid Acquisition
*Where:* London, Cardiff, Remote

*The Company*
Tired of paying huge upfront prices for flights, hotels and holidays? So were we! So we’re changing it, for everyone.

Awaymo lets travellers spread the cost of flights and hotels with simple instalment plans. Unlike other booking sites, Awaymo customers don’t have to pay for their trip in full before they travel. We have thousands of customers across the UK using our platform (awaymo.com) to search, book, and finance their holidays, interest free.

Our customer base is loyal and passionate (as you will see from our online reviews) and, and we are expanding our product team to deliver the next level of customer delighting products and features.

*The Role*
We’re a funded, fast growing startup, and we’re hungry for FAST GROWTH! We are seeking a paid acquisition specialist to lead our performance marketing efforts, and who will be responsible for deploying our ever-growing marketing budget.

*About you:*
* You’re analytical and take a data driven approach to digital acquisition
* You test and move, quickly.
* You’re VERY bright and you see trends early, and act on them.
* You LIVE for marketing and paid acquisition, you literally love it!

*What you'll be doing:*
* Deploying our marketing budget with responsibility for hitting revenue growth and CAC goals
* Work together with the marketing team to define our funnel, creating targeted and engaging content to grow every stage of it
Shape Awaymo’s marketing strategy and define processes and systems that will be used not only by you, but also by future performance marketers joining your team
Develop a deep understanding of our users - their goals, annoyances and desires.

*What You’ll Need:*
* 3+ years of experience successfully managing a 7 figure marketing budget (successful being defined as hitting and exceeding your KPIs, delivering growth for the business)
* Expert knowledge of performance platforms including Google Ads, Facebook Ads
* Expert knowledge of analytics tools including Google Analytics, Heap, Excel
* Be a self-starter and take control of your own work-flow
* Strong understanding of psychology and human behaviour
* Love to solve problems and be challenged
* To be a constant learner. Always growing - both personally and with the team

*Desired:*
* Startup experience
* Travel or fintech experience

*What we offer*
* High-impact role at an industry disrupter
* Casual dress
* Free beer/cider/tea/coffee/water/etc
* Ping pong and air hockey tables
* Team nights out
* Fantastic London location with private offices in WeWork

If you are looking to be on the cutting edge of fintech and travel in the UK, Awaymo is the place for you. Please send your CV to careers@awaymo.com and don’t forget to say which role you are applying for in the subject line.

tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)

hiringOrganization.name: TutukaFull-TimeMiddle East, South East Asia, EuropeFollow Up BossFull-TimeU.S.AHealthy Hemp OilContractRemote

items.content:
Director of Sales

We are looking for a Director of Sales to provide leadership, strategic direction, and daily management of our growing sales organization. You are someone with a passion for coaching and who loves to work hands-on with their team. You should apply if you are creative, have experience building high-performance teams and promoting top talent, and if you’re excited about our mission to build a world where no one’s health is hindered by their need.

About the Role
The Director of Sales will:
  • Report to the CEO
  • Develop strategy to support opportunity growth
  • Recruit for and lead a small but growing team
  • Develop the team through call-shadowing, 1:1 coaching, and pipeline reviews
  • Participate in the sales cycle and push deals to close
  • Take a data-driven approach to pipeline management and forecasting
  • Identify opportunities for process growth and improvement
  • Track, and report sales metrics, account activity, and revenue forecasts to leadership
About You
  • 5+ years of proven success as a sales leader at a small, growing company
  • 3+ years of complex enterprise sales success
  • Accomplished in hiring, coach, and managing experienced enterprise sales talent
  • The mindset to lead by example in terms of your work ethic and willingness to “get your hands dirty”
  • Experience with Account Based Selling or other comparable sales strategies for
  • Ability to thrive in a startup environment
  • Proficiency with Salesforce administration and other sales engagement technology
And the following would be preferred
  • 2+ years experience selling into health plans

Benefits
Together, we live into our Core Values

  • We lead with empathy: We believe in kindness, empathy, assuming good intentions and finding mutual understanding from our teammates, customers, and users.
  • We lean into vulnerability: We're not afraid to ask for help or give and receive feedback. We build off our failures and don’t shy away from tough conversations.
  • We rise above the status quo: We hold our work to a high standard. We continuously learn and improve so that we can develop excellent products for the people and communities we serve
  • We match grit with wit: We love a challenge and the opportunity to get creative and solve interesting problems
...and to further support them, we offer:
  • Unlimited Vacation
  • Equity
  • A comprehensive tech set up
  • $500 one time equipment budget with refreshes
  • $1000 annual continuous learning budget
  • Pretax MetroCard options
  • Zero cost gym reimbursement options
  • Free memberships to ClassPass & CitiBike
  • Access to an FSA
  • 401k with 4% matching
  • 100% covered Medical, Dental & Vision insurance
  • Inclusive Parental leave
  • Flexible work schedule with work-from-home options
  • Twice weekly team lunches
  • A commitment to diversity & inclusion
  • Code of conduct with reporting procedures

items.content:
Head of Marketing

We’re unlocking the value of the spoken word.
Help us tell the world about our magic

Trint solves the pain point of manual transcription by applying AI so users can easily and efficiently extract value from their recordings. Our browser-based platform converts any audio or video to text in just minutes. We’re a productivity platform for collaborative media and content analysis.

Trint’s bold aspirations are focussed on leading innovation and growth in the emerging voice economy and unlocking value from the spoken word. Google’s Digital News Innovation Fund has twice awarded us large grants to further Trint’s innovation in audio/video content management. Trint is reshaping voice-driven value creation by integrating into existing enterprise workflows in big verticals that include media, research and video production.

Customers include: The Associated Press, The New York Times, ESPN, Vice News, The Washington Post, Thomson Reuters, Fox Sports, Der Spiegel, Deutsche Welle, Yale University, Nike and AirBnb.

At Trint we’re proud of the culture we’ve built over the last 4.5 years: we’re passionate about our product; we’re team players; we care about our users. The company is a team of 45: 38 in our London HQ and 7 in our North American sales office in Toronto. We’ve just closed a £3.5M Series A, so we’re well positioned to reach for the sky.

Where do you fit in?
We’re building a Marketing team fueled by inspiration, imagination, grit and a deep understanding of SaaS behaviours. We love that our brand has become a small cult and that we have legions of true Trintlovers, but we know we need to do better to make the most of this enviable position. We’re searching for a marketing leader who can tap into our magical product, our compelling backstory, our really positive culture and a huge market opportunity.

Role
Trint is seeking a Head of Marketing who’s both a “demand-gen” SaaS expert and a master of scale-up brand storytelling. You’ll drive inbound/outbound to directly generate revenue and contribute to sales bookings. You’ll also accelerate our brand adoption by amplifying top-of-funnel acquisition, creating a bond with users over the lifetime of the customer journey. Users love our product and journalists love our story. You’ll own our strategy for building brand profile as we seek to make “Let’s Trint it” part of the lexicon.

You’ll be a key player in our Leadership Team and an important contributor to the company’s overall strategy. You’ll also manage and grow a team of marketing professionals. Most importantly, you’re in a position to craft the marketing discipline at Trint and make it your own!

Responsibilities
CUSTOMER ACQUISITION - Design the overall Demand Generation strategy, including inbound lead acquisition across webinars, websites/SEO, content, SEM/ PPC, social, remarketing, events, email and offline channels
Execute and measure marketing programs across the enterprise buying cycle to generate new inquiries, qualify existing prospects, drive sales meetings and grow the sales pipeline
Accelerate attribution modelling for the non-enterprise ecommerce engine

OUR BRAND - Build a strong brand presence in our markets with effective company and product storytelling; execute earned media, influencer, evangelist and partner campaigns

PRODUCT MARKETING - Oversee our product marketing strategy as we constantly release new features and innovations

TARGET MARKETS - Refine market segments by geo and vertical and target clients that will have the highest yield. Curate a deep understanding of those targets, including their needs, purchase process and how they consume communications to ensure the most effective outreach

CAMPAIGNS - Coordinate with Sales and Customer Success teams to prioritise and develop integrated campaigns, determine best channels for each product/campaign/piece of content

NURTURE - Execute nurture strategies that navigate the customer journey and their digital space for both Enterprise and prosumer customers

TESTING - Conduct A/B tests across channels to continuously optimise campaign and channel performance

LEADERSHIP - Manage marketing operations including the marketing budget, reporting and dashboards to demonstrate ROI
Lead a team of marketing professionals. Provide coaching and accelerate performance and development.

ANALYTICS - Ability to work closely with a data analytics function to storytell internally with data and report to the business how progress is being achieved / challenges overcome

WEBSITE - Manage trint.com, including website development and updates, oversee the design and content of landing pages, integration with CRM and marketing automation. Manage website conversion, testing and optimization initiatives leveraging agencies

Required skills

- 5+ years in a leadership role with experience leading demand generation teams in a SaaS environment
- Experience in building a scale-up brand that transforms a passionate user community into a brand that resonates across target segments
- Strong storytelling and excellent writing skills that shape our messaging and our brand
- Deep experience with marketing automation and data tooling including Hubspot, Mixpanel, Intercom, Google Analytics and others
- Proven experience scaling demand generation programs (e.g. outbound marketing, events, lead nurturing, account based marketing etc.)
- Demonstrated, significant and measurable results (acquisition, CAC, LTV) in previous roles
- Understanding of and experience in executing B2B buyer journeys and developing collateral or assets that advance and accelerate the sales cycle
- Excellent budget experience
- Able to juggle both short and long-term priorities along with daily demands of project management
- Strong emotional EQ helping to inspire, console and generate excitement in your team and across the business
- An understanding of media production workflows for audio, video and text content is a big asset

Benefits:

Share Option Scheme
Team Events & Beer Fridays
A relaxed & sociable office environment
Gym Subsidy
Office Snacks
Flexible working & working from home
Cycle to Work Scheme
In-house Yoga
25 Day Holidays Allowance + Bank Holidays
Critical Illness Cover
Income Protection Insurance
Workplace Pension Scheme
And more to come! We're on the look-out for new and exciting perks that help us on our journey to becoming an employer of choice, so watch this space!

items.content:
Platform Migration Project Manager, Tech Team (Contractor)

MoveOn.org Civic Action and MoveOn.org Political Action

Request for Proposals

Project Title: Platform Migration Project Manager, Tech Team

Proposals accepted on a rolling basis until: Friday, July 5, 2019

Project Description: The MoveOn tech team builds, customizes, and integrates innovative technology that enables staff to lead, participate in, and win campaigns for progressive change. For more than 20 years, the MoveOn family of organizations has used online tools to lower the barriers to participation in our democracy. MoveOn web properties handle millions of hits a month, and MoveOn has terabytes of data that drive ambitious analytics, fundraising, and engagement programs. At MoveOn, making decisions with data is a core part of how all work gets done. Like many nonprofit tech teams, we're a small, scrappy team, wear many hats, and work across the software stack.

The MoveOn tech and petition platform teams are working on a project to migrate our legacy in-house petition system to a new platform. Because of the significant complexity involved in any system migration, we need a project manager to help us keep track of deliverables, dates, tasks, and work sequencing for the tech team.

Request for Proposal: MoveOn is seeking a project manager to embed with and work alongside the 5 person tech team, 3 person analytics team, and 4 person petition platform team. The project manager will create and manage a centralized list of incoming requests and tasks assigned to the tech team, create and manage a calendar of task deadlines, work closely with the CTO and petition platform migration team lead to triage incoming tasks, and notify task owners of upcoming deadlines. Task management will happen in a combination of Asana and Github .

Scope of Work:

  • Familiarize yourself with the current and developing plans for the petition platform migration project

  • Meet weekly with the CTO and petition platform migration team lead to assess and help plan out upcoming work

  • Research and compile information as-needed to ensure all tasks are clearly defined, specific, and implementable

  • Capture technical work to do in a combination of Asana and Github tasks, including task descriptions of what needs to be done, why, how this work fits into the larger migration project, and a definition of “done”.

  • Attend tech team sprint planning meetings to assign out tasks to the tech team

  • Track task sequencing with stakeholders to make sure the right work is being done in the right order

  • Track task completion with the tech team to make sure everyone knows what they should be working on, and that nobody is blocked

  • Work with petition platform migration lead to set up regular team meetings, including preparing agendas and handling all follow up

  • Produce and send out weekly status updates to stakeholders

Total capacity: candidate would have at least 10hrs / week availability from contract start date through the end of August 2019, with a possibility of extension. A Master Services Agreement can be put in place with an hourly rate, hours varying from 10-40 hours a week as candidate is available, and as needs for new project work arise. Candidate should be able to be online for at least 5 hours during US EST during week days, with hours negotiated with the tech team, at least 3 days a week. Invoicing and payment will be twice a month.

Trial period: this consulting position would start with an initial 2 week contract focusing on onboarding and proposing processes for task tracking systems. If both sides are in agreement about candidate and project fit, the contract would be extended through August 2019. At the end of August 2019, another checkpoint will occur, with option to extend the role through the end of 2019.

Organization Overview:

MoveOn is a community of millions of Americans from all walks of life who use innovative technology to lead, participate in, and win campaigns for progressive change and push back against right-wing policies while pursuing economic, racial, and social justice. For more than 20 years, the MoveOn family of organizations has used online tools to lower the barriers to participation in our democracy. MoveOn has a particularly important role to play in the Trump era. We are working to defeat Donald Trump and the GOP in 2020 by building a powerful, multiracial, and economic populist movement that will give voters something to vote for, not just against—and we're also working to defend communities that are on the front lines of Trump and GOP attacks, including immigrants, people of color, the LGBTQ community, and women.  

In preparing for the opportunities and challenges ahead of us in 2018, MoveOn is investing deeply in building and scaling our technology stack.

Budget:

MoveOn will consider all proposals.

Proposal Requirements:

Background : Name, title and contact information of primary contact. A brief description of prior project management work or roles.

Approach :

Please describe:

  • Your strategies for task sequencing, tracking, and management

  • Your strategies for getting up to speed on new projects with many stakeholders

  • Your strategy for working with both technical and nontechnical stakeholders, and working in an all-remote, Slack-centric working environment.

Experience : Proposals should include a description of relevant experience, including seeing projects through to completion.

Schedule and Timeline: Please outline a high level timeline for your availability, broken down into hours / week through the end of August 2019.
 

Cost: Include an estimate for hourly rate and total available hours in your proposal.

Submission: Submit to proposals@moveon.org and put "Platform Migration Project Manager, Tech Team" in the subject line.

Most-Favorable Terms

● MoveOn reserves the right to make an award without further discussion of the proposal submitted. Therefore, the proposal should be submitted initially on the most favorable terms that the vendor could propose. There will be no best-and-final-offer procedure. MoveOn does reserve the right to contact a vendor for clarification of its proposal.

● The vendor should be prepared to accept this request for proposal for incorporation into a contract resulting from this request for proposal. Contract negotiations may incorporate some of or the vendor’s entire proposal. It is understood that the proposal will become a part of the official procurement file on this matter without obligation to MoveOn.

No Obligation to Contract

This request for proposal does not obligate MoveOn to contract for services specified herein.

Rejection of Proposals

MoveOn reserves the right, at its sole discretion, to reject any and all proposals received without penalty and not to issue a contract as a result of this request for proposal.

Nondiscrimination

The vendor will adopt a policy stating that the vendor, in employment, recruitment, selection, compensation, benefits, promotion, demotion, layoff, termination, and all other terms and conditions of employment, will not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, age, sex, national origin, ethnic identity, physical or mental disability, veteran status, marital status, economic status, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected basis.
